Expected somewhat more. Castle overlooking the city of Lisbon. Excellent views, especially on a clear-weather day. Expected somewhat more in the sense of exhibits, historic items/artefacts/etc. Nevertheless worth a visit.
Excellent Views . Well worth a trip up to this castle! Views over the city are amazing. I walked from the city centre rather than taking a packed tram.

It's ok. . Recently visited the Castle, not much offered regarding what your looking at during the time your in the castle, they do provide you with a guide but there's little informative details in it. It turned out to be a walk around the walls. I've been to many superior castles to this one that offered a far better informative experience. It's a nice castle but just ok.
Good views, nothing to see inside. Nice castle for the views but inside is kind of empty. It takes 40 min to visit it, I recommend you to go for the sunset.
Very nice castle!. Very nice castle, not very big, and there is a very nice wallwalk with beautiful sight all over Lisbon!

Interesting castle, great views. I very much enjoyed my day at this castle. The design is interesting and the views of the city are beautiful.We took tram 28 (which was crowded and awkward) to get to the castle and enjoyed walking around the small streets leading up the castle. I suggest packing some snacks or lunch to picnic at the castle. We got some food at the castle cafe and we were very unimpressed. (Inedible, in my opinion) However, it would have been nice to relax a little longer in the castle and overlook the city. We left to get some food nearby, with equally nice views.
Exceptionally in Lisbon: no queue. The most amazing views across this beaufiful city of Lisbon. First place to visit in Lisbon to have a right idea of how Lisbon looks like.

Great views of Lisbon! . The castle of San Jorge is an amazing place! It has an extensive history dating back 2500 years. There is plenty of space to explore the castle and enjoy 360 ° views of Lisbon. Great photographic opportunities to be had here! The only downed was the hordes of people about. Still what can you expect from a mid August sightseeing outing.

Overpriced. I grew up in the Lisbon region and never had to pay to visit. It was, in fact one of my favorite spots. I moved away and now I returned to find that they charge 8,5 € a person. It is absolutely overpriced. There are bigger and more impressive castles in Portugal that cost less to access. With such a price I absolutely think you should skip it.

Amazing vistas!. The castle dominates the Lisbon skyline and is best experienced first thing in the morning before the crowds and heat get too oppressive. The views over the city are amazing and you will take many pictures. The castle itself has stood the test of time well and, compared to castles in the UK, you have unfettered access to so much of the structure.
Not bad. Nice view. Very old castle on top of the city. Easy to reach but too many people there. August is not the right moment to visit it

Superb view over the city and fresh/shadowed spot. Visited the castle with the kids. Tip is to take the free elevators in Rua de Madalena.Very nice view on the city, the Tejo river, the bridge 25 de Abril...Lots of trees bring shadow and cool breeze which is always good when it's warmOld castle, museum, souvenir shop, cafe... All you needThen starting from there, you can discover all the small street of Alfama

Castelo de Sao Jorge. The Castelo fortifications of São Jorge overlooking Lisbon, the smooth paving stones that serve as parterre have seen all : the Visigoths , the Moors, the Christians , the royal family , the detainees and convicts in its history. Go browse ramparts meandering and shady pines courses to have the best views over the red roofs of the city to the river Tagus. Possibility from the city to go to the castle walking but lot of steps before arrival at the castle, it is a good opportunity to take the famous yellow tram No. 28 (and No. 12) that pass near Castle (stop Miradouro Sta. Luzia). tram ticket costs € 7.50. Very easy to find entrance castle .. Worth a visit

Fantastic views of the city with a historic feel.. Worth the trip to the top to access the Castelo; get a tuk-tuk though to the top of the hill as it's quite a climb, and the ride was great fun! Great panorama from the top battlements.

Great view. Spectacular view and a nice museum. Other than that, there was nothing much to see... also,the ticket was quite expensive and although we used Lisboa Card and we were informed that visiting the Castello would be included for free as we used it, the cashier told us that we had only 30% off price (since we payed almost 40€ for 3 days use of the Lisboa card,that was a real bump)..
A solid castle. The castle has tall and strong walls. Unfortunately, the inner buidlings and chambers did not last the force of passing time.
Must see. It's a must visit. It takes a good walk to get there however it's worth it. Very nice view of the entire city. Can't miss it.
impressive castle. enjoyed seeing the history of lisbon/portugal life in a really impressive castle! good prep for the day trip to sintra!!!

fasinatic architecture. If I had to do it again I would go in the afternoon , we went in the morning and it was extremely hot. We had a 6 year old with us and she was extremely tired. the museum is open until 8 pm. For those that have mobility issues the castle is located on the top so lots of waking required. overall is a must see in Lisbon.
Not really a castle . Very nice fortress. Dont expect to visit a castle full accessorized. These are mostly ruins and sidewalls but still something extremly huge and full of story

Has to be done. The castle is so prominent I'm pretty sure most tourists get to see it. This view is reinforced by the number of people walking up plus the buses, taxis and cars. We had an enjoyable three hour walking around pretty much everywhere that we could.

Best view in Lisbon. The Best view i Lisbon, would recommend coming early to avoid the big crowd, tho the castle seems like something taken out from a movie. A must see in Lisbon, you can easily walk up to the castle, take a tram or a tuk-tuk as there is a fairly amount of them going up there.
A proper castle. Incredible views from this 'classic' castle. Kids will love it and the surrounding tree-lined walkways are picturesque and relaxing.

Worth the fee just for the views. Definitely worth the fee just because of the views over Lisbon: you see it all! Then the castle is also worth a walk but, again, the best is to stroll around and enjoy the views.

Beautiful addition to your Lisbon trip. If you like history, culture, and old structures and castles, this place is a must visit. You can't miss it as it lays on a hilltop overlooking the city. Take a tram, tuk tuk, or use your feet to get there. Only 4 euros entree which is quite cheap considering you can walk and chill around as long as you like, with many corners and spots to explore in and around the castle. Beautiful views over the city, and many places in the shadow to hide from the heat and enjoy the breeze. Small cafe in the centre of the square with fairly priced canned sodas and clean toilets.

Great view of the city!. The castle is located on a hill with stunning views of the city, the complex has an outdoor café with panoramic views of the city that serves a decent wine and snacks. In bad weather, you can relax in the beautifully decorated restaurant is located there. Wander through the fortifications of the castle and enjoy views of the city!

Don't expect a typical fort. As this holds only walls as a last resort but no buildings inside this fortress But the view and the gardesn are worth the walk up there. was only at 15 min. walkibg distance from our hotel

Nice castle and beautiful view. The castle is in good shape and offers a really nice view over Lisbon. There is an exhibition about remains of former cultures in Lisbon which is quite informative and interesting.However, I agree that the price is quite high considering what is offered regarding historical background, etc.Somehow I expected a little more. Nevertheless, it is really nice as a starting point to discover Lisbon.
For a great view. As we were in Lisbon, we also paid the Castelo a visit. A pity you have to pay. The view is great of course but the price fell a bit high to us
Great views. Worth the climb or take a tuk tuk and enjoy the amazing views of Lisbon. You can explore, or simply admire the view.
Stunning view of Lisbon . Fantastic view of the whole of Lisbon. No need to pay to go on the other high attraction. This is enough to view it all. 8€ the entrance.

Impressive castle. Well worth a visit, reasonable entry fee and spectacular views. A lovely place to spend a few hours away from the everything. We visited first thing and it was the right choice, because when we came out the queues were pretty long!!

Worth the Walk Up. A very large complex that is easy to navigate and in excellent condition. Fabulous views over the entire city of Lisbon. Nice cafes and antique shops around the castle as well. It wasn't crowded so we could take our time walking through each section.

Spectacular!. We visited Lisbon in February 2016 as a family of 6 with 4 children aged 14 to 3. Castelo Sao Jorge is a must for any trip to Lisbon. Perched at the top of the Alfama district it provides spectacular views over the whole of Lisbon. The castle itself is fascinating, steeped in history with well set out tours. There can be long queues to get in so pick your time carefully. We arrived at about 10.30am and walked straight up to the ticket desk and through, but when we were leaving an hour and a half later there was already a long queue. Bring a good camera.

Nice way to spend a day. We walked up the hill to the castle, a tough walk but definitely worth it. We gained such a feel for this wonderful city, especially with the walk back down through the small alleys.

Not so impressed. My general impression was not so good. It is a medievil castle built in 11th century and the walls are well preserved so that visitors have great view of the city and can take lovely pictures but that is all! The price is 8,5 euros, and there is a discount for students under 25, but my friends and I couldn't get this discount even though we are students under 25 and we had EYCA card and a student card from our country but I guess you need to show the ISIC cart that we didn't had. Anyway, at the entrence you can get free broshures that includes brief history of the castle and most importantly map of the place. The biggest impression for me, beside the view, was the Black chamber with camera obscura that provides 360 degree view of the city in real time. And that is it! You can visit the whole place in an hour (and that includes visiting the black chamber that lasts around 15-20 minutes). If you are coming here only for the view my advice is save your 8.5 euros and visit some other viewing points in the city that are free.

The top of the hill for views - it's worth it . Totally part of any visit to Lisbon. We were expecting a climb and it was a climb. Take your time, or take the tram. We enjoyed the walk up the hill but it might not suit everyone. One great place on the way just under the castle is a piece of ground which has been taken over by artists. Some great pieces and just such a great surprise. The castle is a wonderful viewing point to see the whole of Lisbon. Walk around the ramparts - that's pretty cool.

Amazing castle with great views of city. Well worth the 8.50 euro to walk through this 800 year old castle, some of the best views in the city! A museum inside, easy walk to then get to cathedral. Must visit when in Lisbon.

Amazing castle . What a lovely view from the top. A Bit awkward to get to without a map but the winding streets are nice to walk along anyway. Just follow the crowds to the castle and look for the little castle signs.

Beautifully presented castle . Nestled at the top of Lisbon this castle is worth a visit. There was a queue to get in but it moved really quickly. There is no real detail inside the castle but the layout has been well restored so you can wander around the turrets and ramparts and enjoy great views. There is something very peaceful about wandering through the grounds and I thoroughly enjoyed my visit.

Don't miss. We almost passed on this one, but I am glad we didn't.It is absolutely worth seeing. You can stroll and enjoy all the views, and there's also cafe, wine bar, etc so you can rest after all the walking!
Wonderful. Beautiful views of the city. Lots of interesting history. The whole area around the castle was very interesting.
Nice to see . Nice to see! Briljant view of the city! There are some bars for refreshing drinks and simple food. Not to expensive and the line some times looks very long but it wont take long.
Nice views. Not very interesting castle. . The views are great but you pay €8.50 to see them and a few broken pots in the exhibition. Otherwise the garden is nice.

Interesting history, great views. Cool mostly ruined castle that sits high above the city. It's a great place for pictures looking down over the roofs of Lisbon and the river. It's a bit of a hike up the hill so if the day is hot it might be worth it to get the bus up. Walking down is a lot easier.
Beautiful view. Is a must visit during the stay in Lisbon. The park, the beautiful view of the whole city. Arriving with a Tram 28 is a bonus experience.

Wonderful place. From Rossio square take tram 12, don't bother waiting for tram 28 queues are long and 12 travels to this area. The castle is wonderful, area full of decent eateries, the views are amazing. We walked down thorough Alfama to our hotel, took a wrong turn but ended up near St Apolina train staton so we took the metro to our hotel.

Good viewpoint . Went there in the evening (around 7pm) and spend a little bit more than an hour. The views from the top of castle walls are amazing. But nothing except that, good to seat there during hot hours. Price is 8.5 EUR per person.
Beautiful views. Beautiful views, lovely for a morning of walking. Bit expensive for what it is but worth a visit, even if it's just for the panoramic views!

Great View Nice Castle. Great views, though the castle itself isn't very special. The castle is located on a hill, so take tram 28 and get off them walk the rest. Be careful on the stairs. ticket price is oK. There's also a camera obscura included in the ticket, and the guide explains Lisbon as you see it. It's quite cool, would recommend that part!
not worth the hype. Basically a ruined fort, the panoramic view is not wwoth the entrance fee since one can get same or better views for free anytime one climb uphill.

Great views of the city. Yes, it is a tiring walk up the hill to the castle, especially on a hot day but it's worthwhile. Excellent views of the city. The castle itself is fine but to be honest if you've seen one castle you've pretty much seen them all.

Great views from a great attraction. This was our first activity upon arriving and gave a great sense of Lisbon - both in providing a fantastic view and giving a taste of the city's history. Good to explore for an hour or two.

History. It is a place to visit. Impressive and great views of the city (Lisbon) and other monuments what makes the visit worthy. The castle is a very old monument from almost the beginning of Portugal what says it all.

breath-taking day aventure. I highly recommend this day adventure because just the walk to this castle provides a historic route with amazing historical cobblestone roads and buildings. the walk around the castle alone was an experience. The location provides fantastic views. We were in awe!
Great experience. Nice castle, with very good view to the city. The tickets are not so expensive, worth a visit. It took 2 and a half hours for us.
Disappointing. I was disappointed there was not more to see in the castle itself. The views of Lisbon were incredible. I found the stairs and walls to be tricky to mamouveur.
Great views of Lisbon!. This would have to be the best views of Lisbon and is well worth the entrance fee but don't except much of an internal castle to explore

Nice castel !. This castel is in good shape ! And the romanfic garden is cute and cool compared to the heat of the streets !
I was a little bit disappointed by the inside of the castel but the other parts are worth it ! For those who love panoramas, you will enjoy Lisboa from a great point of view !
Nice view. It's possible to walk around the walls of the castle and have a nice view of the city. Nice visit if you are interested in medieval buildings.

Was ok - best for views and ruins. If you like seeing ruins or want to see a view of the city then this is one of the highest places for this. It is just ruins though and unless I missed it there was nothing really that gave much about the history or anything. You can just walk around the castle and take nice picture of the views. There are other places to get views though.

Do not miss it!. There are several view points of the city and San Jorge Castle is one of the best if not the best. Going up there is in itself a beautiful experience, since is located just beside Barrio Alfama, Lisbon's oldest neighborhood. Explore the area and enjoy the view!

Great view. You can enjoy the view from the castle walls. But you can do the same thing from any other view point around it without paying €8. Otherwise there's not much to see inside the castle. If you've seen some castle in somewhere in Europe, it wouldn't be anything new for you.

On top of Lisbon. The castle is in reality a ruin, what is currently left is the medieval fortress, spanning back to Moorish rule of the area. The castle is in the centre of Lisbon, on an escarpment, while many of its walls extend around the citadel into the city areas that surround it to the east and south.It is is popular pastime trying to catch the tram 28 up the hill, but my advise would be to drop this and walk up - the tram 28 is horrendously packed by tourists going to Alfama during the day - and a walk up enables you to see other quarters of the Alfama area. If you're keen on riding the 28, it's better to take it down from the citadel hill - or maybe take the 12 down which stops on the Praça da Figueira. Depending on where you ascend from, you can squeeze in a visit in the Cathedral The Citadel gives you wonderful and wide spanned views of Lisbon which are wonderful on a sunny day. On a rainy and windy day it is less interesting, as the wind is thrown round the escarpment and the walls of the fortress, which makes the usage of umbrellas moot.There is an entry fee to the uppermost part - be aware that a family ticket can save you money. Once inside you can enjoy the remainder of the castle and fortress. At intervals there is even reenactment of medieval battle techniques by skilled actors - highly recommended - especially for the kids.The views alone justifies a visit, but do enjoy the other benefits as well. If you're looking for some local watering holes on the way down (or up) go for those on the eastern and northern side of the castle, as they in my opinion is a bit less touristy that the ones along the route of the tram 28.

Great castle, great views - don't miss the camera obscura. We took a little bus up the narrow streets. Short queue for 8 euro entry tickets. Great views of Lisbon when you enter. Nice walls to walk around. Nice little café. Best part was the camera obscura 20 minute show which was in English (also in Portuguese and Spanish at other times) - no extra charge but only 20 allowed in at a time.

Interesting. You get to see Lisbon from above and it offers a beautiful view. A lot of souvenir shops and yellow trams on teh way up. There you get to see a camera obscura and a presentation of it...really interesting, but keep in mind you can enter only every 20 or 30 minutes and not all tours are in English

Must see in Lisbon. I always suggest it on the first day of the visit (specially on sunny days), because besides the beautiful view you can have a good idea of the whole city and the distances between the points of interest. Highly recommended to go down the hill walking, a very beautiful pathe through breathtaking views and typical houses.

Great views. Great views of Lisbon. Would recommend to anyone visiting Lisbon. You should just walk up and check out some of the shops asking the way. It is very steep at points so you need to be in decent shape to do it otherwise just jump on a tram. Good price too get in. Not worth paying someone out a tour company to take you there.

Beautiful views from here. We had a view of this castle from our apartment rental and could not pass up the chance to visit. Admission was included in our LisboaCard city pass which allowed us to skip the ticket queue and scan our card at the turnstiles for immediate access (also allows for unlimited travel on the city's metro/bus/tram system). We took the 737 bus from Praça Figueira (first stop) to Castelo (last stop) which leaves you just around the corner from the entrance to the castle. The views from here are absolutely amazing - it's a photographer's dream. I would recommend you wear comfortable and sturdy shoes as some of the grounds may be uneven. Please be mindful of small children as there are sections that do not have railings/safety guards.

Not bad for visiting once for the views. This castle is in ruins so it is mainly the fortress that you see and the view of Lisbon is amazing. The camera obscura had the most annoying wait. After waiting in the quee for over 20 mins we were told that the explanation would be in Spanish and not English. The staff instead of letting us in first allowed people behind us to go inside even without asking us whether we want to attend the Spanish presentation or not. Some people are multi lingual so it would have been been kind if they asked us before sending others behind us inside!

Brilliant views and a fun camera obscura. This was certainly a highlight of our day in the Alfama area. The views from the castle are brilliant. I would recommend wandering up the narrow Alfama streets to get to the castle rather than taking the lift as you get to see the different architecture on that side of Lisbon (as this part of the city escaped the Lisbon earthquake). The camera obscura (no extra charge with ticket) was great fun - although the queues do get really busy!

Beautiful view over entire city. We have climbed the hill by foot and even got lost on the way up - however we have stumbled upon a tourist worker who explained us the way and even gave us a map of the area for free. The caste itself is beautiful, the main benefit of getting there is the most astonishing view over the entire city that you can imagine. After this place, you will not be interested in any other viewpoint in the city...

Went with a stroller and survived. It wasn't too hard, you can take so break, for sure there's some sections that are more intense with the cobbles but if you're well trained it won't be so bad! The visit took is around 2 hours

Stunning views. A historic monument offering awesome, jaw-dropping views of Lisbon. You can see the Christ the King statue from nearby Almeda over the bridge, as well as the majority of the city's skyline.The Castelo also offers plenty of places for shade, giving you respite from the sun and searing heat, as well as a good café offering refreshments and drinks.We really enjoyed our walk around the Castelo, which was cheap to enter and offers a great backdrop for holiday pictures and memories.
The views are great after a bit of a climb. Probably not worth the 8 euro as there is very little to see but a view . A bit of a walk about but that's about it really

A must see!. This is an incredible place to visit. We spent a few hours here going through ever part of the old castle and grounds. They have very interesting artifacts on display. There is a cafe and restaurant, though we did not try either. The views are amazing and defintely a place to take pictures of the city. There is a small charge to enter but well worth it in my opinion.

Beautiful and Magestic. Wow! You can see this from the city plazas. Its majestic. You have to stand in line to buy tickets and get in. Take the 737 yellow small bus to the top from the Rossio town square for 1.80 Euros then walk down and see the rest of museums and churches. It's a long uphill walk if you decide to walk up

A vast sense of what this place used to be. We caught the #25 tram up the hill which was an experience on its own to a fantastic view point. Then a short walk up to the ramparts.The views were fantastic , in places the walls are very low so youngsters need to be kept under control .We came across a pantomime musical band that were hilarious!

Grand architecture. This castle got everything for everyone! It offers an amazing view of Lisbon (even telescopes are available), well-organized museum with guide-material in English and other major languages, a nice restaurant, green gardens with peacocks, a big castle to walk around, and an ingenious 'Camera Obscura', a projecting periscope which allows live-time 360-degree view of Lisbon- with guided tours about it in English, Portuguese and Spanish regularly.

To visit !. On the top of the mountain, the Castel gives an amazing view of Lisbon! The visit takes minimum an hour with a lot to see. I would recommand to go early because there might be a lot of people during the afternoon.It is one of those places to be seen !

Great way to spend an afternoon. My wife and I were staying in a flat near the castle and stopped by very early in our trip. It offers some amazing views of the city as well as lots of history and charm. I thought admission was a touch on the expensive side though.

Lovely views but be careful with kids that like to climb (Walls are high). Great place for kids and family. Queues are long in summer but the ticket kiosk gets people moving very quickly. Once inside its a great place to explore. Just be careful with young kids who like to climb on walls as there are no guards so could be dangerous if not kept under supervision. Few people at the gates trying to flog selfie sticks, pictures and other tourist trap items.

Must see. You see this castle from every place in the city so if your not tempted to go there by that, then what is.Is worth the effort. The walk/metro ride to the castle goes through the narrow streets Lisbon is famous about. From the castle, which is pretty well preserved, you have a great view over the city from various towers.

History with a beautiful view. The walk up and down to the castle is magnificent, old narrow streets and lots of stores and places to it, very colorful and alive. The ruins of the castle are interesting to walk through and offer a magnificent view of Lisbon all around. A must visit!

Nice view. The view from the castle is nice.. it is overlooking Lisbon but the castle itself is a bit dull and empty. Do get some water and snacks with you because all the shops are very expensive; 7 euro for a bottle of water .35l !!

Very impressed . I was very impressed from the castle. The entrance cost 8.5 Europe. You can pay both in credit card and in cash. The view from there is spectacular. For the photographers please pick carefully the time of visit. We were there in the end of July at 18:00 and the light was problematic because of the direct sun. You can climb there on the steps to higher levels and to see more. We spent there 1.5 hours, no need for more. Take into the consideration that the arrival there contains lots of walking.

Beautiful views, interesting attraction. This castle is high atop a hill; therefore, it promises beautiful views of the city below. It is also very interesting historically. The camera obscura presentation is well worth the wait! If you are lucky enough to be in Lisbon during strawberry season, there will be a vendor right outside the gate selling fresh berries to refresh you after your trek up the hill!
Lovely views of city. This was close to our hotel, was reasonably priced and had great views of the city, well worth a visit

Come here only for the view!!!. This tourist attraction which was once free (many years ago) is now a paid area. For 8€ you can see a castle which is in complete ruins and not much to see at all. Apart from the most incredible view of Lisbon and across the river.

Amazing Attraction. This was our favorite view of the city and it was amazing experience being able to walk through an actual castle. We wanted to stay and watch the sunset but were starving so walked down the street to grab some eats. The place is huge so it takes some time to walk through and walk around.

Bigger than you realise.. Really good experience. We took one of the free guided tours in English and I have to say that this made it far more interesting, otherwise I wonder how much I would have taken in.

Worth the walk up. And it is up!!. When you check attractions for Lisbon, there are a! large number of yours, and a lack of memorable attractions. It's not a Paris or Rome. But when you get into the centre it is beautiful, and the walk up to the castelo gardens is worth it. If only for the views of the city as you walk up, and the old style San Francisco trams that pass you on the way.You could get a tour, but just walking about you will take in so much, as long as you don't mind the climb.

Highlight attraction. If you can make the climb the Castle is well worth a visit with impressive walls and covering a much bigger area than we realised. The booklet given with the admission ticket is a little short on the details of the place and their are very few information boards to make the visit more interesting but regardless the Castle is impressive.
Walking . Coil visit, we did not use a tour guide just went on our own..Unless you want a history lesson you don't need a guide..Wear good shoes and it's a lot of steep stairs if you have little ones
Great view of Lisbon. Go for the incredible views! Ruins are ok for a quick walk through. There is no need to see the archeological site and the cobblestone streets surrounding the castle are cute.

The absolute tops ...... ..... of all the things we have done in Lisbon over the last four days. Not just because it's as high as we've been, with panoramic views across the city in all directions. But because it is really well laid out, large enough to entertain and surprise you for a good couple of hours, has a mix of excellent museums, towers, high walls, cafes, peacocks and trees to enjoy, and because it can cope with lots of visitors all at once without feeling oppressively crowded. If the Jeronimos monastery is number 2, as Tripadvisor followers appear to be saying, then for us this really is number 1.

Worth the walk to see this landmark. I kept seeing this beautiful old castle from afar, wherever I was in Lisbon. We walked here all the way from Baixo Chiado and it was quite the hike, so I was expecting rainbows and angels by the time I got here. It was crowded and hot by the time we made the entrance queue. There is a small museum , a nice cafe, beautiful (noisy!) peacocks and, of course, the ruins. The ruins were fully accessable and easy to find rails to help you climb up and down the structures. There were a lit of places to sit and enjoy the beautiful views. It is STEEP and NARROW in some areas, so your knees must be in good shape for the climbing part. I enjoyed it, but I wish I had taken a tuk-tuk here becaue I was tired after the climbing. Still, you shoud go!
Best view on Lisbon. The castel is the best view to embrace all of Lisbon in one sight.very impressive and big, it's a really great visit to do on your first day!

Great city views. This castle is located uphill. Getting there at sunset gives breathtaking views of the city, 25th April bridge and Christo statue in the distance. It is a good hike if you take Tram 28 through Alfama to the top of hill.

Doesn't Really Compare to the Rest of Europe. Visited Castelo de Sao Jorge for only about an hour, as there is not much to see there. The hike is pretty inclined and is difficult in the summer heat. The view is quite nice, but that's about it. There's not a whole lot else to see when you get up there. I believe it was about 8-10 euros for entrance per adult. If you've been to any other big city in Europe (especially Rome), this will be underwhelming for you.
Castle on city top.. It was good for the view around it. Not much to see other than walking around the ramparts...yeah and some peacocks were roaming around and dancing for free!

Not sure what the big deal is. Hola all,I was pretty excited as this was my first official castle visit, but it didn't blow my socks off. We were in and out rather quickly (under half an hour) and there wasn't that much to explore. Hop the train up to Sintra and then you will experience a local castle.

Impressive castle!. The outside image of the castle is impressive and relaxing. A walk inside the castle and related gardens is a good option for a hot day in Lisbon. I was however surprised that only the outside area of the castle is open for visitors plus the walls!

Best view in Lisbon. The castle is great value for only €8 for an adult, considering the view that greets you. You can see over the whole city. The castle is a ruin except for the exterior walls but it's still fun to walk on the castle walls. There is a small museum included in the entry price which has some Roman and moorish artefacts. All in all good for an hour or so.
Great fun. Great experience - really interesting. Although be careful with kids - there are no rails on some of the ramparts!!!

Best views of the city.. Interesting place to visit. Have a stroll around the grounds of the castle and head up to the castle walls to get better views. Have a glass of wine at the restaurant or from the "wine with a view" truck. Definitely worth a visit.

Great view!. Best about Castelo de Sao Jorge is the view over the city and the river! Amazing! Also the restaurant is great but very expencive. To get to the castle you need to climb the hill but there is a elevator to help you part of the way at the cross of Costa do Castelo and Calcada do Marques de Tancos.

True history and some shade. The walk up to the castle is not very difficult, but still the garden shade is welcome. The garden has a good view at the city and a nice breeze. The castle is rather simple, but it has its charm of ancient times.
Great view of Lisbon. This place has much history and it also provides with a great view of Lisbon. It is worth the walk up hill of Alfama

Lovely castle with great views. Takes a while to get there, as it is on one of the highest places in Lisbon. The flip side of this means that there is a great view from atop the castle. This is mainly the reason for going. The castle is not very special and it doesn't have any exhibits. The view makes up for it though.
Kathleen. Amazing views of the city great for photos surrounded by pedestrianised cobble streets with some wonderful cafes and restaurants.
Lovely day in a fascinating place . Worth the hike, which would have been a killer but for the blessed elevator. Great views of the city and river, lots of information in the guide and museum.
Beautiful, romantic and instructive. You can even drink a glass of wine while strolling through the castle... It also holds a cool museum with roman (as well as Iron Age artefacts!)

Amazing views of Lisbon. Interesting part of the history of Lisbon, and of course the views of Lisbon from the castle are incredible, it is a little bit of a hike to get there or you can get a taxi from the taxi rank in Rossio which will take you almost to the front door of the castle!
Old Nice castle. It is a good old castle. An old regent castle With a good story. It Also has a very good view where u Can see all Of Lissabon. They have student discount too.
Worth visiting. Price is too high for a castle, the camera oscura is nice with a good guide. Worth visit of 2 hours. We recommend

Amazing view of Alfama. We got there by coincidence during sunset. The castle is nice especially with the peacocks and the architecture but the most famous I guess is the view of Lisbon and especially the old town. I would recommend you take a a proper camera and dont forget your panoramic view photos as they are memorable.
Worth the climb - terrific views . Spent a nice morning at the Castelo. Went around opening time so there were no crowds. Spent about 2 hours taking in the views, and enjoying a snack at the cafe.

A place to visit.. Very nice place to visit : enjoy the landscape from the top of the hill !
If you like history, you'll like, if not, you still can do a small promenade !

An unmissable attraction!. It's a little tricky to get there (two lifts, both free of charge and some ascent streets) from the Rossio Metro station, but when you get there you'll see why you can't miss this attraction. It offers the best views of Lisbon's old centre until the river and has a castle with towers and corridors that well worth the visit. Take good care of the children as I didn't see many guards at the stairs and towers.

Interesting castle in Lisbon with spectacular views. Take the historical 28 tram to the castle and then explore. A lot fun just taking the tram and then you have the castle to see and then you can walk down winding streets through the neighborhoods, grab a bite to eat, and end up down at the Tagus river. Fun way to spend the day and great views of Lisbon from the castle.
Interesting place!. Very much enjoyed the time I spent at this castle. Great inside and has wonderful views when you venture upwards. Took a lot of wonderful photographs.
Excellent views of Lisbon. The castle had amazing views of Lisbon, probably the best of the city. They also had ruins from the Iron Age. The castle from the medieval times is a must visit in Lisbon.

Well worth it.. On foot it's a bit of an uphill walk but well worth the effort and entry fee.
The views of Lisbon are terrific, lots of photo opportunities.
There is a restuarant within the walls also toilets.

Fantastic Castle . Castelo de St George is amazing. The castle is so well preserved and the architecture was brilliantly constructed! I wish it wasn't so hot otherwise we would have spent more time sightseeing. Warning!!! - getting here is treacherous if you have a baby. It's hard enough going uphill by yourself! Take a taxi or uber. If you have time take a tour when you are at the castle.

Enough to see from afar . It's a pretty big castle and you will need at least 2h to go through the ruins. It's a lot of steps so be ready for a hard workout especially if you go in the middle of the summer. To be honest it wasn't the best location to visit for me. It's quite redondant as you go up and down. I would recommend belem tower or the monastery of jeronimo.

Lisbon watchtower. I would recommend as first Lisbon sightseeing because of it's location, it gives you a geographic impression and has a rich History. Here we understand the relation with the river Tejo.If you are a Lisbon resident, you have yo pay admitance fee. There are several shades if you stroll or hsve to make a break.

Great visit . Beautiful spot. Lots of climbing. This ancient castle is a great place to explore. You can walk around the entire area and climb to the towers. Great views and lots of artists selling wares nearly and inside.

Steve Cockrell. Spectacular view of the city and a nice place to enjoy a packed lunch and just relax or read with a minimum of noise.No way to write the one hundred word minimum so go, relax, have a relaxing time, read a book, just hang out, and ................

Breathtaking views . Exploring the side streets of Lisbon to find your way to the castle...this is worth the trip alone. The atmosphere surrounding the castle when you finally stumble up the steep hills....indescribable! The views of Lisbon and its surrounding areas are phenomenal! Fascinating facts and artefacts. Worth a visit.

THE VIEWS ALONE !!. This castle has beautiful grounds to relax in shady spots on a hot, sunny day after taking photos of Lisbon below. Just the views are worth seeing. I also enjoyed the small museum. Great artifacts on display. This ancient castle and grounds are simply incredible. Watch out for scary heights as you climb to different parts. Fantastic place for all ages.

A must visit and great value for money. Originally built by the Moors of North Africa during their occupation of Portugal in the 1000-1100s this structure is still well intact for the most part and stands on the hill on the east side of Lisbon overlooking the city. The views are simply stunning with a 360 panorama from the highest points. The castle has a restaurant and a lovely cafe in the courtyard which is populated by peacocks. The cafe is very reasonably priced considering the rip prices you pay in some places where there is a captive audience. At 17€ for two adult tickets this is great value for money and an experience you can't get in many places.

Great city views from the castle walls!. Worth the effort of climbing the narrow streets to get to the entrance. An interesting castle to visit with super views out over the city. There is an excellent restaurant in the grounds together with a very good café (watch out for the peacocks which roam free sand try to get the crumbs off of your plate - often before you have finished!!)

Much better than the tower of torres. Castle has the best location ever! Its easily accessable and on your way to the top you will see great streets , shops and restoraunts.
Castle has different towers, a museum and a restoraunt.
Make sure you visit and have at least 3 hours :)
Great view of the city. Good location to visit, make sure you have map to find the entry and exit to and from this place. It's a bit of a maze, but well worth a visit.
More i fo needed. The castle is incredibly situated, and it is definitely worth a story. But where is the story, where is all the information that could make it an experience rather than a sight?

High above the city- Castle of St. George. This is an amazing castle. while I was there, a man was playing Fado music, the music of Portugal. There is no transportation up the hill so be prepared to walk, many, many steps.

Great views. It was busy but there is loads of space. Fantastic panoramas across the city. A good start to a visit to Lisbon. Personally I wouldn't bother with the excavations not much to see unless hyping can get an organised tour.

Must visit the camera obscura. Best view of the city from the camera obscura - essentially a large telescope. You have to queue and wait for a tour in your language, but it's worth it. Best to visit on a weekday
Nice view. Big Place with a lot to see. Nice view over Lisbon. On top of a hill, so big walk, or otherwise using the elevator.

A beautiful castle with great views. The castle was easy to access though the climb through the streets was a bit tiring with the heat. But there was a nice breeze and the views were spectacular. The castle was a nice place to walk through though there were a few spots I rather hadn't crossed with a small child. A nice place, definitely worth visiting for castle fans.

Go early and take your climbing shoes. Beautiful views over the city of Lisbon. You have to climb up some steep, narrow and uneven steps to get the best views, so suggest trainers not flip-flops and if you're unsteady on your feet do your research before going.We really enjoyed it, but get there at opening to enjoy it, as we left which was probably about 10:30, there was a huge queue to get tickets. It's certainly worth the visit.

Tourist must do.... A great place to overlook Lisbon, nice to walk around. But the info map you get sucks and the tours in English is every 80 minutes. So if it already started when you get there is is just overpriced tourist stuff around. Don't regret it but wouldn't go again. Crossed it of the list
Lovely castle ruin. Great place to wander about, beautiful views of the city, lovely gardens. Well worth the admission. Avoid the cafeteria.
Best views of Lisbon. Not only is the castle beautiful, but the views of the city are stunning. If you're looking for the best view of the city, this is your spot.

Nice view. Hard to walk up the hill but you can take T12 to the top.
Nice views, best to go later for beautiful pics, closing at 21 but ok to get there after 19... You'll pay entrance, have a student card, cheaper... Worth to go

Hign up. The castelo is high up from the city cetre close to the Mundial hotel where you can catch the 737 bus right out side or as we did catch a taxi ride up 5 euro its a great ride up with a lot to see Have a walk around the battlements and take in the views Make your way down on foot and stop for a glass of wine good half day trip J

Views are great but it is tough getting there on a hot day!. Very hot the day we walked to the Castle but the views are worth it (I think!!) Lisbon is not the easiest walking city and getting to the Castle is not easy even if you find the 2 lifts but I am glad I made the effort and it was an effort.

Best view in Lisbon. We walked up and that was ok with smaller children (7 and 10 years old). When we finally got there we were greeted with the most fantastic view of Lisbon. Great place to experience the whole city from above and a great view of the bridge and the Jesus statue.The castelo it self is also interesting but nothing compares to the view.Café is ok. Lots of birds trying to have a go at your food.

Expensive. Expensive entry unless you stay all day and look at everything in minute detail. Need a good guide book though as "explanatory" boards etc are simplistic in the extreme. Some nice bars and restaurants inside- but they also expensive, and no access unless you pay to get in in the first place. note- this is not included in the Lisbon card
Excellent view. Must see place in Lisbon. It has great views of the city. Entrance ticket is a bit pricey. Good thing there r is some shadow!
Worth it for the views. Not the most exciting castle but the views were fantastic. And the area around the castle is just lovely to wander around.
Nice views. Tram 28e which can be taken from near baixa chiado station will you take you within 5-10 minutes walk from the castle. Impressive views

Amazing View, Worth Price of Admission. The castle is my number one recommendation for Lisbon. Besides the historical significance, the view alone is worth the price of admission, which I believe was around 8 or 10 euro per adult. The best part of the castle is the walk there. I suggest you just get lost in the old streets on the walk up to the castle. Several outdoor patio spots along the way to stop for a drink or a picture.

A must visit. My second visit to this site. The walk up and back is not that steep and very interesting. The castle itself is well worth the entry fee. The views over the city are breathtaking. Take your time. Sit. Relax. Make sure you explore all the parts of the site. Just be a little careful climbing the stairs as they are narrow, the railings low and some people just bumble along taking no heed. I spent 2 hours here on this visit - my second - and found it time well spent.
Great view of Lisbon. You can spend the whole day here if you wish, it a nice castle on the hill and view of Lisbon is amazing. It cost about 8.90 Euros for a full paying adult.
Great views. Totally worth a visit for the views! The castle was fun to climb, each edge opening a new view.The student price for entrance was just 5€, which we found very acceptableble

Overrated. We left quite dissapointed like most of the people. It is just not worth of 8 eur, of course you have view points, but that's all. There are so many other things to see in Lisbon, wouldn't recommend.

Walked up, took the tram down. The Castelo is a great place to visit. Enjoyed walking through the castle, and especially having the opportunity to learn a bit more about the history. It's surrounded by a really beautiful area. I enjoyed the outside viewpoints a great deal, it really helps you see the overall city and appreciate the vista that this castle enjoyed in its heydey.
Beautiful. It's beautiful but if I can go back to the time, I think I wouldn't go to this place, maybe because I've been to other castles, so it pretty much the same thing... It was okay.

Well worth the money. We visited this late in the afternoon when the tram wasn't working. After a very hot clime up the cobbled streets, we found this attraction well organised and great fun. Views from the top were spectacular, the information booklet came in a wide variety of languages and the 'wine with a view' cart was lovely (although quite pricey). A good couple of hours can be spent wandering and taking photos - super afternoon.
Good views. Worth a visit. It's a good idea to catch the tram as it's quite a walk. Great views from the walls. Difficult underfoot.

Great views + lots of history . Visiting São Jorge Castle is great for 3 reasons: 1. the path to the castle is made of narrow stone streets and alleys that are full of character;2. walking on top of the walls around the castle gives some of the most magnificent views of Lisbon;3. the shops and cafes inside are very nice!

Gorgeous vistas . Don't go for the cattle itself as there is not much to see but the views from the gardens are simply stunning. Several food option on site. Hitch a ride up and let your feet guide you randomly on the way down to discover hidden treasures.
Fantastic views. A very steep climb unless , like us, you use Tram 28 which winds all the way to the top. Not much to see in the castle but the views are worth the journey

Wear your walking shoes. Great site tour, great views of the city all around. Not much discussion or written verbiage on historical significance...very little. Self tour takes about an hour if your really engaged in the surroundings.

Great!. This is a great way to combine Tram 28 and this beautiful castle on the hill.We took a ride with the famous Tram 28 which took us straight to the castle (thete is a brown sign saying that the caste is on the left. That's where you go off the tram and turn left and up the hill).You can have a beautiful view of the Lisbon from the castle.

Enjoyable attraction and excellent viewpoint over the city of Lisbon. Castelo de São Jorge (€8,50) is the fortification grounds overlooking the city of Libson and Tagus River from the strategic hillside location in Alfama district. This is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Lisbon and a place worth visiting, especially during first time visits to the city. The castle grounds are open daily from 9am to 9pm (summer hours). The feature attraction is the 11th century Moorish castle which remains much in tact. You can explore much of the exterior and interior of the castle. Inside, the castle is open and mostly gutted so there isn't much to view. However, you can access the walls in a couple of areas, where you are afforded impressive views of the city. Also worth seeing is the permanent collection of archeological finds which date human habitation of this Castelo de Sao Jorge grounds to at least 7th century B.C. Behind the castle you will find actual archeological sites. Access is limited but you can still get a good look at the grounds. Of particular interest is the Tower of Ulysses, which includes the 16th century optical device that provides 360 degree views of the surrounding city. This particular attraction doe have timed entry and limited visitor restrictions, making it potentially inconvenient to visit if you don't have much time for Castelo de São Jorge. What we probably enjoyed best about our visit was simply the viewpoints which line the hillside of Castelo de São Jorge facing the central areas of Lisbon. These views are outstanding, especially if you have a camera with long lens. You can make out popular attractions and squares like Rosso quite clearly. Overall, Castelo de Sao Jorge is a nice inclusion to a day of sightseeing in the Alfama district. The grounds are family friendly and easy to independently explore. Give yourself 60-90 minutes before continuing onward with other sightseeing intentions in this area of Lisbon.

Special place in my heart. St George's castle is high above the city of Lisbon, and has panoramic views right across the city and river. You can see the statue of Jesus on the opposite river bank, exactly the same as the one in Rio. I've been here several times, and there are almost always musicians playing in the area with trees, and the music is classical mainly, either harps, acoustic guitars or violins.....beautiful, and very fitting for this Moorish castle. Time has lost a lot of the castles finer points, but you can still see that in its heyday, this castle had a thriving population, water systems to cool off in the heat and very much more sophisticated lives than I had previously realised. It's probably because I've now seen many more Moorish buildings since we first came here, but I find places like this really interesting. Lovely places to sit and pace yourself walking around the building, but It's not a place for those who have balance or walking issues, I'm afraid and there is no place to drink or eat. However, there are some outside the castle so that wasn't a problem for us. I have an overall impression of calm when I look back, and I love the atmosphere it evokes, which is greatly helped by the music. Coming from health and safety obsessed England, it strikes me as odd that the stony stairs have no rails to hold, except for pieces of rope at the most difficult stages. However, I mustn't complain: you see, my husband proposed to me here, and told me he wouldn't hold my hand and help me down the rickety steps unless I married him! We had the embarrassment of being applauded and then serenaded by a group of Americans, who became our personal paparazzi! Lovely memories!

Wonderful views!. Wonderful place full if history with so many beautiful views. 20 euros for a family and really worth it. We all enjoyed walking around and discovering breathtaking views at every turn.

Fantastic views but little information. Amazing views of the city but not much information about the actual history of the castle beyond the information leaflet.Nice, if a little pricey, restaurant/bar overlooking the city. In and out within an hour.

The view !!!!. Highly recommend visiting the castle. Not only will you be able to lay your eyes on an important monument, with interesting history, you I'll have the most spectacular view of the city. Great opportunities for photos and lots of shade on even the hottest of days.

Wear flat shoes!. As others have said, the views from here are great, with outlooks over all directions. What isn't mentioned is that the cobbled stones have worn shiny with use and we saw a couple of people slip. So wear flat shoes with rubber soles !Try to visit either early to avoid the crowds, or late for the end of day sun over the city. The castle absorbs hundreds of tourists easily but when we left at 12 the queue was snaking down the hill.On leaving, just wander a while in the back streets around the castle; lovely old buildings and a sense of real living still carrying on. A great way to spend a few hours.
Proper castle. A proper castley castle. "Wine with a view" stall made it even better! Fantastic views across the city and river and bridge
Wonderful view of the city. Just go there to see the most stunning view of Lisbon. Take tram 28 and visit the castle. It is very touristic but worth a visit!

A Great Example of a Former Age......... Looking around this site is a look into a former age and one can imagine what the daily life must have been like in this very well preserved environment.It is a massive site and is in good condition and it is quite easy to walk around and the views of the surrounding area is well worth a visit alone.The site is well managed and there are plenty of shade and rest areas as well as refreshment areas to make your visit an enjoyable experience. Well worth a visit.

Castle Okay/View Spectacular!. The Castle was very nice and very comparable to many other castles in Portugal. The view from up there was the best part. Endless views of red rooftops and the river. Definitely worth a visit.

Great View from above. To go to this place, it's better to take a taxi. We waited for the train/trolley but it took ages. The Castelo has a great view. Be ready to take a lot of pictures while in this place. It takes you back in the olden times while going around this place. This place is a must see.

Lisbon highlight.. Definitely the highlight to Lisbon. Very nice with commanding views of the city and river. Would recommend going in evening as we did, much cooler, less busy and the sun bathes the castle and city in a nice warm glow. Not overly expensive either.

Great views in a relaxed historical environment. Enjoyed a hike up to the castle and a spent a couple of hours wandering around the walls. Beautiful views. Really great spot to get a feel for the city.

Great place to visit. Great place to visit. We got a taxi up to the gate and it was cheap . Great views over city and well done . Castle should put out history where everyone can see it as they have done a great renovation job when you see the before pictures.

A must visit when in Lisbon !. We visited the castle whilst in the city and were pleasantly surprised by the castle, particularly the breathtaking views of the River Tagus and the city of Lisbon from its walls.The castle itself is very well preserved and there is even a museum and a restaurant within its walls . There are also many lovely little bars and restaurants outside its gates . Unfortunately there are lots of steps and many area's of the castle are uneven and would not be suitable for wheelchair bound or infirm visitors.
Historic sight. Worth going for the city and river views. However, castle is largely a ruin, so not as much to see as you might expect. Excellent restaurant, Casa do Leao, within castle walls.

Historic place near city centre. We went here early on the morning which was good since around noon the line to ticket office starts to get really long.There is beutiful view, historic fortress and nice garden to see. If you want to visit the archilogical site notice that they offer tours hourly and you can't go there without the guide. There is no additional charge for the visit but you must joint the tour.
Lovely castello. The castello offers great views of Lisbon city. We had a nive walk around the castle wall. The place is very crowded so do not go up there for a quiet time.

Castle with a great view. This old castle is on one of the 7 hills of Lisbon and serviced by the tram and bus lines. The entry fee was Euro8.50 for an adult. There is not much information about the castle. The views over Lisbon are great, especially from the castle walls.

Beautiful complex. . Castle San Jorge is an extensive complex with great views of Lisbon. Loved the peacocks wondering around and the shady areas surrounded by vegetation. It's a great starting point to visit Alfama, since it's located on the high of a hill and from there you can easily walk down to St. Anthony and the Cathedral. Definitely, a place to visit. You can take the #28 tram or bus near Placa de Commercio up to the top, very easy.

Fantastic Views. The first stop on this visit is the fantastic views from the castle ramparts. Because of the height of the hill it stands on, the views of the city are magnificent. On entering the castle itself, there is not an awful lot to see, as its mostly empty walls & you have to use your imagination as to how it might once have looked. Also, as seems normal in Portugal, there are no signs or information as to what each room is. One highlight has to be the camera obscura. A twenty minute talk about the sights of Lisbon as viewed through the camera in real time. Kids would love the view of 'tiny' people going about their business in the streets below. Also, you might even see a plane coming in to land. Expect to queue for this though, as they can only allow 20 people in at a time. The archaeological site can only be accessed with a guided tour & is mostly inside, so not much to see if you don't take the tour. You can spend a pleasant couple of hours here but don't expect too much.

the castle the view us gorgeous. Stunning views at every turn!!! This is a must do attraction in Lisbon!!If you like to walk i would recommend to walk all the way up to the castle inside the picturesque "bairro de Alfama".

See the red roofs of Lisbon - classic. The castle is certainly a place to go to witness the classic red roof tiles scenes of Lisbon that you must see while in this city. The castle is in good condition, so you can climb its ramparts and towers and soak up its history. I visited when it opened in the morning so it was crowd-free. Ideal time to go.

Worth it!. This is a truly stunning place. We walked there from Placa de comercio. It was a fun walking adventure. Even our 9 year old held up fine. The archaeology exhibit and the grounds are really neat to wander through.

Excellent views of Lisbon, castle risky for kids. 8.50€ Entry for AdultsAmazing views of the city and the walk around the grounds is really nice too. Walking up the castle walls can be a bit iffy and there are some steep drops in places; I wouldn't recommend for young kids or ones that tend to run off!

amazing during sunset.... I visited this at sunset... during the sunset you have an amazing view on the city while the sun is going down.You can enjoy it from the terrace of the restaurant in the Castelo de Sao Jorge.Entrance fee is € 8.5

Disappointing - just a shell and no information on site. We would not recommend this castle . Low walls are dangerous for children and steep steps are not for the less able. Toilets were at the top of a steep flight of steps with no handrail. Not one we would recommend.
What a view! . Don't forget to visit the castle the view us gorgeous!both from and on the way up inside the pitoresc "bairro"!
Its a castel. Yes indeed. A nice one, but still a castle and have you see one you probably seen them all. This is no exception. Its nice of cause but one in a long line in europe

A good way to spend a couple of hours.. The castle in lissabonn is good for a few hours touring the castle grounds as well as enjoying the view from one of lisbons seven miradouro(terraces with great views over the city), which is located here.

Great views. A site we would recommend if only for the views across Lisbon. It takes around 2hrs to walk around the castle grounds and older relics. Nice little café inside grounds with numerous peacocks who if allowed pinch yours food.!!

Stunning views of Lisbon!. A great morning's visit. We travelled by hop on hop off bus. There is quite a steep walk up to the castle on cobbled streets. The ticket office staff are helpfull and speak good English.The visit itself is fantastic. Great views at every turn. Be prepared to climb the walls & battlements for more views!An early start is advised; very busy & quite hot by 11am.Nice bar near the bus stop, with outside tables. Sit, sip & catch your breath while waiting for the bus.
Amazing:). Very beautiful Magnificat area where you can over look the city and the river .. The castle well worth visit and the fee is very cheap..

Beautiful views. The Castle is very well maintained and is situated in one of the most characteristic neighborhoods of Lisbon , where you can have fabulous views over the city of Lisbon. it's worth visiting.
A good place to rest and see the city. After a rather short (but steep) climb, you can rest walking around this castle. The best part is the view (from all ides) as is not a very good shape...

Nice step into history. This is a must do attraction in Lisbon. I loved the architecture, archaeological digs and even the peacocks! I'm uneasy with heights and made myself go up the stair cases to get better views. There was however a VERY long and steep downwards staircase that seemed like a cruel joke. Once I got to the bottom (aft what seemed like forever) there was nothing there but a platform. I mistook it for an exit and was not happy to hike back up... overall though, it's a pretty amazing castle.

Worth it just for the view!. Great place to visit whilst in Lisbon! Castle is amazing and quirky but the view point is just stunning i could have sat there all day!Unfortunately we couldn't find how to get there by transport so we walked there and i do not recommend this! So far and so steep! but once we were there it was definitely worth it.

If you want a view - then ok. . Having been to Obidos, this castle paled in comparison. Other than having a great view of Lisbon's red roofs, the river and the 25 Abril bridge, I found that there was very little else to do and felt that we had wasted the €8.50 entry fee to get in. There was a long queue to purchase the tickets and in almost 39 degree heat, it added to the frustration of being disappointed with the site itself. Perhaps better to go early in the morning or late evening if you really want to walk around. However check the website for timings. The walk up to the castle is hilly and paved with cobblestones that can get quite slippery. There are a tonne of shops selling souvenirs and perhaps the only saving grace of going up here for us was a little shop near the pasteis de nata shop selling magnets based on watercolour paintings which is worth checking out. In hindsight I wish we had skipped this stop altogether, ridden the tram for the experience and spent more time on other tours.

Beautiful Views of the City. Bit of a slog up the hill to find it, but nice as much quieter than the more central streets. Really beautiful views, there's a restaurant as well which looked nice but we didn't try.

Spectacular View and Peace and Quiet. Nestled atop a hill in Lisbon in the St. George Castle. No need for a tour guide, the castle is easy to navigate and take in the incredible views from many different levels. I recommend walking around the outside of the castle to really enjoy the water views before climbing to the upper levels. A place of beauty and calm.

The view is sublime! . Another must see when in Lisbon. The view from the castle is without comparison! The castle it self is fascinating and the history around it incredible. But the view does take the focus above all. The entry is fair priced, there is also student discount.We arrived at the castle a Tuesday in july around noon, but the ticket line was very long. We came back at six, the line had grown very short and acceptable and the amount of people inside the castle were comfortable. I would definitely recommend you, if it fits your schedule, to visit in the late afternoon or evening.

Beautiful Ruins, Great Views From the Top. Great place to visit to see the wonderful views. The ruins and the museum are quite interesting, and obviously steeped in history. I enjoyed my time on the grounds. If you're afraid of heights, it's not a big issue, however there was one bridge that I did not feel comfortable walking across, so I turned around, but felt like I missed nothing. The café provides cool drinks and light snacks for a respite after your trek around the Castelo. This is a must visit!
St George Castle. Worth the trip up the hill for the views of Lisbon. Also very interesting tour of the castle. We took a cab up the hill but managed to walk back down to the Avenida da Liberdade.
Amazing!. Stunning to say the least! Fantastic experience, with great views. Cheap entry, and a nice walk to the castle too. Would highly recommend.

History with a View. The fortress provides a tantalising view of medieval architecture coupled with spectacular views over the city of Lisbon....well worth the climb. Take in the stunning panorama with a glass of wine from Wine with a View.
Must see in Lisbon. Even though the walking route to the Castel is a bit steep, the view, the wine, the nature - it is amazing!

Castle in Lisbon. I visited this Castle in Lisbon October 2015. I used a bus from Praça Da Figueira area to get there as it wasn't far from where I was staying bus was a steep walk. the old cobbled streets and shops were nice to pass by while going to the Castle and with more time permitting and better weather I would of had a look around the surrounding streets. I went in the evening and it was getting a little chilly by then and with hindsight I should have gone a little earlier. It was reasonably priced to get in and the atmosphere of the place was quite nice. One thing I should note is use suitable footwear otherwise you will have trouble getting around the place. The Castle offers stunning views of Lisbon and in good condition. There is a Restaurant and a Cafe there for Food and Drink. though the Restaurant is quite expensive. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Lisbon and would like to go there again preferably in the day time.

Loved it. I read a lot of reviews before I went to the castle saying it was underwhelming. I have to disagree. Ok sure it doesn't have the artefacts and rooms all made up as you would get in many palaces, but personally I don't really like that. It seems much less genuine than going to a castle as it was. It is really rather impressive. The courtyard outside the drawbridge is lovely with great views out over Lisbon, a few canons, and a restaurant or two. Then you can go inside the castle, see the different areas and walk the walls. The walk of the walls is quite great. I felt straight out of Game of Thrones! There are brilliant views over the city and you can really get a feel of the fortifications of the castle. We also did the Camera Obscura tour which was actually brilliant and gave us a good orientation of the city. We went up to the castle around 9.30am and there weren't many visitors there at that point which was a great time to get around without the crowds and heat. I recommend the castle and allow at least 2 hours.

For the best view of the city you have to come up here.. The view over the city is spectacular from here. The walk up through the old streets may be a bit much for some people. However, taxis can get you almost to the entrance for only about 4 Euro from the town center. The entry fee is 8.50 Euro.
Payette at the Castle. We accidentally came across this restaurant whilst visiting the Castle. It is well located with a great view of town and the bridge. We ate fish and it was great.

Stumbling in to a Surpirse. We were walking around the neighborhood when we encountered the back of the museum. We ask the guard and he told us it was open till 9. It was 7pm so we thought what the heck. When we went in the front gate we found a performance happening, a mixture of music, mime and comedy with lots of audience participation. It was charming. Add the back drop of the best view in town and the castle grounds and ruins and you get an unexpected magical evening. There are performances through out the summer and there is a schedule at the castle gate. This is one of the best 360 views in town.

Wonderful castle amazing views. One of my favourite things that we did in Lisbon. We went over lunchtime and it was very hot so in the summer I would recommend going in the morning - the castle is quite exposed. The ruins are worth looking around and they do free guided tours. Be prepared for lots of queues to mount the steep steps on a weekend though!

Great views. We walked up and were rewarded with some amazing views of the city. As you make your way around the grounds yiu get a 360 degree view of Lisbon and there famous red roof tops. The grounds themself have a bit of a ruin feel. Teenagers can safely climb different areas but hold on to the little ones because some areas have no barriers.
Nice view. It gives you nice views. When we were there, there was an archeological site, very difficult to access and not impressive. Avoiding that is recommended.

Peaceful. We walked up to the castle to get a feel of the surrounding area & it was well worth it! The grounds are lovely & there are some great views over the city! Although it was very busy there are plenty of places to sit & relax to enjoy the views in a peaceful environment. Well worth a visit, there are buses to get you there if you don't fancy the steep walk.
Expensive for a few walls. This castle offers nothing more than old walls of the castle combined with breathtaking views.The views are really spectacular.

Really lovely space to visit . This is a lovely ruins set high up on the Alfarma district hill top, it is well looked after and the perfect place to ponder a while and enjoy the extensive views of Lisbon. Highly recommended this is a must see, old Moorish architecture everywhere really lovely!

Incredible views. Take the hop on hop off bus up to the castle otherwise it is an incredibly steep walk. The views an incredible - right across the city. It doesn't take long to walk round so don't plan a whole day there.
Great to exolore. Hard to find due to no signs but once there it's a great place to visit. Stunning views and interesting sights. Be prepared to climb lots of steps!

Nice attraction. Nice attraction, is at the highest of Lisbon. You can get there by tram 28 known from the downtown. Costello's view that all Lisbon and there are many historical artifacts. It is highly recommended.

Think they only finished it the week before!!. Great place to see the city - lovely views, but that's it - if you're looking for history,, bear in mind the place was wrecked in the 1700's earthquake, and it's rebuilding has been recent - not a lot of history left - spend your 8 euros entrance fee on the trams

Great views of the city. Interesting castle remains to wander around. Great views back over the city. There's a nice little deck bar on one side where you can sip your sangria and admire the view - but get in before it closes at 5pm!

Great views of Lisbon area at the top. The castle itself is not that interesting-- not much to see except the old walls. But the views at the top were fantastic! At the very top levels, you can get views in all directions. The entry fee for the basic level is definitely worth the price. But you have to pay more to get to the inner castle, and I'm not sure that was worth it.

"Lisbon's most prominent tourist attraction". Dominating the Lisbon skyline, this ancient Moorish castle is a must destination when strolling the narrow passageways of the Alfama Quarter, with its tiny shops and typical bars and cafes. The castle aslo served as a royal palace to the Portuguese monarchs

Sweeping Views of Lisbon. So much fun! As my friend put it, the castle itself is not much to see, but the views are breathtaking. Plenty of shade in the area as well offering relief from the hot sun. Climb on top of the castle walls/walkway for amazing vistas of the city. Totally worth the walk and tram ride up. Tip: Use your 24 hour 6.50 Euro Metro card to use tram 28 for free to get to the castle location. Big crowds but plenty of room around and in castle site to move around and take great pics. Enjoy the shady areas for relaxation on the castle grounds.

Cool to see. My wife and I stumbled upon it, paid the minimum cost and entered. We took some good pictures of the city and the water and walked around and learned a little about moorish culture and the history of Portugal. I would absolutely recommend it and would note that one could get a lot more out of it if one wanted to. We just liked walking around and old castle.
You have to go. Great overview of lovely Lisbon town and a peaceful place before 10 am....then the tourists hoards arrive!

A must do when visiting Lisbon. My second visit to Lisbon and second to the castle, this time to show my wife. Only spent one day there this time but this was and remains the number one site that I recommend on a Lisbon visit. As noted by others the castle is not super intrinsically interesting beyond being a castle with nice grounds and battlements you can walk along, as can be found with lots of castles elsewhere in this part of Europe, but it is the tremendous views out over the city and river. There is a restaurant in one of the main viewing areas in the castle grounds and of course some outside in the quaint local streets. The other real experience in visiting the Castelo is walking the "neighborhood" to get there and/or back. I suggest walking not taking a cab or bus if ok with hills. You can take the tram up but may have a long wait in tourist season. There are really interesting staircases and narrow streets up the hill from near the main downtown plazas that take you past small cafes and shops, houses with old decorative tiles etc. From the southeast corner of Placo de Figuero, which is one of the main downtown plazas, walk about 100 metres along Rua dos Fanquieres and to your left a staircase leads up to Rua de Madalena and then an arch across the street starts the narrow winding stairs up towards the Castelo. If you do not like the uphill hike too much you can take two elevators to get you much of the way up. The first is located at 170 Rua dos Fanqueiros. Get at out at the floor marked Castelo then go left on Rua de Madalena a short distance and right on Largo Chao do Loureiro (sign posted to both the castle and elevator) to the supermarket and take the elevator to the restaurant. This gives access to the street, turn right and that does not leave that much of a hike up to the castle, which is sign posted along the way.

Great Views over the whole of Lisbon. I need to say at the outset that we live close to a great many very good castles and are spoiled, but we visited two good castles on our Portugal holiday, this one and the Moorish Castle in Sintra. Both were very interesting in their own ways. Castle St George is accessed via a steep hill (its Lisbon and its a castle which is always on top of the biggest hill around), so sorry for stating the obvious! It is very well preserved and is quite large with plenty of levels. Take your time walking to it and around it. There are areas where you can sit and just take in the excellent views across Lisbon, it is worth the entry price just for the views alone. Buy some water on the way up - 50 cents per bottle further from the castle up to 2 euros per bottle just by the entrance. Its hot work getting up there but make the effort, you are burning enough calories to have a good meal and a bottle of wine.

Fantastic views and fantastic history. After a trip on the famous number 28 Tram and a short walk up the hill, we arrived at the Castle. The price to get in was €8.50 each and it was money well spent, the views were breathtaking and the buildings were fascinating.I've seen people on here say it's not worth the €8.50, however I feel this is a bit harsh. True, it's no Edinburgh castle but it's well worth a visit.

one of the must-see attractions. The views over Lisbon are just stunning from here, the way is already worth the visit, because you pass a lot of houses with the beautiful tiling, Lisbon is famous for. The castle is mostly walls you can walk on, but an interesting experience of the past.

Medieval Lisbon. Great place to get a beautiful view over the downtown, and to get to know some of the city's history. Located near the famous neighbourhood of Alfama, you can include it's visit during a tour around Alfama and Sé. I recommend!
