Do you like walls?. This is listed as one of the top local attractions so congratulations, Portugal: your visitors have low expectations! The truth is, it's just walls. There are walls around the perimeter and then inner walls and then the "castle" is walls around a courtyard. If windows, ceilings and floors are your kink, you'll be disappointed. There's one little attempt at a museum in a small room of pottery but I wouldn't be surprised if they broke a few in half to make it seem like more. The one thing it has going for it is the view, which is spectacular. But Lisbon's a hillside town so there are views everywhere without an entrance fee. There are also a couple of peacocks running around that everybody follows and takes pictures of because they'll look much better on their IG page than old walls. If you're short on time in Lisbon, I suggest sitting this site out.

Amazing view!!!!!!. An amazing place, and the best view. The only problem was that the way to get up to the castle was a bit difficult and crowded. But I don't think that matters if you want to see the beauty of the Lisbon.

Stunning views of the city. Stunning position to see more of Lisboa for the photo album. The castle is a large area to stroll around on an easy level. If you want to see more you can climb other parts. The coffee shop and the restaurant is a nice location to sip a drink. I'd take a taxi up and walk down to see more of the city but if in good health walk up or take a tuktuk.

A definite must not to be missed in Lisbon!. Although the castle has been amply restored and modified from the original, and there are only walls rebuilt, it gives a fantastic feeling of bygone days with one of the most beautiful views of Lisbon.Living in Lisbon, not only I take there all my friends visiting the city, but I also go there on my own (actually I did more before they started charging for entries). But do not take me wrong, the price is definitely worth the deal.This is one of the spots not to be missed when you visit Lisbon.And one of the wonderful attractions are the very old and exquisite olive trees along the walls.And a visit with the climb to the top of the main castle building and its towers will leave something missing!

Worth to see, great view of the city!. We took the No 28 tramway to go to the Castelo de Sao Jorge, We where visiting Lisbon
The last week of June not to many tourist at that time of the year and we got great weather.
A must see attraction.
4 days in Lisbon. Great vista's of Lisbon but otherwise disappointing. Expected more than just walls but at least it was cool.
Awesome castle!. I really loved this place. Great views and the castle was amazing. A lot of peacocks roaming around too.

One of my favorit places in lisbon . The castillo is one of my favorit spots in lisbon and best to visit early in the morning. I've already been there a couple of times and always enjoyed the beatiful view over the city. There is always somethimg new to discover. The entrance is about 9 euro for an adult. A visit of the castillo which was originally built by the Moors takes about an hour and is definately worth.

Amazing View of the City. After our walking tour ended near the Castle we decided to make our way tot he Castle, this was absoultly worth it! The views offered form the Castle walls over the city are absolutly stunning. Lisbon is one of the most beautiful cities that I have been to and seeing it in this view was absoultly breathtaking! However it costs around 8 euros or 5 with a student ID to get inside the castle walls, however worth it! A must see for anyone visiting the city

The view!. The castle view is what matters! The view of the city, the bay and the bridges. I believe that it is the first thing someone should do when visiting Lisbon for the first time. During sunset the view and the colours are fantastic! outside the castle entrance there is a bus station, very convenient since it drops you to the city center.

Peaceful & beautiful. This castle offers incredible all-round views of Lisbon & the river. It's a bit of a climb up, but well worth the effort. It's much calmer & more peaceful inside the walls than out in the "hurly-burly" of the tourist traps too. There's no actual castle, just a series of walls & ramparts & gardens - v historic & interesting. Well worth a visit.
Nice to see. We had a quick visit to the castle. It was mot expensive to get into. Not much to see but has lovely views of Downtown Lisbon. We got there by the red tram tour.

Just view of the city. I would like to see medieval stuff in a castle like this one. I guess they should add some attraction points, restore some rooms etc. Currently it is just a point where you enjoy your view however we climbed a lot, paid 8,5 euros and I think it did not worth it.
Beautiful place. Fantastic view of the city and a very exciting castle to visit and spend time relaxing. There is plenty to see and keep you busy

Very pleasant castle, great views, but not much more. This is a very attractive castle, particularly for its very pleasant and relaxing grounds. There are great views over Lisbon. However, there's not much else to see, and little or nothing in the way of visitor information. There's a fine archaeological museum.We arrive reasonably early in the morning on a Saturday, when there was no queue to get in. When we left shortly before lunchtime, there was a considerable queue, so turn up early if you can.

Visit . Worth a visit. If you don't like heights then don't go. If you go visit you may want to get transport as its at the top of a very big hill not good if your not a good walker. Once you have purchased tickets you get a free museum ticket for every 2 adult tickets bought. Not sure about the museum as I didn't go in.

Castle castle . With the tram 28 we got near Castelo de São Jorge. This Moorish style castle built on a hill overlooking the city and the river is impressive. Also inside the castle is a nice restaurant to enjoy a drink. And walking on the castle walls with friends is very nice. The view is perfect for an Instagram or Snapchat moment.
Overhyped and overpriced. You can get the same view from the free miraduoro above. The rest of the area is just castle ruins. Museum closed without advance notice.
Great castle. It's a great place to just wander around. The history is amazing and they include free tours at certain times. Amazing view of the city!

Worth the visit. As a castle enthusiast, I was really exited to see this castle. There are a lot of great photo ops here. The outside and the views of the city from on top of the castle are worth it alone. It would have been neat to be able to explore rooms or dungeons or things like that. You could tell some of the rooms were no longer standing and other rooms were being rebuilt. Overall, it was a great visit. I enjoyed it.

Beautiful Views. Stunning views from the castle, lovely spot to have a glass of wine and enjoy a sunny day.However there wasn't much to the castle itself. It is in ruins, with big vistas around the whole city. There was an exhibition but not on a related topic.

It is all about the view. Mind your step!Serious, you could easily twist your ankle or have a fall on the rough and uneven pavement.An old castle with access to the outside walls and the courtyard.Nothing special, the view over Lisbon is the better part.

Lovely views. The views over the city from the castle are amazing. We wandered around the castle and the ruins for a few hours. There is a restaurant which we didnt use but the cafe has a good selection of food and drink and there are plenty of seats outside and around the walls to sit and enjoy your snacks. Overall i thought it was good value for money.

Historical must. Loved the history of this place, how the king and queen once lived there and how it was destroyed. Get a guided tour as then you will appreciate the value of a castle like this, mainly ruins, but with your imagination and the tour guide you can be transported back to the times and place where Portugal and Lisbon ruined the world.
Worth for the view - but too expensive to get in!. few toillets, no water fountain, it's worth it for the view. The restaurants are expensive and there is no signs nor explanations.

The maze to nowhere - not worth it!. From the outside, it looks like it's going to be a cool place to see but it turns out, there's very little to see. There's endless paths to nowhere. The worst was the giant staircase of death where you'd think it leads to something worthwhile to see but takes you to a dead end after all that huffing and puffing, leaving you pissed off that now you have climb up all those friggin' stairs for absolutely nothing! The views are good but you can get better views for free at Miradouro de Sao Pedro de Alcantara instead of paying 9 euros for a worthless castle.

Amazing Views. Well worth the trip for the beautiful views. The castle itself was as you would expect, and the gardens were small but pretty. Wish there was more - but for €5 for students I'd go again just to sit by the walls and watch the city.

Nice view. The castle has a few beautiful points of view. We spent there more than 1hour walking and taking pictures. You can go up and look at the city from the walls. The only reason to go there is the sight over the city.
Firearm demonstrations. We were lucky enough to visit on a Sunday, when several characters were dressed in medieval garb, demonstration black powder guns and canons. It was quite a show!

Castle area to enjoy.. We spent a full morning walking around the castle area which has great little streets and quaint shops and bars and restaurants. Full of atmosphere with great views over the splendid city of Lisbon.

Great place when you get there. We decided to walk up to the castle and found it quite tiring and frustrating so I suggest taking the tram and walking down. Once there it's well organised and the views are spectacular. There's a self service cafe and a smarter restaurant on site and other small bars and eateries in the surrounding streets.

Verging on 3.5 perhaps. A sort of have to, but maybe not as it turns out.. There are many activities one can partake in that are well in advance of a visit to this Castelo. Getting there is pretty cool, whether walking the narrow streets through Alfama, jumping on a tram and being freaked out by how insanely steep and narrow the track is, or going on a tuk tuk type tour.We elected to catch a tram (28) and were dropped at the Miradouro da Graca. From here we checked out the views which were quite stunning prior to paying to use a public toilet (novel) then asking a local street seller for directions to the Castelo. Mistake! I tapped this gentleman on the shoulder asking for directions, and with that he broke into a massive diatribe about the area, how to get to places and then gave both myself and my wife a free bracelet. He said, take them, they're free! Sure... as we walked off he asked how much I was willing to pay for the information he gave me. And there was no way he was going to leave it at. He wanted to be paid.Point! Don't ask a person selling cheap rubbish (selfie stick, sun glasses etc) anything!Anyway, then we wended out way up to the Castelo where we paid for our 8.5 Euro tickets, and proceeded to the main forecourt. My immediate thought was WOW! But this really is where the wow ended. The forecourt and the views from the Castelo are very nice, however the Castelo itself is very forgetful with limited goings on and very little to look at.

The owner of the city. I love this place with my soul, I believe there is a kind of historical magic there - and I knew it a long time ago, when it had a lake (like a castle's moat) with swans. Now, the lake disappeared, there is grass and sand, with peacocks. And It is a very known and visited place, to explore the ruins and the marvelous views of the city. I still love it and I return every travel to see how the place is. I believe it is a little bit "fake", because it was lost, as a castle, explored longtime like a militar and bureaucratic place, and suddenly (salazarism?) one decided to change the mass into touristic attraction. So, there aren't many things to see (rooms, exhibitions, relevant information). But it doesn't matter - I will love it forever, as it was a true slice of History.
Fantastic views over Lisbon.. Well worth the walk up- or take the tram or a tuk tuk . for breathtaking views over lisbon. Relax in the cafe within.

Nice but needs more stuff.... I love castles. This one is beautiful, but lacks features: historical information, rooms to visit, restored or reconstructed buildings, etc. You only get walls, towers, and great views. It's nice, but I would have liked more. I'm not saying I want to talk to actors dressed in fancy clothes, but more that just stony walls. I was a bit disappointed, but nonetheless, it was worth the hike (and the entrance fee). I mean, you're in Lisbon, you need to see Lisbon from the top!

Stunning views! . I personally found this a little tricky to actually locate, the entrance that is. Once I did I felt like an absolute idiot for it, so if you are in the same boat as me, do not give in! The views are INCREDIBLE! It's €8 I believe, late June was when I visited so the weather was perfect for pictures! The castle itself was a tan underwhelming, and I personally am not a fan of narrow stairs with flimsy metal railings, so not for me! But the views, just incredible!!
Nice view on Lisbon . The panoramic view from the Castel is very nice. The Castel himself isn't special. So if you can take a panoramic view around, it's enough
Worth the walk. The romantic garden really did it for me. Amazing view over Lisbon aswell. Castle itself is not really worth it. The peacocks were a nice addition.

A must see while in Lisbon.. Wonderful place to spend an hour or two, relaxing, beautiful views of the city while feeling like you are doing your touristy thing. It is within the city so no excuse not to go. Great small restaurants and wine bars nearby. Goof photo ops. Enjoy.

Great Views. This was our first stop in Lisbon and it didn't disappoint. The views of the seven hills of Lisbon from the Castle are amazing, the peacocks at the restaurant fun to watch and the structures are beautiful. A must see.

Great view. We walked from hotel fenix 40min and loved the view from the castle. We went at about 12pm and didn't wait long for tickets. Worth a wander and great exercise with the hills and stairs (if mobility a concern, get a taxi there and don't climb on top of the castle, good views are available on the paved grounds of the castle too). Wear good shoes, the grounds are paved with the typical mosaic style tiles which can be bumpy and uneven if you don't look where you are going. There are drinks and market stalls at the top. Toilets are in the gift shop FYI

Worth the climb. Up on the top of Lisbon with great views of the whole city. Interesting place which tells a little of the history of Lisbon when Portugal was one of the mightiest country in the world.

Must See in Lisbon. Although this is one of the most popular sights in Lisbon (read crowded), it is worth seeing. This Moorish castle dates back to the 10th century, although the history of the hilltop go back to the second century BCE. The structure itself is jaw-dropping as are the views overlooking Lisbon. Prepare to spend at least two hours as there is a lot to absorb, historically...and be sure to take the time to savor the million-dollar views from the top.

A wonderful historic attraction. We all really enjoyed this attraction. It has a rich history and features beautiful views of the city and river. There is only a smallish museum with artefacts from previous centuries, and a basic map of the castle grounds. The ground is very uneven and you will do a lot of walking, do wear sensible shoes!
Pretty castle in the center of Lisbon. It's definitely worth spending a few hours seeing this castle, the atmosphere is relaxed, there are many places you can admire the views over the city,

Castle with spectacular views. Spectacular views over the city and down to the river from this historic castle, where you can walk the ramparts. There are a number of gardens and walkways within the walls. Interesting, but steep walk up from Baixa via the Se cathedral. Good value for Euro 8.50.

Castel playtime - sunset. Great place to explore and let your inner knight or princess out! Wine with a view - what a great idea and lovely woman tending the wine cart - sunset views are excellent from this location.

Beautiful . The castle was just beautiful . The scenic Lisbon you see if just amazing and there is lots to see. Whether you are with friends or family it has something for everyone too see.
It's great to see history set in an old but new backdrop. The views are amazing
Fabulous Views over Lisbon. Worth a visit €8.50 for an adult, make sure you ask for a senior rate if over 65, brings the cost down to €5.00. The views all over the city are tremendous.

Great Castle!!!. We have been to many European castles over the years and as that goes this one is very well maintained. Fantastic views of the city from all angles and many picture taking opportunities. You can walk along the upper areas of the castle walls which are very narrow but afford you fantastic views (careful with small children). The only complaint is with the ticket prices for families as you MUST have 2 children to get the cheapest price. We have only one child and were 'penalized' and extra 2.50 Euros for this. This is the second tourist location in Lisbon were this happened and I think the management of these sites needs to think about that and price it for families the same whether you have 1 or 2 children. In fact the ticket sales person agreed with us and said that they mention this all the time to management but nothing changes. Maybe if more people write this is their reviews things will change....

Pretty nice castle ruins. The views from the top of the Castelo are great you can see a long way. It's fun to walk along the top of the Medievil walls up and down the stairs, and explore. However it would be very nice if they would have some Placher it's with explanations of what was happening at the castle in those days. Won't learn much here but you will have some nice views. The walk up and down the hill is pretty nice as well.
Fabulous . We really enjoyed walking around this castle for about three hours. The guided tour of the archaeological section was informative as the the Camera Obscura.
Castel. Great monument of culture and history, a great example of the country's heritage. The views are just amazing...

Great place to have a drink. We love castles. That said, this one is mildly interesting as a castle. However, the best feature of the place is a restaurant with outdoor seating along the parapet. tress offer shade, height allows for a nice breeze, and the views are wonderful. Stop and get a drink. Relax.

Living history. Great place. We spent some hours with kids of 7 and 9 and really took in the architecture of the place combined with stories of visigoths and the Moors. Walking the walls and exploring the towers. Great views of Lisbon. Be sure to start early when they open and have the place almost to yourselves. Around lunchtime the place is packed and the line to the ticket office goes on and on.

Great visit despite rain. The view from here is wonderful. We walked up to the castle from our hotel (Mundial - great location) and boy it was quite a climb, lots of steps but it was worth it.Very high winds when we were there so they closed the tower - enjoyed the visit
Best views. More then the Castello itself this place offers the best views of the city! Well worth going up the hill.

Great Castle. When I think of "castle" the image that pops in my head is this castle though this is the first time I have been to such a castle. Great views of the city. Charming shops and restaraunts around the castle. Good walk.
Outstanding. Very beautiful. Well worth the walk up. We visited in the early evening so the views were spectacular. It is a very peaceful place and I would highly recommend a trip

Do not miss this. We got the 37 bus to the top and went up a short walk to entrance It is excellent and the ticket gives entrance to the museum and the grounds there are lots of steps if you want to go around the walls and the views are fantastic If you walk to the road you can ride the lovely old tram to the city again

Periscope over the city! . Really cool to see the life the soldiers YSS to have and see the city through a periscope! Very nice views too from the whole castle and its grounds. Don't forget your student card for discount!

A piece of history. If you are only in Portugal for a short time, I recommend you visit this moorish castle. It costs about $18 to get in, but the view is spectacular and so are the artifacts.I would recommend, if you have a bit more time, to take the train/bus out to Sintra and explore the Moorish castle there. Be ready for some steep climbing to reach both, they are located at the top of the hill to protect the city. I suggest you can it up, and walk down.

The most amazing view of Lisbon!. This is my 4th. visit to the castle. The views of the city are fantastic.Also the castle is full of history.Don't go to Lisbon without going to the castle!Take a bottle of wine with you and sit and enjoy the views!!

Great views - really interesting history! . We did a tour of the Alfalma with Lisbon Explorer that started at the castle. The history of Lisbon and how it played a part in world history was fascinating. The castle itself doesn't have a lot to see, but with a guide telling you the history it really is worth a stop for the views alone. Just a note - we hauled up a lot of steep streets to get there and if you do your research there are elevators that will get you up to the castle. I loved the views from the castle most of all!

Interesting. Worth a visit. Be sure to go to the escape tower and save enough energy for the trip back up. Great views of the city and a fun walk up to the castle. On the way down get lost in the Alfama.

Caste de Sao Jorge- worth a visit. We really enjoyed our visit to the castle and would return, taking more time to explore the area surrounding the castle, including shops and restaurants. The views from the ramparts are spectacular. We also enjoyed lunch outside the museum. The peacocks were a special bonus.

A hidden gem . I am so glad that I happened to pick this hotel. It made all the difference in my trip to Lisbon. In a city that gets over crowded with throngs of tourists, this hotel is a welcome respite. The service was excellent and the hotel as a whole was impeccable. As for the walk, I welcomed it after every day of indulging in meal after lovely meal :)

Okay, if you have the time. Not particularly interesting. No self-guided tours were readily available and didn't even get any kind of brochure. Lots of large courtyards that all started to look the same. However, there were great views of the city from all angles from the towers. You need to be prepared to climb some steep stairs and some are a bit scary since there is a small rail on one side only. If you are infirm or elderly, skip this castle. You can get views of Lisbon at other sites around town.

Exceptionnal panorama view!!. You should really make the effort to go there. The castello can be joinded by different means. One of them is to go by elevators from the old Baixa (ask for the way at local people or at your hotel desk). It certainly offers you the very best view on Lisboa. Overwhelming. Only weak point: the camera obscura. Lot's of people. Difficult to localize (in fact at level +1 at the south western corner) We did not stay for 1 hour. Leave it. We preferred to turn quietly around and have a nice overview. Stalk down to the old center and enjoy. So many nice streets and corners.

Best views of the city. . The view of the city is amazing!!! It sits on top of a hill in alfama and affords a 360degree panoramic view of Lisbon. The castle itself is nice but there is no palace or buildings to tour. There is an archeological dig site inside but it was off limits to the public while we were there. It is definitely worth a visit for the views alone.

Wine with a view . Visited here whilst on city break, lovely quaint "traditional" streets to approach and surrounding castle. Great views from all sides of castle but not for those with fear of heights or restricted mobility. There is a indoor display of pottery etc which we found by chance as it did not seem well sign posted and this exits via the gift shop, also additional toilets in this part which were deserted unlike the long queues for the central underground toilets. Again not well sign posted. Took advantage of the wine with a view drinks cart which includes souvenir glass, this was good value and refreshing whilst looking down on the city. Spent a few hours looking around which for admittance prices was we thought good value for money. There are escorted tours around the older ruins but we did not take advantage of this. An enjoyable morning.
Amazing!. A great experience to see (almost) whole Lisbon from above... Very nice castle with facilities and marvelous landscape.

Great Views we stayed nearby worth a walk. Watch the battlements when its windy but views are stunning you walk round and see all of centre of Lisbon or Downtown as they call it - brill nice cafes nearby and lift down to lower streets

early morning venture. My daughters and I got up early in the morning, took the tram, walked through some beautiful graffiti, had coffee and croissant outside the walls and were first to enter the Castle. Wow, beautiful from every angle. We climbed every stair, went down every passage and took photos of every corner, view, wall and peacock. Yes, beautiful peacocks that fanned their tails to show their beauty.
Amazing Moorish Castle. A most impressive Castle with a moat, with easy access walls and towers. Unusual and extensive as it was also a royal palace. Several peacocks also roaming around.

Some of it was shut shame really. We went to use the camera obscurer only to find out that it wasA: very difficult to locateB: closed for no apparent reasonDon't expect National Trust style standard the building is amazing the user interaction less soInteresting but not necessarily worth the entrance fee. Know that it is at the top of one serious incline. This is Lisbon, everything is on a serious incline. Not recommended for the disabled or those with no stamina.

Nice castle. Once you are at the castle (definetly take a ride with the tram) u can enjoy a great view over the whole city. There are also some peacock running around. You can run around the castle and have a look over the city. Its a nice throwback into the past of lissabon
Must see landmark & view of Lisboa . One of the best views of Lisboa. You will be able to pinpoint all our landmarks from the top.Castle surroundings, landscape, facilities clean and pleasant.
Visit the castle and the projection room. Nice castle with good views. There is a projection room with powerful camera that can zoom in on spots around the city - this was the highlight for us.
Afternoon Lisboa. You definitely pay for a view of the city Lisboa. The castle isn't that exciting. So worth the visit but quite expensive for what you get

Interesting Castle with great views of Lisbon. Good place to get a good view of the city. Some of the archeology on display but great battlements to scamper across. Charge to get in small Resturant and cafe inside

Worth it for the view. The castle is large and in our opinion over-restored...but I guess that is inevitable because it was more or less rubble which had to be rebuilt. Even so, it is an essential visit. Tip: take Tram 12 the Castle Circular it is much less busy than the tourist-famous No 28.

Great views after a big climb!. We opted to take the stairs up to this castle. There are other options (tram, tuk tuk, taxi, etc) but we enjoyed the walk. The views of Lisbon are great. A full 360 if you walk around the castle grounds. Not much inside but do find the "Wine with a View" stand and sample the Vino Verde (sparkling) and meet Teresa, one of the nicest women in Lisbon! There are several small touristy shops and restaurants just outside the castle and the cost is very reasonable for such spectacular views!
Very interesting. This castle is a the very top of the hill in the Alfama area so getting there on foot is part of the attraction. Spend time walking around ramparts and towers

If walls could talk........ I enjoyed our visit to Castelo de Sao Jorge and enjoy this type of historical site. You can walk through the ruins, touch the walls, sit in the court yards, see amazing views of Lisbon and the Rio Tejo Tagus (Tagus River), The castle was started in the mid-11th century by the Moors, became home to the first king of Portugal and others, and then became a military fortress. So you understand why I wish walls could talk. Be sure to climb up the towers, visit the "Romantic" Garden...(we had lunch at the Casa de Leao Resturant in the garden area). Check out the Permanent Exhibition too.

Great views of Lisbon. Take a 28 Tram up if you can or go by the sight seeing tour Gray tours green route and a short walk. There is also a bus but you should get the feel of the narrow streets and atmosphere of the old town. Site covers iron age to the Lisbon Earthquake

Worth the effort. Three ways to get up to this ancient castle/fort. The trolly (for thrills), walking (for the hardy), cabs--inexpensive and quick. There is nothing left but the walls, but climbing them gives you great views of the city. It was hot the day we were there, so fortunately we found a food truck offering good gelato.
Peaceful castle and grounds. . Peaceful, beautiful grounds. This is a great experience. The walk up earns you a stop at the wine bar on the way back down.
Beautiful in the morning . Great views, and a wonderful place to visit. Highly recommend it. We went around 9:30am and there was very few people there and got some really amazing photos

Great views. The castle offers great view over the city. Take tram 28 then bus 737 for easier access, it can be a bit tiresome to climb in 30 degrees.It is a nice walk on the walls with 360 degrees view of Lisabon.

Nice view, not much of a castle. The view from the castle includes the city panorama. It also has a great landscape with gardens. The castle though is not very spectacular. You can climb the walls and see the courtyard but that's about it.

Beautiful . Beautiful castle Wish there was more explanation of things as you walk through...a blurb about the history of the place. Only thing with info was the pamphlet you get when you buy tickets. Map isn't clear though
Nice but simple. Nice and well conserved castle, with slightly expensive entrance. Apart from very well conserved walls and amazing views on the city, nothing to visit within the castle.

It ok for a castle. Lots of history but not much to see other than the walls and great views of Lisbon. The walls can be climbed and walked on but not much else to see here. I suppose it's worth visiting but if you don't - you aren't missing much.

Great views. While the castle walls were rebuilt in the early 1900s, the view from this area looking down over the city is worth seeing. There are peacocks in the grounds, and lovely narrow streets in Santa Cruz to the left of the exit. The castle itself is just a series of walls, unless I missed something ! We didn't try the restaurant in the castle, but had lunch in 28 Cafe on Rue de Santa Cruz.. The interior is set out like an old tram, with a few small tables outside. The soup was delicious and good value.

Must see. This is a must see for a trip to Lisbon. You get a breathtaking view of the city and the river. Just take the trolley up to the top of the Alfama, enjoy the view from the lookout there, and then follow the signs up the rest of the way to the castle. Not an easy walk so not recommended for people with mobility problems. There are peacocks wandering around the castle grounds and a nice café where you can get a cold drink, fresh fruit, etc. It is open from 9am to 9pm and the sunsets are spectacular from there!
Worth the price of admission. Fabulous city views from the parklike area just inside the turnstile. The grounds were the best part, although a walk through the castle is worthwhile.
Wow. What a view! So much history to be seen and heard. Beautiful fortress to walk around and did I tell you that the view is amazing? Well, it simply is!

Amazing. Just go there and enjoy the weather the place the green ,u need in the castle around 1 hr not more , it's nice to go by tuck tuck 5 euros per pers or even u can use the bus 5 euros all the days on and off , then enjoy the downtown and have traditional lunch or Sardinia

Great Castle. We did this as part of the hop on off bus trip, you can get a free tuk tuk to take you up to the castle then we hailed a cab to take us back to our hotel. Lovely views over the red rooftops of Lisbon and we had the added bonus of some guitarists practicing for a concert so we sat a while and listened very nice
some parts closed for works. The archeological site and camera obscura are now closed. There is plenty of space to sit around and relax. They have 50% student discount

Totally enchanting castle. . This place would have been gorgeous in its heyday. The view from the walls is stunning and it would have had so many fountains going. The peacocks make sure you know they are there (very cute). It was a bit confusing trying to find the entrance once I got off the trolley car. Luckily a policeman was around so I asked him. It needs better signage I think. I actually walked back down to Baixa which was quite easy to do. I wouldn't even attempt to walk up to the castle though! It costs 8.50 euros to get in and cards are accepted. Lots of places to eat and drink around you are spoilt for choice.

Lovely views and atmosphere. Some incredible views of Lisbon from the Castelo. We brought a picnic and ate this in the sunshine overlooking the city. The peacocks are very entertaining (I had no idea they could fly!). Well worth a trek up the hill.

Must see. Was such an interesting Castle, we went to the "camera Obscura" it is an optical system of lenses and mirrors, provides a 360 degree detailed views of the city in real time, good guide pointing out all the sites, well worth seeing. We also bought a glass of wine from stall "wine with a view" The whole outing was excellent.
Good value site. This is a very popular site and it's very easy to spend along time wandering about. The views over the city are excellent.

Steeped in history. Wonderful example of Portugal's past and steeped in history.
Great view of the city and a pleasant site to meander through.

Great view! Funny peacocks.. When we were staying in Lisbon, we opted to take a long walk up to the castle from Principe Real (about 30-40 minutes). Unfortunately it was raining pretty hard, but it was still a beautiful walk as we passed through many beautiful neighborhoods and other landmarks. When we arrived, I found the ticket prices a bit high, but after going inside, I found the price to be worth it - the castle definitely beat my expectations. You get a panoramic view of the city and even on a cloudy/rainy day, this was very impressive. The architecture and history of the castle was very interesting to me as well. It was a lot of fun climbing the different towers and exploring each section of the castle. The highlight for me though was seeing so many peacocks in one place. They are very boisterous and entertaining to watch. Definitely wear comfortable and non-slip shoes here as there are many steps to climb (if you want to explore that area). I felt very bad for one woman who was wearing ankle booties with a high heel.

Fabulous views and rampart walks. This is the most significant landmark in Lisbon and provides the second highest miradouros.It is readily accessible by foot and the views are breath taking and the trees provide ample shade

Don't Queue, take a tuk tuk.. The queue on a Sunday for the tram was horrendous so for 10 euros we took a fantastic tuk tuk ride and got a commentary thrown in free. The Castle itself and the views are great and should not be missed if visiting Lisbon. Historical, well looked after a good tourist attraction.
Loved the castle!!. There are better castles in Sintra but Sao Jorge was a nice visit. It has beautiful views of the Lisbon city.

Panoramic views. It is worth a visit just for the fabulous views of Lisbon. Castle is interesting to wander around and there is a guide in several languages. Also the ticket gives free entry and offers to other sites. Queues are long to enter but once inside it is not over crowded. Steep walk up to the castle but you can catch the tram, taxi or Tuk Tuk. Well worth a visit.
Worth a visit for the views. Nice place to wander around and absorb the views. You can have a drink in the shade of the trees or wander the battlements.

Fun - but not that great. We went to the castle and enjoyed walking around and looking at the views. It's not as much fun because there was no diagram to really show what we were looking at. We had a lovey day and the views are definitely worth it - but the castle itself is not that interesting.Plus I am afraid of heights so walking along the narrow ledges of the castle walls made me really nervous.

Views and History. As castles go, this one was underwhelming for me, even though it's from the medieval era, one of my favorites eras! It is just a ruin--a shell- of its former self. But, since it was built by the Moors in the mid-11th century, I found its architecture intriguing. The stone on the ground and in the walls carries a history and draws you in---if you are so inclined. This was a residence for the elite and royalty once, after Lisbon was conquered in 1147, even though it seems its main purpose was for protection. It was once very active as a palace and residence, though, complete with coronations, through the 14th, 15th and 16th centuries, after which it was fortified for defense. In the 19th Century, after it had been previously ravaged by an earthquake, it then became a military barracks. Much of the original structure had been built over. Still, it's pretty amazing to see such antiquity still existing, even if only bits and pieces of it!The walk up the winding cobblestone road is interesting in that there is lots of old architecture to see. I love old cities! Old stones, old cities, old bones….they have a texture and history that I find soulfully interesting. Some of the quarters closer to the castle were once residences of the elite, apparently. It can be a challenging walk, so you can get a taxi or Uber to the top if you want. Uber works well here! They also have a Tramcar (#12, #28) that will get you almost there. Once inside, there are lots of shade trees to shelter you from the strong sun, and places to take good photos and/or sit and relax while enjoying the view of the city and bay. I didn't take the tour. It just didn't seem that interesting. The grounds are quite large, and you can occupy yourself here easily for a solid couple of hours or more. You can walk inside a part of the castle to see artifacts in glass cases that have been retrieved from the archaeological site. Inside this exhibition building was beautiful, as it’s the old structure. Down some ancient staircases, around the bend and through a door, lead the way to the clean and well-maintained toilets.We climbed to the top of the ruins along one of the fortress walls, and the view was even more spectacular! Actually, it's very high up and a steep stairway at one point, and since I have this little issue with heights at a certain level, I didn't go quite to the very tippy top! It's still a great view from where I was though. There are a few towers you can explore, and we didn’t actually get to all of them! After walking around the sprawling grounds and ruins for a couple of hours in the heat, we were ready to relax and have a cold drink. Always carry bottled water with you, however, because it does get very hot here. The cafe is casual and good with outside picnic tables under huge shade trees. We had wine with our sandwich and yummy pastries while a Peacock perched and posed for photos right next to us! Of course, he/she wanted a little snack too. I'd keep that simple though, such as a tiny piece of break or crust, because I'm sure it's not too healthy for them. While eating, a swoosh made me turn around and see one of these huge birds fly up into one of the huge trees where I saw about 6-8 others. Pretty amazing since they're so big! They weren't directly above us, which could pose a problem (if you know what I mean!), but to the side of us a bit, in a huge tree. They were beautiful, elegant and well-behaved.We went in May, before the peak of the tourist season, so it was a little less congested. If you want to do the tour, I'd suggest coming early to queue up, because I think it must get very crowded here during peak season. Be ready to do lots of walking. And, wear a hat!
A must see!!. Spent a lovely couple of hours up here at the castle. Great to wander around the walls and the views over the city are fantastic.
The usual castle-experience, but amazing view of the city. One of those must-see-tourist attractions in Lisbon, a quite pleasant visit. Fantastic view over the city.
Very interesting!. All was beautiful in the old & smilingly maintained castle. A must see! The views are great as are the glorious cobblestone streets!

Come for the castle, stay for the view. This castle offers wide walls that you can walk around, with lots of great views of the entire city. There are a few old cannons and the like but not much else for military enthusiasts. I recommend getting here early as there were large crowds.

Castelo Bonito !. Beautiful Castle at the confluence of Mourario and Alfama. The ramparts are the best vantage points in the heart of Lisbon's old city to get beautiful sweeping views of the neighbourhoods and also the Ponte 25 de Abril. There are also museum collections in the castle and two peacocks.

Wonderful view of the city and the river.. The view of the vast Tagus estuary, the harbors, and the bridges puts this in the running for something you should really do, even if you are in Lisbon a short time. Except for the walls themselves, not much remains of the glorious past of the castle itself, however. Depending on how you get here (we walked from the Baixa neighborhood) you can get major exercise! But you can also take a cab or a tuk-tuk. Walking around in the Castello, however, is also strenuous.

More of a view than a castle. When in Lisbon the old castle looms over the whole city, so naturally you want to go see it. Truthfully, the castle itself is mostly disappointing. Most people go to enjoy the fantastic view (and it is great). As others have mentioned it is possible to have similar views for free. The walk through surrounding Alfama to the castle is also amazing. When at the castle we managed to see the tour with a camera obscura that happens in various languages every half hour until 5PM. It is essential that you line up as soon as possible for this because they can only take 20 people at a time. There was a very rude family who freaked out when they were told there was no room for them in the last tour of the day. We ended spending a few hours here even though it looked like there was nothing to do. So although Sao Jorge is not much of a castle, it is definitely a good time, as long as you know what to expect.

Beautiful View. This castle was built as a fortress, not as a place to live so there is no sense of former lives when you walk through the open air rooms. But it is still interesting to see, and the peacocks are gorgeous. Surprisingly chilly and windy when you get close to the walls.

Great place to visit. This is a great place to go in Lisbon. Be aware that getting up to the castle is somewhat challenging as there are very steep paths to get to the entrance. Once there, however, there are great views of Lisbon in all directions. It's also worth visiting the castle itself and climbing around the Ruins.

Amazing place to roam. Spent an early evening exploring the castelo & was pleasantly surprised by the serenity of the castelo. The views were fantastic of the city, the cafe was perfect to sit outside and enjoy a snack with beverages ( including wine), the bathrooms were clean & the onsite restaurant looked top notch ( didn't eat there but would of considered if we hadn't already eaten). From the roaming peacocks and friendly cats, the small museum & the ability to climb all over the castelo, I highly recommend visiting... Plus the route to the castelo is beautiful (but uphill, so I advise a tuktuk).

Best of the sights in a beautiful . Loved everything about Lisbon and surrounding areas (day trip to Sintra and Cascais) but the star was the excellent castle and the views it gave over the city and the river. Definitely not to be missed.

Must see. The castle is a must see place and a great place to start your visit to Lisbon (We walked from the centre via the Cathedral to the castle). The views are spectacular and give a great overview/perspective on the city. The castle itself is very interesting, the main structure including the walls having been rebuilt. Good fun. There is also a Camera Obscura which is worth a visit (Great for kids of all ages).

Exceptional 360 degree view of the city. After getting down at Terreiro do Paco metro station, its around 20-25 mins walk upwards to get to the castle. You can also take a tram to get here. There is an entrance fee of 8.5 Euros to be paid at the entrance. Inside the castle, you can have a 360 degree view of the city going around the castle. Also, there are around 5 peacocks within the castle adding to the attraction.

You can get the same views for free from other parts of the city . It's a nice view but there is no historical information about the Castle on site. It was mostly rebuilt in modern times. You can get the same view from other sites without the expense and tourist trap nature of the surrounding area.

Don't miss this and then walk through Alfama. The Castelo is a must - a beautiful structure to explore with lovely views across the city. There is also a fine small museum giving the history of the place with artefacts and pictures. But then make a full afternoon or morning of it by walking slowly down through Alfama - the old Moorish district - with its exotic narrow streets and tiled houses and the quaint very old-world trams. Have a quick beer at the bottom then take in the delights of the Fado Museum as well. Four or five hours to remember with great pleasure.

Wonderful views, amazing camera obscura. Ruined castle dating from Moorish period, with wonderful views in all directions. For taking photos of the city, visit in the morning, when the sun will be behind you.In one of the castle towers is a camera obscura, which you can see by means of a guided tour (this is included in the admission price). Tours are given in Portuguese, Spanish and English and take place every 20 minutes. Numbers are limited so join the queue in good time to get a place.
Fortification with a nice view. A bit disappointing. besides the view, there is not so much to see. The roman remains in front of it are not well enough highlighted.
5 euro for a good view. Probably the best view of Lisbon that you will find. Costs 5 euro for students and 8.50 for adults. Very good place to chill, relax and drink a glass of wine.

Great place - don't miss the camera obscura!. Nice castle, lovely grounds and great views of the city. We also stumbled upon a free explanation about the camera obscura, which we could look through and see the architecture and goings-on of Lisbon.

a must 4 understandig Portugal history. when in Lisbon, capital of tiny country Portugal, but a great nation, we can not miss the Castelo, as locals call it. well the path to this destination we made it by walking along the streets line and as the tram is doing uphill his old, very old line of drive! and is worth the effort when you reach the end and in front of you is opening a wide ancient bastion of so great war's and history at this start/end point/cliff of the old continent ! The view after you enter is magnificent and the history of the city, the country is unfolding at your feet, eyes and mind! WAW! even 4 a day and you have to do it, to see it end feel it! After some time, when you live the site , you, the tourist, will fell that a part in the old continent has opend up with the secrets of how and why have developed during after the Roman Empire has vanished and a new era has come over.!!! all are my personal opinion of course as an "accidental traveler" as I am.

Beautiful Views. Castle offers great history, views and lovely places to sit and eat lunch.
Be careful not to venture down some of the outposts if you do not want to climb the 100+ stairs up!
All about the view. Ancient Moorish/Portuguese pile with a truly world class concert venue with a panoramic look at the whole region. Lisbon's top tourist trap and best view.

10/10 would castelo again. Wasn't sure what to expect. But there is a lot of hard work Into this attraction and I thought it was great. Very very good views over lisbon and across the river. Can pick out a few of the other sights to see. Also saw a couple of very friendly peacocks and a peahen. Plenty of steps to keep the heart rate up too.10/10 would castelo again

Worth the hard walk. Do walk up. Dont take any motorized transport if you can help it. Nice walk and lots to enjoy along the way. There's not much in the castle itself but the two restaurants. We watched a nice Fado performance as a part of the Lisbon festival on till 10th July. Good views of the city. Go for the walk and the views not for the castle.

Great views of Lisbon and the River Tejo. Its at the top of a hill, you can get up there on a street car, good luck, or one of the regular mini buses. There is a nominal entrance fee. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes because there is a lot to see and a lot of walking if you want to take advantage of the site. The views are spectacular.
short break for birthday celebrations. the castle is amazing with fantastic views over the city lots of interesting things to see, you could spend a day there easily

BEAUTIFUL CASTLE INTERESTING SURROUNDINGS. The thing with Lisbon is that it is very hilly and so naturally a castle would be at the highest point. So go with very comfortable shoes and be prepared to climb everywhere. The castle itself is fascinating with wonderful peacocks adorning the walls. Once you have viewed the castle the whole surrounding area is fascinating with its cobbled streets and little boutiques.

beautiful castle. castelo de sao jorge is beautiful caste in lisbon. from here you can see the beautiful views of lisbon city. i will come again to this place when i come to portugal again. definitley worth a visit. highly recommended !
Nice visit.. You get excellent views of Lisbon from up in the castle ruins. Would love to bring my 5 year old here one day. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful views of the city. Buy a beer and bring it in, walk around and enjoy the views of the city and the castle which is still pretty much all there. A must see if you're in Lisbon.
Beautiful views. The castle is a beautiful vantage point in lLisbon that affords you views all around the city. A very nice spot. Stop at the cathedral on the way up.

Castle. Great views of the city and interesting historical centre which is very well restored. The archeological guided tour and the camera obscura are worth attending. Walking up or down to the castle is part of the enjoyment.
Outstanding vista. Perched high above the city the Castelo de Sao Jorge is a well preserved old castle with outstanding vista's over the town.

Castelo Sao Jorge . Great day out at sintra lots of places to visit. There is the palace as well. Best to get the bus to the palace as its a long way up. Take a break one bus stop before the train stop back

A MUST visit in Lisbon!. We took the "Tourist" Tram 28 to the Castle. The castle gives beautiful views of the city. Grab a cappuccino at the Castle Restaurant while watching the local peacocks! Be sure to see the museum. After the castle enjoy the walk down the hill to central Lisbon.

Walk to the castle - worth the bragging rights!. This is a great place to see - the gardens inside alone are worth the trip. The castle is more of a "fort". If you think of it that way you won't be disappointed There are no better views of the city than from here. You can take the historic tram, a taxi, etc., but we walked and it was so wonderful to walk through the neighborhoods on the way up - and you get the bragging rights of having walked it!
Historical! Great view of Lisbon. This is indeed one of the ideal places to start a visit to this beautiful city. You can have a helicopter view and at the same time feel the historical pulse!

A great view. from the castle you have a great view of the city. However to get there it is better to take a taxi or any other transportation. There is no metro, the streets are narrow and in the summer there is to much people around.

Worth the admission ticket. All is worth the 8euros admission, spend 3-4 hours wandering around the ruined castelo with a unchallenged vantage view of the Lisbon. Remember to climb the castle walls if you are abled

Great view of Lisbon . Best view above Lisbon, enjoy the scenery and history as you walk on stones as many did for centuries. Be sure to visit the small museum, lots of nice items from the past. Take transportation to the top and walk down, a definite stop on your trip..

Sightseeing. Great views from restaurant
Could see the whole of Lisbon
It's a nice walk around the surrounding area bars shops etc
Take the team as close as you can get
It's a steep walk if you dont

Pristine castle with a commanding view of Lisbon . An amazing preserved fort on top of a hill overlooking Lisbon, some of the best views of the city. Many different places to get different views of the city. A very good small museum and peacocks roam the grounds and climb the trees! Not overly busy even in peak hours. I'd like to go back and see it in the dark! One of the highlights of the trip!
worth a visit . best views over lisbon worth a visit in the old part of Lisbon it's a lovely walk back down into the centre of Lisbon

Guinevere would be jealous. This is a quintessentialCastle which Cinderella could only dream of. If you are a hiker, walk up from town... Your bottom will thank you later. You will pass 1 neighborhood after another as you ascend. The castle itself is a walking tour of history from 600 ad to the 1700's. Breathtaking view of Lisbon and the water. Ancient gardens and a museum which is small but contains amazing antiquities

Best vistas of Lisbon. Not to be missed if you're in Lison. The best views of the city. The castle itself is extremely impressive too. Plan to spend a few hours there, then walk your way down slowly through the surrounding streets.
Amazing view. If you like to set your eyes on a spectacular view of Lisbon, don't forget to visit the castle. Prepare for a steep climb towards the castle, but it'll be worth it!
Beautiful views. Spent a couple of hours seeing the castle, which was quite interesting. Be sure to buy a glass of wine from the bar and enjoy the view!

What a view...don't get better than this. A gorgeous, cool sunny day overlooking the city of Lisbon...an uphill hike, but well worth it. You can climb the castle walls and walk the perimeter and get a 360 degree panorama of the city. Plan on at least 90 minutes..some of the steps pretty steep, hang on to the handrails

Nice views of the city. This is a nice old medieval fort with interesting history and overlooks the city. You can get a free elevator through a supermarket to save you the hill walk. Nice to walk around and look out over the city. Some parts were closed off during the visit but didn't take from the experience.

CASTLE VISIT. The views of Lisbon are spectacular from the promenade and a must visit. We had a tuc tuc from the the start for tram 28, the cost 5 euros each. Well worth it because of the steep climb to the castle.
Beautiful views of the city. The castle was close by to our hotel with great views over the city. Lots of places sit. The museum at the castle is worth a visit.

Stunning Views. Interesting couple of hours overlooking stunning Lisbon. Area around the castle full of little shops and bars and we got a bit lost trying to find our way to the nearest metro. Should have just walked back down through Alfama to the river. Cafe with decent coffee but disappointing tea. Peacocks entertaining. Museum detailing castle's history with artefacts.
Must See. Great views all around. Lots of Tourist but also a lot of history and things to see. Kind of pricey to get in, but a lot to do. The walk up through the neighborhood is also interesting.

A steep climb but worth it. We got there via the 2 elevators (ask your hotel how to access) or use no 28 tram or bus to take you most of the steep climb. Fantastic views of Lisbon from the castle. A piece of history awaits you.

Bring a map if you are walking.. Great views over the city with lots of interesting history on the castle and lisbon in the little museum. Some of the walls in the inner keep are only knee height and quite precarious. I would make sure you have a decent map as if you dont you may end up hiking up to the top to realise you are at the other side of the main entrance. Also if you wish to explore the surrounding alfama area, a map would greatly decrease the chances of getting lost in the winding streets !
Plenty of fabulous views. Views were great, the castle has been over restored and has lost it's mystique. Peacocks roaming were fun, especially sitting above us in the tree when in the cafe.

Awesome views of Lisbon. Worth the trek up!. I spotted the Castle whilst at the waterfront and decided to opt for the local bus rather than the tour bus to get up there. Miles cheaper but it was a little more of an 'adventure' to find it. Follow the crowds and ask locals! Lots of up hill walking once off the bus and you must pay to get into the grounds, but so worth it. Aim to go on a clear day, but the view was still great even when cloudy. Visited April 2015

Castle. Make sure you get off the tram at the right stop it you will be walking uphill alot! Great views of the city and a little piece if history. You have to run the gauntlet of vendors to the entrance but once you are in its peaceful. Watch your step, uneven ground.

Great views . We only had a small amount of time in Lisbon so we asked a waiter in a restaurant places we had to see during our short stay. We were in Lisbon during the Saint Anthony's celebrations so she recommended visiting Castelo de Sao Jorge. It cost €8 to get into the castle rounds which was very reasonable. The views around the city were amazing in the castle. Also the history of the castle was fascinating. The area of Castelo de Sao Jorge also has great little shops and restaurants. Really enjoyed our morning here, definitely worth a trip!!
Huge and impressive. We were on the tram tour and got off to climb up to the castle. The views are fantastic and the castle is quite impressive.

Great views. This is a worthwhile place to visit even if just for the views. The castle dominates a large part of the city and it is worth making the trek up to see it. There are pleasant places to sit and eat an icecream or watch the world go by. The battlements are well preserved and certainly give you an idea of how well fortified the castle was in times past.
Fantastic View. This is a great place to visit and has a fantastic view so one take take lots of photos. We walked up to the castle but in a warm day it may not be for everyone!

What a view. There are so many castles dotting the landscape of Europe that it might be tempting to give this Lisbon castle a pass. Don't do it! The castle itself is an enjoyable walk but the view of Lisbon is spectacular! The peacocks are a please tell diversion if you like that sort of thing. The walk down hill through the winding streets is a pleasure - narrow doorways, circular roads and interesting shops. It is to be sure a touristic haven but worth a gander.

Amazing and calming atmosphere. Located on of the high hills of Lisbon. We could have spent hours sitting and watching the beauty of this city from here. You wont miss much if you dont go up to the top of the castle, you have an amazing view and sitting areas as soon as you enter. We have spent at least an hour to give ourselves a coffee break and watch the city and of course take 100s of photos :)) but could easily spent more time if we didnt have to move

Great Views of the City. Went hear last year. It's a pretty cool little spot with amazing panoramic views of the city below. If you are exploring the castle with little ones, just be careful. There are not may guardrails to prevent them from falling from the walkways. But they'll LOVE the peacocks that are all over the castle grounds.

Fantastic views. The trip to the castle is definitely worth it for the views of the city. Unfortunately the castle itself has been over renovated in my view which takes some of the character away. Still worth the trip to see the exhibition and the artifacts found.
Loved it. The castle has lovely romantic grounds with trees and beautiful buildings I would totally recommend also fantastic views from the terraces

Castelo se Sao |Jorge. We climbed all the way up to the castle to enjoy the most spectacular views of Lisbon. They offer seniors a very fair entrance rate and you can spend a few hours enjoying the view or to just sit and enjoy the surroundings. You can also take the trolley up the hill close to the castle. Do watch for pick pockets in this area as they blend in with the tourists. We loved watching the beautiful peacocks that live up in the grounds. Lots of restaurants within the grounds and on the streets leading up to the site.

A Disney-esque castle. Why only 3 out of 5 stars? Because there is very little of the original medieval castle in what you see during the visit to the Castelo de Sao Jorge. Everything has been rebuilt "maybe" respecting the original look of the place. But since the structure has been used for centuries for many different things, what you see is basically a XX century view of what a medieval castle was!If you like Disney movies, though, you won't be disappointed!

Fun exploration, great views. I really like this castle. You have freedoom to explore at your own pace. The grounds are beautiful! The view is even better. There are cafe's/resturants on the castle grounds too.
Beautiful castle on a hilltop. I've seen a lot of monuments and I really enjoyed walking around the remnants of this castle. The views of Lisbon are smashing from various points. Lots of stairs!

Great Castle and a spectauclar view. This visit is essential and I will recomend that you get there by a Tuktuk because its quite a climb to the top. Once there you will feel like a conquerer and please have your camera ready to take great shots of the city and the river. On your way down you may visit the cathedral and other beautiful churches. Then you may go to the famous Alfama to visit this old town with a great history
Cool castle. We walked up to the castle, a bit of a hike, but you get some awesome views of the city. It's cheap and worth it. Only takes about an hour in the castle.

Very nice view of Lisbon and good food in the restaurant. The view of the Castelo de Sao Jorge is amazing.You have a nice view to the whole Lisbon.The food in the restaurant of the castle is also very good.It s also good in case companies want to organise business dinner or lunches there.

Brilliant Views. We got tram 28 to cover most of the climb. The driver shouts out when you are at the stop for the castle. The views are worth the final climb on foot and the €8.50 entry. The cafes surrounding the castle are more expensive as you would expect. Quite a lot of hawkers and a few beggars. If you are in Lisbon you must do this.
Delightful history and outdoor ambiance. Castle fans and history buffs alike shouldn't miss the castle. It has all the relics you'd expect and the peacocks in trees you wouldn't!

Amazing views. The day we went ended up being a rainy day, but even with the weather being the way it was, we had amazing views of Lisbon from here. The red/pink roofs of all the apartments below made for beautiful scenery. The castle itself was not all that interesting to me, but the views more than made up for the building!

Castle with a view. The Castle is perched high up on a hill overlooking the city and offers excellent views of the whole of Lisbon. The entrance fee is 8 euros which represents good value for the Castle walls and the views of Lisbon. You can walk up the hill from Baxia or take a Tram if you fancy a quirky trip

Worth the walk up to the Castle. The walk up to the castle is well worth it. You get to run into many cafe, shops...etc. And the view of the city from the hill is quite magnificent. Not sure if the admission fee is worth going into the castle ground..
Great views. Nice to explore. Lots of stairs but worth the climb. Great area to take panoramic views. I recommend the journey!

Well worth a visit. Took the tram to the castle and walked back down
The castell is in amazing shape and well managed
Views of Lisbon are terrific
Plenty to visits within the locality
the walk back down the centre was a an interesting experience with steep hills and cobbled streets etc.

An impressive castle, with amazing views over the city!. This castle maybe on the small side, but it is very impressive and the views of the city are amazing. This place is great to wander around and also very relaxing.
The entrance to the castle was 8 euro and 50 cent, and overall it was a good few hours spent. There is hot, cold and food available on site.

Fabulous castles and great views of city. What a great place to visit and good exercise as many stone steps! Be careful with children or unsteady people as the steps are unguarded (so they look better). The camera oscura has free guided sessions in various languages but the times are limited and small numbers only, so queue if you want to go in. Also there are guided tours of the excavation site which is otherwise off limits; also free.

Spectacular views over the city of Lsibon. Due to its exceptional location this attraction stands our as one of Lisbon's majestic and must do sights. The castle occupies a prominent position looking down on the busy city, everywhere you walk around the city you see the castle up on high from the top of the Alfama district. This was Lisbon's ancient seat of power for 400 years, the battlements you see today were totally restored in the 1920'sWe could not face the walk up through Alfama so we cheated and grabbed a taxi from our hotel. At the castle entrance, they have a very modern and sophisticated ticket office, and you can collect a brochure on the history etcAs you walk around the battlements, stop for a while to take it all it, there are many places to sit - the views are totally fabulous, Alfama to the left, the River Tagus and all aspects of the city. There are many original gun emplacements, the odd statue, a permanent exhibition on site a small shop and a lovely outdoor café/restaurant.Brilliant to wander around for an hour or so, then a taxi back down into the city.

Great view! . Nice walk (climb) up from Alfama to the Castle. Without a map we definitely took a wrong turn and had to go around before we got there, but it wasn't too far in the end or too difficult to find. Baby carrier much better idea than a stroller, I'd say - for parents. Great views and lots of benches to take it easy. We got a drink and sandwich to go at the Cafe to sit outside. Quality of sandwich poor but it didn't seem important. Our one-year old loved the peacocks in the courtyard. Free public toilets, too, just down some steps.We did not really take in nor appreciate the castle, I am sorry to say. Just the surroundings were enough for us. Then lunch at a small place nearby that looked like tram 28 on the inside.

Beautiful spot, highly recommended. Castelo is an absolute must see in Lisbon. You take a mini bus from the Placa de Figuera (I think this is how it's spelled!) and it's a 10- minute interesting drive up the narrow streets to the Castelo. The admission fee is 8.50 EUR. Once inside you can enjoy a beautiful view of Lisbon and then explore around the castle. Wonderful

Gorgeous Castle. Wonderful little castle with great views! Take a Tuk Tuk up there if you don't want to walk up the huge hill, other wise you'll get attitude from the Taxi drivers. Walk down if you can there cute little shops along the way.
Best view over the city on a clear day. The view from the top of the fortress is worth the climb. There is a small museum but the rest of the building is quite empty.

Great place.. A place with panoramic views and full of history. It's quite a lovely walk up the hill and through the winding streets. It's a surprise to be greeted by the resident peacocks, but you will enjoy a few hours on the castle any day of the week.Highly recommended.
Outstanding views. Pay the entrance fee just for the views.Well worth the walk up the hill.You will spend at least an hour just looking at the views from different sides of the castle.
NOthing great. It's more of a fort. Good for the viewpoints. And the peacocks. Apart from that mostly deserted nothing much to look at at.

Great Views. Great place for 360 degree view of the city, Tagus River and city attractions. You can walk around the upper walls that surround the castle. Gun emplacements and sculptures are found on the grounds and the brochure explains the history of the castle. There is a nominal entry fee but there is a senior citizen discount. No recommended on a rainy or overcast day.

Don't miss the castle. Also, it has fantastic views of the city and river.. We took Rick Steves walking tour #1 that started from the castle. The castle itself was great, we spent about 2 1/2 hours there. The views are fantastic. There is a small museum as well. Beautiful peacocks walk or fly around the premises.

Best views in the city. Thoroughly enjoyed the trip from the walk up to the walk down (don't wimp out and get a tuk tuk etc - the walk is part of the experience and I'd recommend following a different route down than up. Just meander - you can't get too lost and we stumbled upon lovely gardens etc on the way down).Inexpensive to get in and spent a good couple of hours wandering around, taking the obligatory iPhone pano shots, climbing the ramparts, and bothering the resident peacocks. There's a restaurant/cafe and other eating options too. We visited in May when the weather was pleasant - if visiting in the heighth of summer this would be a very welcome respite from the heat as the main courtyard is well shaded.

Fantastic view . Another monument with a lot of story.An amazing view over the city and also over the river.The castle can be reached by the tram number 28.Must pay to see the castle only for local people is free of payment.
Great Views of Lisbon. A bit pricey to get in at €8.50 per adult but the views are great especially from the top of the castle rampartsWorth a visit
Great virwd. Great views with lots of interesting nooks and crannies. Could not find the camera obscura. (But didn't ask, so our fault). Peacocks were very interesting.
Lovely views from the Esplanade. Its a bit of a walk to here but well worth it. Interesting esplanade with good views all round. Go early to avoid the crowds and the heat

Wonderful place and lovely view on Lisbon. Even if it deserves it by far, I dont put 5 stars just because of the visit price 8.5€ too expensive! However don't miss the way up to the castle either walking or with the famous tramway to the castle Sao Jorge. The view is breathtaking on Lisbon and all these red roof houses. Castle is nice and you can even have a better view from the towers. I love Lisbon.

Best viewpoint in Lisbon. Climbing up the hill was not entirely easy. It was worth the effort though. We didnt choose to take a taxi up simply because we believed we could walk up and could save a few bucks.The castle offered a wide view to the historical core of lisbon. Very nice place to take pictures if your friends are photogenic and/or are desperate to update their instagram profile (smirk).The castle itself was okay. An old one was what I could conclude. Not many remains of historic relics apart from the architecture.

Nice Piece of History. This castle is perched up high overlooking Lisbon and, therefore, gives amazing views of this wonderful city. It's quite cheap to get into and you learn some history about the place from the little guide you get on purchasing a ticket. There is a café and places to get drinks and ice cream dotted around.
Great scenary . Very old castle place , in hilly area . Good to walk around , not so huge place. You can see great view from terrace zone .

Beautiful views, visit early in the morning to avoid the crowds. The views of Lisbon are outstanding from the Castle but you do need to get there early to avoid the crowds, which start to build up by 10.30. The cafe is lovely and reasonably priced. The peacocks put on an impress page show for us and overall it's a nice way to spend a few hours in Lisbon.
A must visit. Away from the rush of the city peaceful location with must see views over the city. The queue was quiet long but moved quickly and well worth the wait.

Interesting history. Spectacular views from the tops of the restored castle. Full of history. Plenty of space to bring your own lunch or but from the cafe. A little bit Game of Thrones (though not actually used in the show). You will need A LOT of time to stand in the queue if you want to view the Camera Obscura.
Nice to visit. It's not very expensive to get in and it gives you a nice view over the city from different angles. The way to get there is a nice walk through the old town.
Amazing views. Castle is not much interesting, but there are stunning views of Lisbon. In the inner yard there are Roman excavations.
Its ok. The only left of the castle are the walls that surrounds it but u can walk around it giving u a better view of Lisbon. Its cheap to get in too. Youll see peacocks wondering around the area.

castle with a magnificent view. the climb up to the castle is so worth the panoramic views of Lisbon - you can always get the tram or a tuk tuk . You can also stop off at the many cafes, restaurants , bars along the way . There is also eating places inside the castle . Very interesting place to visit .

Amazing views and relaxed atmophere steeped in history. What a stunning view of the city! This castle has interesting history and provides a wonderful way to spend an afternoon. Grab a glass of wine and take in the stunning sights.

A must visit when in Lisbon. A definite must see with majestic views over the whole city, the suspended bridge, the River and the Ocean. Located at the top of Alfa's neighbourhood it is probably best experienced by climbing the narrow streets leading to it and following the tram 28 tracks and later leave using the tram to enjoy both sides of Alfama. Once inside you will enjoy the peerless panoramic views of Lisbon.

Worth it. We weren't going to visit the Castelo but found ourselves with an extra day inLisbon. We are very pleased we did. We walked up and down, it's not that strenuous, but if you aren't a walker then use the tram bus or tuk tuk. There is quite a bit of walking on site, and steep steps. The views are spectacular. The history is very interesting, and there is a small archaeological museum on site. Walk around the top of the wall. Great place if a bit pricey.

Interesting but short stay.. Take the 12E Tram to Ig. Sta. Lizia street. or just look for all the people taking pictures of the great view of the water along the railing of the left as you go up the hill. €8.5 for adults €20 for two parents with kids under 18. Museum, great view, restaurant, and lots of old cannons. Amazing view of the harbor.
great views. well worth to visit and get a great view over Lisbon; also you go thru the Old Town; plenty of tourists but also

Really worth it. We loved the Castelo de Sao Jorge - bit touristy going up to it but once inside the crowds thinned out. We went on a particularly beautiful May day and the views were stunning. The Camera Obscura was one of the highlights for us. Really enjoyed this. Well worth a visit - fascinating place.

Nice castle and beautiful landscape.. It's a nice place, with lots of green areas, there are some souvenir shops in the inside and also some places to have a snack. Unfortunately, it does not work as a museum, so you can't learn much history about it. It's a lovely place for a long walk and you can appreciate beautiful landscapes of the city.
A beautiful view. Beautiful place to see all of lisbon. Take cab to it, it is a very long walk up hill.10 euros per person but not badAlot of cafes inside also if you don't want to tour castle

spectacular views. Located high on a hilltop, the view of the city and the water is awesome. The castle is quite fascinating and the grounds are beautiful. Lots of places to climb and also to sit and take it all in. Grab a glass of wine or a cold beverage and sit and take it all in.

Not worth the ticket. Views are the same as in any other free miradoro. I even think they are better elsewhere, because from any other miradoro you can see the castle, and from the castle you dont! haha, crazy but true. Inside the castle there is just nothing. Half demolished walls and it is all up to your imagination. The walk through Alfama is very very beautiful, but I wouldn't recommend going in the castle.

A must. Great views as you soak up history.Went in early June late afternoonWhen the sun was setting.Absolute must for castle and history buffs and for those who want to admire Lisbon from a vantage point.

We could see it high on the hill from our window. The Castelo can be seen overlooking Lisbon from our hotel window. We had to go see it. We took a taxi from the Tile Museum (also worth a visit) and started to climb around the walls. Lisbon itself is a great city, but after the traffic and crowds in the old city it was great to get up into the fresh air with a view of the entire city below. This is a place where you can really feel the history and envision the people living here. Highly recommended.
Fantastic views. The castle itself is in good condition but is nothing more than walls really. But the views from the walls are amazing and its well worth a trek up there for this alone.

Well worth the climb.The views are super.. Castle St.George is worth a visit.It is situated at the top of a steep hill,so wear flat,sturdy shoes.There are lots of interesting points to rest and study the superb view over Lisbon .There is a cafe and small shop in the grounds.lots of ancient history,a good museum and when we were there some visitors were having a go at archery and sword fighting!

Impressive height. The castle is very impressive and the vistas of the city are great.
