Nice place with excellent panoramic views of the City of Lisbon. This castle has excellent views of the City of Lisbon and some good architecture and historical information - although the star attractions appear to be the peacocks who put on a fantastic view for the visitors lol
So beautiful. Well worth it for the peacocks, views, garden. Lovely on a sunny day and the walk up to it is wonderful.

Nice views. Not a must see place but still a nice walk about with several great views of the city. There are peacocks in the park that are fun to see. We had a guide and she pointed out several need things about the site.

Great panoramas. It's a nice place to walk and admire the panorama of the city from different angles. Also, there's a camera obscura worth visiting. Within a castle there are some friendly peacocks spreading their tails :)

Lovely castle. Pay the one fee at the gate and you are free to roam through the extensive grounds. There is a cafe inside for a break if you tired of walking. Excellent views from all around the castle, so make sure you bring your camera.

Great Views of the City. I enjoyed visiting this part of the city. The castle is nestled on a hilltop and all around are small village areas. Great views of the city are all around. There are buses and trams regularly running in the area. Lot's of cafes and beautiful scenery.

Beautiful views over Lisbon. We were here on a sunny day, which meant we got to see the wonderful views over Lisbon. Wouldn't recommend it for a wet day visit. Interesting to read the history of the castle, and generally a nice place to explore. Look out for the peacocks though!

Great place to visit to get some history and views of Lisbon!!!. Great place to visit! High above the city and picturesque to say the least! On a clear day you can see the majority of the city of Lisbon! Didn't see many relics and only the walls of the castle and various courtyards. The castle can be reached by walking, trolley car or cab. It's quite a hike up the hill to the top by foot! A must see if you are visiting Lisbon especially for the great views of the city!!!

Save your money, give it a miss. There are lots of miradours around the city where you will get splendid views and no charge. You could walk on the ramparts and enjoy the spectacular views but that was it. The exhibitions were sparse and the camera obscura was not open. It was mentioned on the brochure you got at the entrance but had disappeared off the numbered map showing the attraction locations. When we finally found it, the gate was locked, no explanation.

beautiful view over Lisbon.. This castle is greatly located as up from there you can enjoy a fantastic panoramic view over Lisbon. The museum in the castle is quite rich. you can sroll around the walls of this castle and discover every corner of it.

Great views and nice place to just relax and learn. The views of Lisbon are amazing here and there are enough areas to sit and relax and even have a picnic if your bring one. The castle itself is nice but if you have any fear of heights you may want to stay on the ground level as the narrow stairs without any hand rails may weaken you knees a bit.
A piece of Portugal and europe history. One of the best conserced medievel castles in europe from where you have a unique view of the 7 hills of Lisbon and the river Tejo.

Castelo. Well worth a visit beautiful location wonderful views reasonably priced and you get a brochure with all the history a must see on your visit to Lisbon.plus a lovely tram ride up tho the castle.

Great Views. We enjoyed them gem while visiting the town of Alfama. My 5 y/o was able to climb the stairs and enjoyed looking out over the castle ruins. Although there isn't much "to do" here, the views and history of the castle is amazing. It is an open castle ruin so try to visit on a day without rain in the forecast.

A 'must'see' place in Lisbon with lots of history, interesting peacocks wandering around, and battlements to walk around. We spent 2-3 hours walking around the site, and it's got great views of the city. Nice battlements with less of the UK over emphasis on health and safety, so good fun as well. Older ruins only accessible via guide (free) but tours infrequent and not explained to us, so we missed that part.

Nice spot to overview Lisbon. Although the way up to the castelo is a bit steep, it is manageable for everyone. Just take the tram (12 I think it was) and there are only about 500m left to walk. We did it with a stroller and it worked just fine. Inside the castle area you can easily spent some hours, watching Lisbon from different angles and wandering around the castle. There are also restaurants, however we have not tried them.

For the view. The castle is really a hollowed out fortress. The reason to pay the emission is just for the panoramic views of the city. This city of always walking up or down hills has many panoramic sites just as spectacular. However, it is interesting to see how the defense system of this building was constructed.

Brilliant views of the city.. Worth a visit for the views. Long haul up on foot but using the hop on / hop off bus you can reduce to a 5 minute walk up the last bit. Interesting history briefly described in the entrance info. would benefit from more written information as you walk around. Apart from the museum all outdoors so not a good choice for rainy days.

Good views. This was a steep walk up to the castle but well worth it. The views from the top over Lisbon were fantastic. Plenty of walls to walk round and explore. Remember it is all down hill on the way back.

Amazing Views. We took tram 28 to the castle then walked a short, steep and hard hill to get to the top. A big queue to buy tickets but once we were inside there was enough space for everyone and it didn't feel crowded.Very impressive structure but it was all about the views for us. We wandered around the walls taking in the incredible sight of the city way below. You get some great views of the River and the Alfama and all the houses with their colourful walls and roofs.Much of the castle is a shell but it is fun to explore, steps to climb and nooks and crannies to peek into and lots of grassy areas with peacocks everywhere strutting their stuff.A Lisbon must-see, those views are unforgettable.

better than I though. Quite well preserved and large castle with stunning views. Includes also a few bonuses which I could not take advantage of as was on tight schedule - archaeological site with guided tours, live camera views of various parts of Portugal with guide giving explanations. The latter two are at specific times starting only 10 or 10:30 AM so plan accordingly.

Castle of St. George. My wife and I hiked up the hill to the castle right before sunset (not knowing there was a lift). The views of Lisbon were breathtaking! We toured the museum and learned about the many cultures that used the site over the millennia. We walked down the hill and took in a local Fado show for dinner. It was a fantastic evening!

Self guided tour of Castelo de Sao Jorge. This tour was well worth the visit. You can take a trolley up but we found they were very full so took a local bus from downtown Lisbon instead. The castle is on the top of a hill soprovides excellent views of the city and bridge. You get a map of the site along with your entrance fee so you can wander through at leisure. There is a wine kiosk on site where you can get a nice glass of red or white wine for about 5 Euros and then sit and enjoy the view.

Worth a visit. Very interesting with fantastic views over Lisbon. Lots of steps in places so be prepared ! Walked up to the area through lots of narrow streets and passageways and this added to the day out.

An oasis of calm overlooking the fantastic city landscape - all at a great price. After long trek up the hill (trams available for the weak willed) - we were delighted to find no queues for the castle and reasonable entry fees (c. 14 euros for adult and teenager). Large area to explore including walking the walls and getting a 360 view of the city. Loved the lack of focus on health and safety. Inner walls of the castle also available to explore and cafe on site too. Peacocks gave off their best displays to impress the visitors. The size and space of the site meant it felt calm and quiet after the bustle of the city streets.

Disappointing. The castle looks fantastic when viewed from other parts of the city, but it's not that great when there.Took a 28 Tram to the nearest stop and still had to walk uphill for 10 minutes.Not that clearly marked, so followed the crowds. Entry price was very reasonable and the initial courtyard promised much, with lots of stonework, architecture, trees and brilliant scenic views (ideal for photos)The courtyard lead to inner and outer sections that were disappointing, as there was nothing really to see except stonework & walls.You could take some of the many steps and walk the battlements; but with no handholds, low walls & moderate winds, it felt really unsafe. (I wouldn't take a child up there)Best part of the visit was the cafe: - spent longer in there than walking the whole castle

A good place to visit on a Monday. On a day of heavy rain musuems are a good choice. But on a Monday most in Lisbon are shut so I ended up here. The views I don't doubt are very good on a clearer day. There's the 'romantic' garden, a small museum and the castle. Was a good way to spend a few hours.

Impressive castle, good documentation. But rather hard to know where to reach on map. The local roads clearly indicate where to go to though.Much space, lots of trees and bushes which make the castle very nice with kids as well.A lot of dangerous heights though, it's possible with young children, but you need to keep a good eye out on them.The camera obscura had LONG waiting lines and only admitted 20 people every 20 minutes and the language guide shifted from English to Portuguese to Spanish, so that's an hour wait....

Beautiful castle. Be ready to climb a few hills in order to get to the castle. The view is great, so is the castle. There's a dark chamber where you can see all the city and the targus river. Worth spending 2-3h.

Excellent visit. Ruined castle very well restored & work still on-going. Sensational views of Lisbon from ramparts. Camera obscura. Peacocks strut their stuff. Nice cafe. Lovely walk through Alfama to get there - or take the tram. A must-visit if coming to Lisbon.

Very interesting. We enjoyed our visit to the castle very much. The view of Lisbon from the castle grounds is incomparable. There is a small and very interesting museum and you can wander all over the castle. Our only critique would be that there was not much guidance or information provided. For example, there is a section of archeological excavation that you can only go into with a guide. It's free but we did not know about it until one had started and the next was not until much later.

Must see- place in Lissabon. Lovely view over the city of Lissabon. You can easily spend to whole day here, there are restaurants and even a portwine-cart. I was a little bit scared walking up to the towers, but the view was great.

Not a lot to see here move on. It's a bit of a walk up to the castle from the centre of the city. The advantage of that is a super view all around 360 degrees. But that's as good as it gets for the castle. Not a lot else to see up there, not interpretation or displays so hard to pick up on the history of the place.

Stunning views from every angle. Wow! If you like to photograph a view you can't go wrong here, they were wonderful!!. We were able to take the elevator from inside the Pingo doce supermarket (address Largo do Chão do Loureiro 11) in the Baixa district which allowed us to halve the time it would have taken us to walk all the way up to the entrance. We walked on and around every wall and just loved what we could see. There was a queue to use the camera obscura so we didn't bother. We will certainly visit this site again.
Worth it for the view alone. Great views of the city in all directions from the walls well worth the reasonable entrance fee alone. I recommend going on a clear day.
Lovely Catle, amazing views. Lovely interesting castle with fantastic views over Lisbon. Coffee shop was good with seating outside and lovely gardens. Allow about 3 hours for your visit

Perfect spot to watch the sunset. We were staying in a hotel right next to the castle, so decided to go late in the day to watch the sunset. If you are able to, I would highly recommend going at this time. During the day it looked as though it got busy very quickly, but it's open until around 9pm and is quieter later on. We took a small picnic and some Port and sat watching the sunset over the whole of Lisbon which felt really romantic, and the views are spectacular. The castle itself, well, is a castle. Some of it is ruins, and it doesn't take an awfully long time to walk around but it is pretty, but for me the experience was about the view.
Short break . The castle is a must see very well restored and maintained make sure you walk up to get full overview of castle and surroundings
Must visit. We had a lovely day up the castle. There is a nice view of Lisbon (shame it was a cloudy day). There are some peacocks inside and has a lovely display of feather from one of them.
Beautiful views, beautiful peacocks.. Its a long climb but worth it to look out over the whole city. Not cheap but quite a lot to explore.

Views from the heavens of Lisbon. Fantastic place to relish history, see spectacular views of the city and imagine yourself back in time.A highlight of the city with peacocks, great places to wander around and even dine. One of my favorite places to visit while in Lisbon. TIP- Very cool on a hot summer day, sit under a tree and enjoy the view.

Fantastic views of city - very interesting Black Chamber . €20!for a family ticket is good value. Great views of the city. The Black Chamber optical system is great - try to catch it (no extra charge).

Perfect selfies from the fortress. Me and my fiancee LOVED Castel San Jorge. We've climbed up the stairs through old city Lisbon, it took a while but it was worth it. Perfect views and sunset for the most perfect selfies ever.

The climb is not too arduous.. It's actually a pleasant walk up to the castle through the winding streets. It is more of a gradual climb, at least the way we went. Great place to see the City and a lovely relaxing environment. Highly recommend the 'Camera Obscura' with 360 degrees views and a very interesting and informative guide to the City.

Spectacular Views in a Pleasant Setting. Worth the climb to be rewarded with excellent views.There are various shops on the approach to the castle, but the views are limited until you go into the castle grounds. We purchased a family ticket for 20 euros which was really good value for a couple of hours exploring and taking numerous photos over the castle walls and from different turrets within the castle.Before going into the castle itself, there are plenty of photo opportunities in the castle grounds. There are peacocks wandering around and the museum was interesting. Sandwiches in the cafe are reasonably priced.Our teenage boys liked climbing up and down the castle turrets, but the camera obscura was a let down as the presentation was only in Portuguese.Go on a clear day to appreciate the views.
Amazing. Don't be put off by what you see when you first go in... There is a whole castle to explore...bit sketchy on the walkways if your scared of heights though...look out for the albino peacock
Fabulous views!. Steeped in history and with panoramic views. We got there early but it's such a large site that it didn't ever seem too busy. The peacocks were a hit too!
City view. Ticket costs €8.50 per person and you actually pay for a city view from the castle more than for anything else.
Great views over the city. The castle is in good condition and there are lots of interesting aspects to enjoy. The highlights though are the wonderful views over the city and river.

Great Views from this Castle.. We got the tram to this attraction, which was just a short walk from the tram stop. It cost us 8.5 Euros each, except for my son who was slightly cheaper, due to his student card! The castle is in very good condition and the views over Lisbon from its turrets are spectacular. There are lots of steps to climb so not a great place for elderly or unfit people! Although going up all those steps will be an aid to getting fit:-)! I also had a Magnum and Capuccino (What a mix) in the café, and it was reasonably priced and a good cuppa! The castle was well worth a visit and I recommend it as a sight to see in Lisbon!

Don't miss the view from above. I visited this in the evening just when the sun was setting and I can say this was my favorite place. The view is amazing from every corner! I took a lot of pictures here and I was fascinated by each and every part of Lisbon that I saw from above.

Great value and superb views. Well worth a visit....only €8.50 per person and views and amount to see brilliant. Little cafe and restaurant if wish.outside of walls lots of little shops with traditional gifts and cafes and restaurants and the houses in the little streets fascinating. Really worth a visit. It's on a hill so quite a climb however a bus stop is at the entarance of castle or taxis which are quite cheap.

Interesting but quite a walk! . Right at the top of one of lisbon's many hills this castle is a very interesting place to visit. It is quite a walk and there is lots of walking/ hills/ stairs inside. There is also plenty to see and spectacular views - I would highly recommend the camera obscura - but make sure you check the times and get there early as only 20 people are allowed in at any one time.
Very nice. I can't say how many times I have been there by now.. it is always nice to show to friends. You get an amazing view up there. Love it!

Pay the Entrance Fee for the Views!!!!. After climbing up the hill and noting the stew entrance fee to a castle we knew was basically a blank canvas, had us think twice about entering the grounds for the 20 euro family fee. SO GLAD WE DID!! It made the city experience a positive one for us! The Wine Cart-Wine With a View is A COMPLETE MUST!!! You get to sample wines from Portugal as well as get a souvenir glass with your purchase, the beautiful lady entrepreneur and her husband are very kind-you can tell they love what they do and each other! Such a romantic place!

Medieval fort on top of the Alfama district. For an admission fee of €8,50 you are allowed to enter the old fort with a beautiful view on Lisbon. I think it is worth the money and we spend almost 2 hours in the castle and area around it.If you weren't tired enough from the trip to the fort, you can climb the walls of the fort to get a nice idea on how the people inside the settlement could defend themselves against threats from outside.
Worth a visit. Great view of Lisbon. Take tram no 28 to avoid steep walk up. Pleasant walk on way down. Nice tea room. Interesting place to visit

Great views and a nice cafe too. Once you find your way up here via via trams or tour buses and the walk up the narrow streets you're in for a treat. A well preserved ruin of a once great castle, giving amazing views of the city below. The walls are a little precarious if are brave enough to climb but it's fun when you do. This is a must on your trip to Lisbon.There is a nice cafe just outside the castle walls and a more sophisticated restaurant too if you are hungry, take a seat outside the cafe and enjoy the many splendid peacocks as the wander around.

Good views . This castle is beautiful. The views are awesome cause is in the top of alfama so you can see a fantastic view of the city. Last time that I went there it was 2014, and I was a resident in Lisbon so I did not pay alot, but I think normal price is so expensive.

A lovely castle. We arrived early which was definitely a good decision as the crowds picked up about 11:00am. The views from the site are beautiful and you can walk all around the old castle walls. We stopped in the cafe and the food/coffee was good.

A must-see for any visit to Lisbon, no matter how brief. Was here on business, and so glad I took advantage of a long lunch break to take a look. As others have said it's a steep walk up, and amazing how close it is to the downtown places. Wonderful views from the top across the city and the water, going up the towers and down the long rampart was amazing.This was my favorite part of several days in Lisbon.
Uphill hike. We had a lovely walk up stairs and winding hills to the castle. Stunning views over Lisbon and beyond. A beautiful and interesting place.

QUITE A HIKE. Wow, what a hike but worth it for the views. As castles go, Sao Jorge has one of the best views going. Not too expensive and the perfect place for a pic-nic. TOP TIP: GO AROUND 7.00 TO AVOID ALL THE HAPPY SNAPPY CRUISE LINER TOURISTS AND CATCH SUNSET AT 8.00 WITH A GLASS OF WINE.
Great views and Peacocks!. Very enjoyable for a ruin. Would recommended for the view and local shops nearby. I have to give 100 words here so hopefully this sentence does it.
Great views and Peacocks!. Very enjoyable for a ruin. Would recommended for the view and local shops nearby. I have to give 100 words here so hopefully this sentence does it.
Castle, Gardens and Spectacular Views. Whether you walk, take the trolley or taxi be sure to visit the castle when you're in Lisbon. A definite must-see.
Well worth the climb. If you walk it's a fair climb to the top but well worth it. The castle is well worth exploring and the views over the town and river are superb.

Steep Walk. we walked from our hotel and it was a steep walk up! the cost was 8.50 euros and no guide or booklet given which wasn't good value. but the view was, the weather needs to be nice to appreciate the view and if you have more time take a picnic. A lovely place to eat and relax
Great View. The castelo is a hint for all who want to learn about the history of Lissabon. For the others it offers a great view over the roofs of the city.

Good visit but be careful. Take the tuck tuck or tram to the castle and spend a couple of hours exploring the historic site. It is a very interesting visit but due to the high walk ways with low parapet wall it could be dangerous for children. Once you have finished your visit walk down the hill and enjoy the views.

A long climb. It's a fair way up the hill from the main centre, but it's still walkable and well worth it. The route coming up through Alfama is full of character and cobblestones.Once you've wound your way to the top, there's a few lookout spots, lots of restaurants, and all before you get to the ticket office for the Castle.Still the view is something else. Definitely visit.

DO NOT MISS!. Castelo de Sao Jorge is a most see sight in Lisboa. Just the view along is worth the price of admission. Go early or you will wait in a long like to purchase your tickets. The castelo is huge and in perfect condition. Make sure you walk all around the castle. I hope you will be able to see the wild peacocks and have a cappuccino in the snack bar.

Great, sunny day exploring Castel and streets of Alfama. Beautiful castle and really great journey through Alfama to get there - get tram 28 if tramping up hills is not your style (we live in South Lakes, England - so hills are a daily occurrence for us!) Lemon trees and orange blossom was made all the better with some fab sunny weather - took picnic and noticed others doing the same - great venue for a picnic!!!!! Castle is really interesting and worth the €20 for a family ticket - guide leaflets in different languages are free!!!!! Peacocks were roaming and showing their full tails!!!! Called in Church of Se on the way down after exploring beautiful tiled houses in Alfama - very interesting!!!! Best day of week long stay in Lisbon!!!

Historical and beautiful views. I took the trolley tour that stops here and other places in the Alfama. This is a wonderful place to wander through, climb the stairs to the battle turrets and read the amazing ancient history of the fort and hilltop civilization from before the castle/fortGreat views of the city and of other parts of the Alfama. Don't miss the "wine with a view" opportunity. I made good use of the plastic wine glass for the rest of my visit in Porutgal.

Great views but not much to see. The views to all sides are great but there is actually not much to see for 8,5€.. As the castle used to be a military station there are no frescoes, mosaics.. Nothing but walls to climb on.

Very impressed. Took Tram 28, and walked up the hills to the castle - interesting sites on the way up. So interesting to see the surroundings of Lisbon from the different vantage points. Well worth the time and effort to see this scenic landmark.
History . Good experience to know and understand more about Portuguese culture. Great views, gardens and museum.

Nice way to spend a couple of hours. Well preserved castle, sitting high up overlooking Lisbon. Reasonably priced at approx €8. Access is allowed in all areas of the castle, and from here you have great views of the city. There is also a strong contingent of resident peacocks which is nice.

Marvelous view over the city. To me, this castle is a must. The grounds itself are quite interesting and you can see pretty well that there used to be a castle here with its great walls. We went early in the morning (the castle just opened) and it was still quite. This made the visit so much nicer. We had all the time for ourselves to have a look over the city, and what a view. I believe in the afternoons it can be quite busy with tourists. Tickets without reduction are around 7-8 euros.
View from the Past. Walk through the Castle takes you back in time. Lot of walking, up and down hill. its worth. Great photo locations around. ideal for a late afternoon or early morning.

Great views and a different kind of castle. This castle is very different from any others I have visited, loads of great views of Lisbon and lots of places to climb. Come in the morning or late afternoon so there is no queue and less people to fight the view-points over.

Nice castle, with average musuem. Yes, it is 8,50 euro, but what do you expect? It is a tourist attraction. There is a museum to wander through and a lot of castle walls to walk along. There was an exhibit from the Moor period that was closed.As a tip, if you want to see the camera obscura of Lisbon, you must go before 5:00 pm. We missed this when we went.
Wine with a view!. The best thing was buying a glass of port and looking at the view at sunset! And we got to keep the glass that says "Wine with a View". The view was beautiful.
High on the hill. Well worth a visit but don't walk it cos it's very steep. There is a bus that goes up to gate. Fab views. Lots of places to eat. You can feel the history

Wear walking shoes. Plan a couple to 3 hours of walking it is up and down. Take the tiny tram or the hop on. then plan to walk up the small roads to the top. Not for the weak. Wheel chairs may have trouble as the roads are cobled

Nice views, but overrated.. We enjoyed the views, but there's not much there besides the view and the castle walls. It was a long, difficult walk to get there as well. The miradouro of Sao Pedro de Alcantara is a better, more accessible view. And that one is free!

Beautiful area with ruins and a castle. Beautiful area full with ruins and quite large castle to search through and climb to the towers. Splended view over the town. There is also a cafe on the site. Well worth the entrance fee.

We stormed the castle. You should,too.. The worst part of our trip to the castle was that we didn't put 2-3 hours into our schedule for this visit. We were there for maybe 30 minutes, when really, we should have just kicked back up top and stared at the amazing view. The castle itself is a feast for the eyes and imagination, but the glorious view is, by itself, worth the trip to Lisbon.And don't take a cab up; you'll want to savor the charming, historic scenery in this area of the city.

Great views of the City. We like castles, and there were a lot of walls to walk around, and stairs to climb and descend: maybe a little vertiginous in places. The best bits for me were just inside the entrance: the panoramic views over the city and beyond. Added to this a free guide, the chance to be guided around the archaeological sites, shady places to sit and watch the (tourist) world go by, and even noisily displaying peacocks, and it was time well spent, even knowing that it has largely been rebuilt.

Breathtaking view of Lisbon!. From the Castelo de Sao Jorge you can see a magnificent 360 degrees view of Lisbon. You can walk around the bastions, visit the museum and even eat at the restaurant. All around the castle there are plenty of nice souvenir shops and local cuisine tavernas. Definitely worth visiting.

Amazing!. Loved, loved it! Me and my friends visited Lisbon a few weeks ago. This is was one of the places we've visited. Easy to find and it is worth the steep walk! What we loved about it is of course the view of the entire city but also the street artists, where you can by great art work. My favorite was the artist who did graphics with coffee!

Pleasent. There are nice views from the castle, but Lisbon is full of view points, you cannot see the views without paying the entrance fees.The castle is largely rebuilt, there doesn't seem to be much of the original castle left. There is a dark, dingy little cafe with small pack of crisps for 1.60 euros, its better value to buy a meal.If you have the energy it is worth walking the battlements. There isn't a lot of explanation about what you are seeing.It costs under 9 euros to enter.

A must see. We walked up to this castle from the main center of town. It is a little difficult to find since some signs were not there but it has a wonderful 360 degree panoramic view of Lisbon at the top. The castle is well maintained with plenty of space. It has a restaurant although we did not eat there. Cost was 8.50 euros.

Historic Castle. My son and husband really enjoyed climbing up to the ramparts and exploring. If you are into old ruins, this is a great place to go. Good views from the top. Ignore the Roman Ruins at the back--much ado about not much.
Great views. . Well worth a visit. Good value. Well preserved castle, lovely view ober tue whole city. We were impressed.

A great place to see, but not much to learn.... If you want to have amazing views of Lisbon, there are a plenty of "miradouros" around the city. However, Castelo de Sao Jorge beats them all - it provides amazing views, especially in the afternoon and around sunset.Great thing about Castelo is that you can walk the walls and courtyards and if you are travelling with kids, they will totally enjoy it.However, if you are into history (as I personally am) you might get a bit disappointed: you'll learn very little here. Apart from one information panel at the entrance with some general information and overview, and one additional in the "archeological" site, there is nothing to read and learn about the place, when certain things were built, what was their purpose, etc. Okay, I didn't see the museum inside (the kids didn't feel like that), maybe it provides more info, but if you are information hungry, get yourself a guidebook or simply resort to learning online, and spend your time here simply enjoying the views and the green.

Great Views - Scary Wall walks - Camera Obscura. The views of Lisbon are breathtaking at this castle. You can see the Santa Justa lift, the Commercial square, and other noted sights around Lisbon. The railings on the castle wall are very low and may be intimidating to those afraid of heights, especially with many people passing in different directions. The camera obscura is located on the second story of the castle. You have to go into the castle fortress, go to the far right corner and then up the stairs to the middle of the building. The room only holds 20 people and it takes 20 minutes per tour, where the tour can be in English, Spanish or Portuguese depending upon the time of day. Camera Obscura is a huge box camera where through pulleys and levers it can view the cityscape of Lisbon. It is really amazing to see how it operates (moving, focusing) and even more entertaining when you can see people walking in the streets of Lisbon from afar. The castle takes about a 1/2 day to see. The line for tickets to the castle can get long so if you can get there when it opens you should have no problem, especially since the town does not seem to get active until 10 am. The tram can get you up to the castle but you still have a lot to walk uphill. It is best to get mini bus 737 that is located on the square by the Rossio station; it is not crowded like the tram and it is the closest drop off to the ticket office.

History and Amazing Views!. We explored the castle on the afternoon after we arrived. Unfortunately, it was cold, windy and raining. We were dressed properly and ventured on but could only imagine how special it would be on a nice day! We enjoyed exploring anyway!
Part of Lisbon visit. Located in beautiful Alfama. The castle is worth a visit. Gorgeous view on Lisbon. A very busy place. Go either early in the morning or late afternoon.
Old castle at top of city. We took a tuk-tuk up and walked down. Great views of city and lots of places to take pictures. Be ready to walk a lot of stairs.

King Arthur's envy (Castelo de Sao Jorge). Climbing to the top of the old town on the East side is the beautiful Castelo de Sao Jorge, 'St George' first day there was quite a queue, but the second day we arrived early and didn't queue at all, after paying which was not a great amount and picking up the information booklet we wandered through, up and down stairs to the towers, around the battlements, some fabulous views over the city and the river, came across some (tame?) peacocks and peahens, went down to the archeological site, remains from the iron age, the Moorish occupation, spent time in the permanent museum of artifacts, had coffee in the cafe, restaurant opens later in the day, I think this huge ruin of an ancient fortification is a must visit when in Lisboa, I managed to walk up to it from the river front but did on another occasion take the tram ride which is much easier.

Visit just before dusk. We visited just before dusk. The light was amazing and the castle grounds were quiet. The views across the city are fantastic. We were able to walk the battlements and take pictures and pause to admire the views in peace. We left as it became dark and the peacocks were roosting and calling to each other. Lovely!

Excellent! Amazing views!. I highly recommend visiting the Castle! The views are incredible and there is a lot of walkability within the Castle (although a fair amount of stairs so keep that in mind). There were also 5 or 6 peacocks in the trees at the Castle! It was awesome. I can't say enough about the views. To get there, either take the Tram or, if you're up for it, you can walk which is what we did. It's not that far just steep but we enjoyed the walk. This is a must-see!

Great vistas and good value. Awesome overviews of the city from the moment you enter the castle precinct. Try to get there early to avoid the queues at the ticket office and give yourself plenty of time to wander the Castelo. Be aware that there are a lot of steps, open stairways and uneven surfaces in places.Whilst the walls and structure itself are great, the tour of the archaeological dig set and permanent exhibition are good too.The cafe is good quality but don't leave your food / drink unattended as pigeons are waiting to pounce! The peacocks amongst the trees and café seating area are beautiful but be aware that they roost in the branches and do their business from on high!Information boards e.g about different areas of the castle, would have been good (guidebooks available at extra cost. )€8.50 to get in ( adult); fancy coffees and cake + bon bon for 2, approx €10. Allow 2 - 3 hour, or more.

plan to use a tram or elevador. Best to take an tram to the top and walk back after your visit. We were lucky to find an elevator (not the tram type) a few blocks northwest of the castle. This took us up approx 6 stories and saved a lot of huffing and puffing. The castle is more of a fortress with commanding views and a lot of history. The museum is very impressive and included with admission.

Well worth a visit!. An uphill walk to get there, but well worth the effort. The castle was amazing with lots to see and we spent a happy couple of hours exploring. We felt it was good value and would recommend a visit.

It is an okay castle. I am not sorry that we took the time to see this and it DOES have an amazing view of the city. It is pleasant enough walking around the grounds of the castle but at the end of the day it was not all that special if your time is limited. Maybe it would be with kids.
Great view. Great views but big queue and a steep walk up the hill. Great cafe bars near by so worth the trip.queue moved quickly so don't panic

Beautiful view. Got in line for tickets, 2 euro discharge because of LC card. So 6,5 euro per adult. We didn't have to wait very long, although it was Easter weekend and busy. From the castle you have a beautiful view over the city. You can wander around quite some time over the old walls and along the archeological site. There are guided tours if you like, there is a nice café, toilets and the site is very neat and we'll kept. Great for kids, they can stroll around and climb on rocks, walls and canons. We mind of missed some historical information, but we didn't do the camera obscura cause of the long wait so maybe we would have found that there.

Go early . We got there first thing in the morning. Took bus 737 from Praca da Figueira (next to rossio square) and it dropped us off 1min from the castle. The views are amazing and the less crowded the better. They have a periscope with guides (20min presentation) that show you the whole city in real time. Very cool but check the times and languages for the presentations plus they only allow 20people at a time.

Great views of the city. We planned to take the tram up to the castle from the city center but the line was quite long so we opted for the city bus, which worked out well and dropped us just a short walk from the entrance to the castle. The views from atop the castle are remarkable! I did think the entrance price (about 8 Euro each) was a bit high. There is a nice cafe within the castle walls and there is even a "Wine With A View" kiosk where you can get a glass of wine to enjoy while you stroll around the castle grounds.

Great views of Lisbon but not what I Expected.. The castle is not a real castle, it is more a fortress. Located at one of the highest points of Lisbon and you can see the whole city from there. There is a charge of 10 euros to enter its grounds which is ok, since they are doing extensie restauration works at the castle. Be aware that the way to reach Castelo de Sao Jorge is very steep and you need to be fit to get there in one piece, if you have elderly in your group i would advise to take a taxi from Rossio as it can be very difficult for the elderly to reach the site.

gigantic castle with fighting knights. went here with my girlfriend on my first visit to portugal. The castle is huge and inside there were knights showing off their skills in the art of swordfights. The view from the top over Lisboa is awesome. Highly recommended!

A nice viewpoint. Overllooking the oldest parts of Lisbon, as well as most of the metropolitan area, the tagos river with its various bridges and the port of Lisbon as well. This is a nice place to visit

Well worth a visit.. Great place to visit and spend a few hours wandering around this historic castle. You can stay at ground level or walk around the walls taking advantage of the numerous viewing points for stunning views of Lisbon from all angles,worth the climb up the hills just for that. The walk up to the castle is very steep so you might want to take the tram as an alternative.

Excellent Views of the City. This mid-11th C Moorish castle stands out against the backdrop of Lisbon. Visitors from North-America (who have no castles) will appreciate its age, history. and cultural development. However if you have been to a number of previous (Moorish) castles, you will probably find this like many of the rest. Still the views of the city are great and is a good way to start your tour of Lisbon...but perhaps after a Free walking tour of the city.

Interesting place. Nice views of the city from here. Interesting attraction here in one of the towers...the Ulysses Tower is the camera obscura which gives a 360 degree view of Lisbon in real time. Get the 737 bus from Praça Figueira.. it drops you right at the door so avoin=ds the steep climb.

Castley. I must admit I was castled out and exhausted by the day we visited this castle. There were lots of stairs and high dangerous places. I wouldn't recommend taking your small or rambunctious children there. Much of the exhibit was closed on our visit. The interior of the castle interested me little, (if you are a history buff it is likely for you) but the views outside overlooking Lisbon are spectacular - so go for that reason alone.

Go for the view!. A bit of a hike to get to, but well worth it for the view over Lisbon. 8.50 euro well spent. It is not in restored shape but I liked the crumbling glory of it all. I took the 12 tram and got off at the Fado museum. It was a 5-10 min walk from there, well signposted.

Great Lisbon view. I really recommend after a trip on the 28 tram to see some views of Lisbon. Is a Castle full of story and rebuild with anyrhing they could found. Was taken from Arabic people thanks to the sacrifice of Martim Moniz. Was stuk in the door :/ The view to Tagus river is breath takin.

Best place for views over Lisbon. Although we were told later (on the free Sandemans New Lisbon walking tour) that the castle is a fake, and never a real defensive fort, we enjoyed the visit. On a sunny afternoon the walks on the extensive walls gave super views over the city. Some of the steps are steep and don't have handrails so it may not be suitable for everyone.

Fairytale palace. We unfortunately got a tuk tuk here as we were told it was a very steep hill. Don't!!!! 15 € for a 5 minute journey. Absolute rip off!!! The castle itself was very interesting and the views were amazing, however its not a great place to visit if you don't like heights. Lots of little restaurants around the foot of the castle, serving nice food, if a little pricey but shop around. Lots of annoying people trying to sell you sunglasses etc while you are eating though. The walk back down the hill into the city is lovely and you can visit some very pretty churches, nice ice cream shops etc.

Beautiful view over Lisbon. If you visit Lisbon you definitely need to go to Castelo de Sao Jorge. The place is full of tourists because from there you can see the whole city. The views are magical and you can see major attractions of the city. Take your time walking around the castle and climbing up its towers, you won't be disappointed!

Beautiful example of portuguese history. We walked from our hotel in rossio up to the castle which was a lovely walk, passing through old streets with traditional lisbon houses. The entry fees to the castle are very reasonable and the queue was bearable. There is a lovely cafe at the castle which we stopped off at for a croissant and a drink, again very reasonably priced. There were some signs that gave a little information about the history of the castle in the very old area however I wish there had been more all around the castle as this was lacking. If you want this it may be a good idea to purchase a guide book from the ticket office. I wish we had done!
Great views. Interesting as all forts are, it is really about the views of Lisbon. See all around the port from up here, take the trams to get here

Great view. Not great in the wet.. Climbed the hill on the day I visited in the sun. Lovely to stop along the way and see show. When I got to the castle tickets were easy and quick to get. The terrace park at the entry of the complex is amazing as are the friendly peacocks that roam the area. The weather then changed and became cold and wet. Obviously no fault of the venue. The thing about wet in Lisbon is that the pavements then become fatal. The castle is no exception to this. The archeological dig requires you to be there at specific times to gain access. At the end of my visit the sun was out again and the terrace area was just brilliant and the views are outstanding. Just be aware the pavement and more importantly the steps. And of course the crowds.

Castellated de Sao Jorge. Went there on our first day in Lisbon. It is an ancient fort overlooking the city. It is quite imposing and has a commanding view of the city. It is a classic appearing fortress that is very intact in terms of the fortress walls. The interior is mostly open courtyards and there are no indoor or covered areas of the ancient castle. It is very close to the city center Lisbon, the view is great and of historic interest. While there, walk to the Alfama neighborhood or take a trip on the old tram system.
Interesting Place. Very nice place, has a great view to Lisbon. I'm not a particular fan of this kind of places but I think its a must in your visit.
It worths a visit!. Easy access to great views of Lisbon, full of history!Perfect for a drink in the afternoon if weather is perfect.
Worth a visit. We walked up to castle, the walk is lovely. Quite steep. But worth it, we walked through Alfama, very interesting, a must see

Good site to visit in Lisbon. Really great views over the city and an interesting castle to walk around. Lots of Peacocks in the grounds who seem to display their tails all day long. Nice cafe and selection of food available. Its a very steep walk up though even if you take the tram, suggest a taxi if you are not good with steep hills.

Worth some time in Lisbon. We walked to the castle and after getting lost many many times, finally came up the back way only to find out we had to walk literally 3/4 of the way around to find the sole entrance. It's up & downhill so our calves were killing us!! But it was so worth it.The view from the castle is amazing. The stairs up and down in the castle would definitely NOT meet North American safety standards and for anyone with vertigo, could be paralyzing in places but the view from the top of all points of this castle is worth risking the trip up. We just missed the 5 PM guided tour of the archaeological excavation happening in one portion of the castle with the oldest artifacts and history, so that was a bummer. But walking around, reading about how this castle survived the earthquake, seeing how defensible the castle really was, and walking the stone parapets was an experience not to be missed. I don't know how so many women wore heels to this site.The highlight- peacocks roaming around pathways and lazing high above trees. Who sees that in the wild anyway? And if you can stay for sunset, the pictures are stunning, as is the view of the city and the river. Cost: for a family of four- 8 Euro. Time spent- about 2 hours total.

Freedom,Interesting and great. access all areas, including walking on the roof! there is also a large range of timeframes with the objects on show, the castle and the roman remains,well worth a visit!

Great views. We wanted the exercise, so ignored the easy way up by tram. After walking up the hill, the views were well worth the effort. We were very lucky with the weather - it was perfect. Fantastic views in all directions.There is a very nice, and inexpensive cafe. Beware of peacocks perching in the tree!Not one for the disabled. Lots of steps.

Impressive Ruins and View. I walked up to the castle which is a bit of a jaunt however can really see all the views at different points and shops along the way. The castle is well preserved interesting to walk about the different areas and structures. The exhibits were nice and it is worth the visit. It was fun to climb around the castle and imagine what it was like trying to defend it.

No words to describe. This castle was my first attraction visited in Lisbon. My first impression of the city was the best one I could have!! Even though the castle is just ruins, doesn't matter, it is impressive anyway. But the best thing about it is the breathtaking view of the city and of the Tejo River from the top. You will simply get stucked on there and won't want to leave there anymore!! Take time in there, sit down, relax and appreciate the place. You will love it!!!

Fantastic for kids. We spent a morning here with our 2 smalls boys (3 and 4). They absolutely loved it. You can climb up and walk along the top of the castle walls which I was a little weary about with the children and the steps are pretty steep but we managed okay, taking it slowly. There is a gift shop and restaurant as well as a few stalls selling ice cream and drinks. We walked from the centre which was a bit of a trek and up steep steps so I would recommend getting a taxi.

Morning Visit. Visited the castle on a dry winters morning. It was quiet early on but got busier as it got nearer to 12pm. Caught the tram up and walked through a derelict area not threatening just interesting with old neon signs. Dont miss the urinal on the way to the castle gates. The castle is fine with some good views. Make sure to take in the camera obscura.

Great views. Having already walked up to Carmo on the opposite hill I took a taxi from Rossi for under 4 euros-no toiling up the hill for me. The views of the mist-shrouded river and the monument of Christ across the river were memorable and the wandering peacocks added interest. The archaeological site was informative. Do be wary of the uneven ground and maybe pickpockets crowded outside the entrance to the castle. From the Castle I took an exciting and speedy tuk-tuk ride to St Vincent de Fora to see the splendid tiles before walking down the Alfama. Both the Castle for its views and the tuk-tuk ride across the narrow streets I would highly recommend.
Beautifull well preserved castle. Impressive well preserved castle with views on different heights. On the walls are still several canons and inside a nice historical museum.

Beautiful Castle!. Be prepared to walk up the hill to this amazing castle. Comfortable shoes or sneakers are a necessity as the roads are all paved and up hill incline. Once you reach this palace, it's a sight to see both inside and out. The grounds are beautifully cared for and the views from this gorgeous castle are a sight to see in Portugal. Lunch at the restaurant was also a gastronomic feast. As with other eateries I've reviewed in Portugal, it seems the presentation is an art form as these dishes were also beautiful to see as well as to eat. Tip: that squawking you hear coming from the rooftops are the peacocks that are roaming the property!

Very interesting and well-preserved castle. Fantastic views. Castle is very well preserved with lots of ramparts etc to walk along and the views are really fantastic in all directions. Entry fee very reasonable (8.50 Euros). Bit of a climb to get to the castle but obviously taxi is an option for some. This is not suitable for people with bad knees, etc. Also wear shoes with a good grip. Climbing up the steps is ok, going down the steps is not much fun in city shoes. Some climbs down not good for anyone with vertigo.
Lisbon in your head) . Nice place, where interesting coastal. Fantastic views you can see all Lisbon city. We are really like to spend the time. Recommended!!!
Best view of Lisbon. A bit of a hike to the castle but once there you have a great view of the city. Easy to walk around and the literature provided was excellent

Big castle with big views. Great views over town, but don't be afraid of lots of steps - some without handrails . Had a good wander round also make sure your footwear works too, as we saw a lady with heels in serious strife trying to negotiate uneven steps not fun.

Informative. The trip on the 28E tram is fun, if you're prepared to be squished. The castle is not like many of the other castles in Europe, it is really an Arsenal. A lookout station. Terrific views of the city stretching below. The special tour of the archeological site is informative, and well worth the time. It helps to clarify all the influences that have occurred over the centuries in Lisbon.

True Royalty. What a view of the city-this historical attraction is a must see for all. You have to walk up but its worth every cent. There are great little restaurants to have great seafood surrounding the castle.

Weekend trip. Walked up here was worth the long hike up the hills to get here didn't realise I could have used my yellow bus ticket for a discount views are unbelievable. Would definitely recommend it to others travelling to lisbon
An interesting afternoon. A fascinating look into the history of Lisbon. Situated at the top of the old part of the city with some spectacular views across the city

Amazing views of Lisbon. The Castelo Is Nothing But A Wall Structure. Located at the top of the Alfama district it offers breathtaking views of Lisbon. A lot of history here so worth the visit. We took the trolley up but chose to walk down through Alfama back to our apartment in the Baixa area. Very steep streets.

Beautiful views over Lisboa. A fantastic and well preserved Castle however it is not so good in the pouring rain which it was on the day we visited. The walls surrounding the castle give amazing views of all of Lisboa. Take the famous tram 28 up the hill to get there. 20 euro for a family ticket (4). Also has an Moorish archaeological site towards the side of the castle and well worth a visit. Cafe on site - reasonably priced.

In the top 10 for sights to see. On a 2 day visit it is a must see. Great view, a bit expensive to enter though. Fabulous walk down into the old town afterwards. Wold recommend the 28 tram highly to get there

Nice place to visit, get some good views, and some exercise. It was a very nice walk to the top of the hill to see the castle. Interesting history. Great views of the city. We went in March and it was not too crowded on a cool. sunny afternoon.

Nice castle. Nice castle in a good place for tourism. To get here you need to get the tuk tuk, the streetcars or by cab, but this last one can be a little bit expensive. You can also walk but be aware it is a long walk and it is a steep terrain. Entrance fee was 8.50 euros for adults. Stores around for a coffee, beer or souvenirs. Inside you can visit and get info about the history of the place and see this fantastic architecture. It worth a visit for sure.

Castle offering hidden treasures. Fantastic well kept castle. Admission €8.50 adults. A truly great place to visit. Lots to explore and a chance to see the city via a member of staff, who will show you via a 360 degree view of the city for free via a telescope. Amazing view. This mini tour last 15-20 minutes and is taken in 3 languages. Tip - queue on the right side of the entrance door as numbers of visitor at one time limited to 20 people. Peacocks roam freely and if your lucky will display their beautiful feathers for you to see.

Great Castle. We have visited various castles in Europe. This was amongst the really good ones. Super scenic, great views, and plenty to see. It is a bit of hike up there but a scenic walk through older parts of the city. There is also public transportation or you can shorten the walk with an elevator, but we enjoyed seeing the neighborhoods on the way up. If you go to Lisbon make this a stop.
Best attraction in Lisbon. The castle itself is interesting but the best thing is the views you get over Lisbon. Go for a walk in the nearby Alfamo too

Expensive - there are other great Viewpoints in LIsbon. This is a very expensive way to get a view on the city. If you look up 'Lisboa Miradouros' you will find plenty of other great places to see the city, have coffee, and not wait in line to get ripped off. The idea of a castle is romantic and attractive, but I find admission very pricey and the cafeteria disappointing. Lisbon is built at the foot of seven hills, meaning there are so many other spots from which to see the city: - Miradouro da Basílica da Estrela (+ info) - Miradouro da Penha de França (+ info) - Miradouro da Rocha de Conde de Óbidos (+ info) - Miradouro da Senhora do Monte (+ info) - Miradouro da Torre de Belém (+ info) - Miradouro das Portas do Sol (+ info) - Miradouro de Santa Catarina (+ info) - Miradouro de Santa Clara (+ info) - Miradouro de Santa Luzia (+ info) - Miradouro de Santo Amaro (+ info) - Miradouro de Santo Estêvão (+ info) - Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara (+ info) - Miradouro do Castelo de São Jorge (+ info) - Miradouro do Jardim do Torel (+ info) - Miradouro do Monte Agudo (+ info) - Miradouro do Padrão dos Descobrimentos (+ info) - Miradouro do Parque Eduardo VII de Inglaterra (+ info)
Back in time at this fortress, magnificent views over the city!. Back in time at this fortress, nice garden for a romantic stroll, magnificent views over the city: a must see/do!

A nice place with good views. If the weather's nice definitely head here. There are lots of lovely photo opportunities plus kids seemed to love roaming around the turrets and look out spots. One thing though, wear very sensible shoes, the ground is incredibly uneven and rocky and I saw people tripping over all the time. I would be very careful with elderly people!By the way there's a great ice cream shop round the corner!!
Top View!!. On the top a hill is located this very old roman castel with a superb view over Lisbon city and Tagus river.
Great piece of history. Beautiful castle set high above Lisbon, definitely worth getting the tram up to it as the walk is very steep! The grounds are lovely and the views are breathtaking!

GREAT CASTLE. Very interesting castle , great views overlooking the city. , museum wasn't the best ive visited but was interesting,was hoping we were able to go to Archlogical dig site but it was blocked off

Fantastic views, worth the arduous walk up. A Moorish castle with fantastic views of Lisbon and a good way to see monuments and bridge. The 360 degree 10min show was interesting, the peacocks great to photograph. We enjoyed walking around and taken in the views. Relatively inexpensive to enter, I think 14 euros. Streets around the castle are great as is the Tram 28 cafe!

Views to die for. Worth the visit. Very interesting Moorish castle on the top of a hill. The views from the battlements are fantastic. There are shady places to sit and a cafe with Peacocks outside. If you're mobility isn't very good, it may not be the place for you. Lots of steps and uneven surfaces. However, if you can't or don't want to climb you can admire the views.

It dominates the city. We managed to walk all the way up from Praca figueira up to the castle and then down to Alfama. The views from the top are magnificent. You need at least 3 to 4 hours pro see everything. We ran out of time as it was our last day. Suggest see it early in your stay.
Stunning views!. I highly recommend visiting the castle. The views of Lisbon and fantastic. You can buy a bottle of wine and sit for awhile and soak up the sun and the views from your castle perch.

Excellent view on the city. There're some exhibitions on the history and occupation of the castle and also a place where some ancient buildings were restored however the most people come here to enjoy the great view on the city which you may see from the walls of the castle.

Excellent viewing point for whole of Lisbon.. We walked up to this castle, which truly looks like a castle from afar, even if it was never inhabited. You get a feel of life back then, from the stalls and trades vying for your attention just inside the grounds the noise and bustle give the atmosphere of everyday life as it was. Not the best for walking round due to the extremely uneven cobbles under foot. The views more than make up for all this.
A castle in the middle of the city. Castelo de São Jorge it's a wonderful historical place where you have a wonderful view of Lisbon. On your way there, you will go by some beautiful churchs.

A historic icon of Lisbon. The castle is within walking distanse from downtown Lisbon and you pass through narrow streets with small local bars and restaurants. Herre you can rest and have some refreshments.The castle is spectacular and on sundays you can watch historic plays with the warriors. Beautiful oversight over Lisbon. Worth a visit
Fabulous overview of city. It's worth the hike up to this fort which overlooks the whole city of Lisbon. Climb and walk the ramparts to get a true impression of life in earlier centuries.

Great views cold beers!. The walk up to the castle was fine for us young ones but the less agile people will benefit from the public transport. The views from the top were unreal. The cafe sells meals and cold drinks. Best way to take in the views over portugal

Beautiful Views. The walk up through the winding medieval streets can be hard work - they're VERY steep - but it's definitely worth it just for the beautifully preserved historical town, and the art dotted around. Be warned though: you have to pay to get into the actual park around the castle, the views from it are amazing but you can just as lovely views for free as you walk around - although they won't be as panoramic.If you're going to pay to get in I suggest you take a packed lunch and make an afternoon of it, you'll certainly be treated to a gorgeous sunset!

A hirtorical moment. It is a Moorish castle at the hilltop overlooking the historic centre of Lisbon and Tagus River and other monuments. Looking down from one site you can see a typical !quartier" where you can find Chine,e, Indian, Afro and, of course, Portuguese population and very interesting and cheap shops and restaurants, supermarkets. You have a 360º view over Lisbon.
Great afternoon spent here. The views are fantastic and there a lots of towers to climb and explore. Beautiful pheasants walking around were a pleasant and unexpected bonus!

Tom Bridge . Well worth a visit . Walked to it and it is very hilly so take your time ! But the views across the city from the ramparts are breathtaking and well worth the effort . A must do if you visit Lisbon .

Beautiful views. Its quite a steep climb after getting off the tram but worth it. The cadtle is lovely and affords beautiful views over Lisbon. We stopped and had a glass of wine from the stand up there sitting out looking over the city. Its cheap to enter unlike castles in this country!

Do not miss . Amazing views, beautiful buildings. Worth the straining walk uphill. Take the tram part of the way and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere on the old, lovely trams.Truly one of the highlights of Lisbon!!
History & View. Definitely a great site to spend some time, to make a pic-nic or simple breath the history of this place. Fantastic views in all directions.
Amazing Views of the City. A super place to explore on a sunny day. The views of the city are incredible. Take the tram (or bus if you're feeling adventurous!) to the top as it's a long climb.

Great visit. Nr 1 on my list. Very cool and price worthy. Really great coming here a sunny day. One of my top visits in Lisbon. The view is great, was here in February so it wasn't that much visitors. Heard is hell during summer. My cat loves the place.
Great views. Worth a visit just for the view. The castle itself is just another castle! As long as it is a nice day. The footing is very uneven, so take care.

Thoroughly enjoyed our 4 hour visit. The entrance was €5 for seniors. For this you can walk around the site as long as you like, enjoy the great views of Lisbon, visit the small museum, and join one of the several (free) tours of the roped off areas with a charming and knowledgable guide.There is also a cafe where we had excellent coffees and cakes, at very reasonable prices. We sat outside and enjoyed the peacocks strolling around the customers!Note that it does get a bit windy up there so take an extra jumper.We had visited the castle on our last visit to Lisbon, but didn't have enough time to really appreciate it. So very pleased to have a long and relaxed visit. The guided tour was a real bonus. We didn't realise they did them - you just wait by the sign and go with the guide.
Go there for the views. Impressive view. Other than that just another castle as can be found on a lot of spots around europe.

Simple, visit only with sunny weather . It was on my Lisbon bucket list and finally decided to visit it, although some friends told me it wasn't worth. You enjoy a beautiful view over the city, but, a part from that, it doesn't have much to offer.The archeology museum is extremely small and simple.The only very interesting thing was the experience in the Cámara Escura of the Ulysses Tower, but be prepared to wait in line.

Amazing views of the city!. Whilst the castle itself is just like most castles, the view is what sold this for us. You have to pay to get into the castle grounds, which was around 8/9 euros and whilst this wasn't worth seeing the castle, it was worth it for the view. You can see the whole of the city from all directions and a sea of Portugese standard terra cotta roof tops. There's plenty of places to sit down and enjoy the views, which was very much needed as we climbed the numerous steps. Not for the faint hearted, elderly or less mobile but definitely worth a visit for the views. Tip - get the tram 28 to the castle from its start at Martin Monitz for an authentic ride round the backstreets of Alfama and Garca. At one point we could touch the walls it was so narrow and added to the whole experience.

The most scenic and unforgettable experience!. This ancient castle provides you with the most breathtaking views of the city. We went there in March and there were not many people around. So, we enjoyed walking through the place for a good 3h. Make sure you get coffee and pastries in the cafe, they are fantastic!

Gorgeous view. Great view over the entire city. Perfect picture taking opportunity, and good exercise climbing up the steep hill. Once in the castle you can sip a glass of wine overlooking the city. Many steep steps to climb in order to get to the gorgeous scenery.

Nice view. Walked around this site on a windy monday in March. The Castle is nice on itself but the view of Lisbon is just amazing. Personally i thought it was a little expensive as the entrance fee is 8,50; i can understand they need it for preserving the site but i found it a little expensive as we where with a small group.

Has to be done and worth it. Gorgeous view of the city. Cost 8eur in but was worth it. You can walk the castle walls. There is a restaurant there and a can that sells wine. We enjoyed a glass of vino with the view and you can keep the glass

Worth the price . I was lucky to have a beautiful sunny day fora nice walk through the castle grounds. The views are spectacular from many vantage points. We were limited on time, so budget a couple hours to give this historic site the time it deserves.

Sunset & Dusk. A night tour of Castelo de Sao Jorge. We visited in December. It was lovely! Warm but breezy! Upon recommendation of the Wine with a View cart we timed it to see the sun set across the city. Very beautiful views across the city and the bridge. Very romantic! Once the sun had gone down we decided to explore the castle grounds and building....health & safety doesn't seem to exist here, and to be honest, quite glad of that on this occasion as was pretty special going around on our own and seeing parts that would definitely be off limits back home! Touring at night and the season meant it was fairly quiet but do be careful if going so late as you really need to watch your step. Worth a visit. Big climb up but makes it all the better when you can reward yourself with a prosecco at the top!

Worth the walk. I am just going to echo all the other reviews. Its quite a hike up to it but most definitely worth it. The views are spectacular. The "Castle" is actually just a fortress with open grounds and high walls you can walk all around. The palace is in ruins so not quite what i expected. The fortress is in remarkable shape and you can climb just about everywhere. The towers are mostly open and give you great 360 degree views. The tower of st lawerence is not for the unstable but worth the climb down.Thats about it. Great visit.
a great day out. Came here on the first day of our visit. Really great experience and fascinating to learn the history of Lisbon. It is a steep climb so get your walking boots on!

Wonderful view, beautiful fortification, but overpriced. In spite of its name, it's not a castle in strict sense. It's more like a fortification. There's not much more than walls. Still, it's quite nice and the view from the garden is one of the best in Lisbon (and I've been in each and every "miradouro" in the city). I strongly recommend going around sunset time. The only problem is the price, very high as usual in Lisbon.

Stunning views. Decided to walk up to the castle - quite a trek. You can get a bus, taxi or tuk tuk but it was a nice day. Not very well sign posted but it may have been the way we went.Thought it was quite expensive for entry- 8.50 euro per person, but you could make a day of it by taking some food and drink and lay in the sun.The views are stunning but it's not for those who haven't a head for heights, especially when it's windy. There is a cafe and souvenir shop and toilets (no charge). Well worth a visit for the views and photo opportunity...
Interesting castle with with panoramic view. Interesting history and design. Peacocks roam freely in grounds. Get tram up hill or use elevator nearby if you want to avoid climb!
Lisabon . From this place it is very easy to understand the greatest of the Lisbon. Use tram for climbing or for decent.

Worth a visit. Great place to visit in Lisbon, the views are amazing from the top as it overlooks the city. We could have easily spent longer there as there is so much to see. A lot of steps and walkways around the castle walls, some of them not for the faint hearted. Would be difficult for people with mobility problems as also some uneven ground.Plenty of places to stop and admire the surroundings and enjoy some refreshments. Enjoyed some coffee and one of the delicious Portuguese custard tarts, very moreish.

Medieval castle built by the Moors. Absolutely fantastic standard of original architecture. The museum was well presented and the story of 1000 years of history well told. Good value cafe. The ongoing investigations are now out of bounds due to idiots stealing the artefacts.

Really interesting worth a visit. We took a tuk tuk from Lisbon centre up to the castle which was fun. It's €8.95 each entry. Easy to spend a few hours there . Best views over LisbonNot great for those with limited mobility as steep steps and uneven ground
Wonderful views!. Take a walk up to the hill and Castelo de sao Jorge along narrow lovely old streets. The old castle is absolutely worth a visit and the views are stunning!

A história vista por dentro. A beaultifull place. Pleasant view. History lives in this place. It is possible to see all city, the river. From this place the old portugueses could see everything around their city and defeat it. Wonderfull! Necessary pay for entrance.

City castle. Great place to visit for all round views of the city. Everything was well maintained and the museum was small but interesting. Stopped for a snack in the cafe and we were entertained by the beautiful peacocks, or you could also get a drink from the 'wine with a view' van.

Best view of Lisbon. Of all the places I visited, I thought this one had the very best views of the city. It is an old castle built more than 900 years ago which has seen war and peace various times over. The locals have done a great job preserving the site and it looks in great shape given the age.The central plaza is a great place to unwind and have some ice cream or wine (which they sell by the glass). A bonus of having to pay to enter is that the tourist hawks aren't there, making this very peaceful.

Beautiful view. Perfect place to look on city,u can see so much from there. U need to pay 8,5 € for entrance but worth every euro. U can also have "wine with view" and it's excellent to take it and enjoy
Best views of the city. Impressive castle with amazing views of Lisbon. Should be number one on the list for any traveler. Discounted student entry so don't forget to bring a student card!
Love the view. A great trip to walk up to the castle. If you're there, enjoy the view, maybe with a wine! Liked that it was not too touristy.

Panoramic views of Lisbon. Our host at the B&B recommended this as the first stop for a visit to Lisbon to get the bird's eye view of the city layout. She also gave us the tip to get up there as the locals do - via a series of two lifts - the first is accessed via Rua dos Fanqueiros - (Elevador do Castelo) then switch to the lift located in the grocery store Pingo Doce - brings you almost to the top.

Castle. Interesting castle visit. The history was good and the views from the wall was great. There were a tonne of stairs though, so be prepared to get your cardio in when visiting the castle and Lisbon
Great views!. Great views from the castle - maybe a bit pricey for the ticket, but considering most other things are free...
Great castle. Nothing inside but a fantastic structure well worth the climb up the hill. We spent an hour walking along the wall

Castle Tour. Amazing stucture, fun place to explore! The view of Lisbon is beautiful from this vantage. Awe inspiring to stand where ancients have stood. Be prepared to walk up and down steep stairs! Look for the peacock with white plumage. He's friendly and he'll eat from your hand.
Interesting castle with easy access. Not really suitable for the disabled as it is a fortress, but the views over the Tagus and Lisbon are excellent.
Lovely view. Amazing place, bring us back to the 17th Century. I suggest you to come here on Summer. Easy to access and don't use high heels if you want take a walk around the castle :P

great place to start getting ones bearings. A pulse increasing walk up the Alfama streets, ticks off a number of sites of note. Turn a corner and face the Cathedral, turn another and find the tiled walls of one of the top viewing platforms, turn another and find understated stellar eating place and at the top of the hill you will be well rewarded at the Castle with stunning views in every direction. We hit upon an unexpected bonus with reasonably priced cherry brandy and port, to help fortify (haha) our bodies against the penetrating breeze on February.

Impressive well maintained medieval walls. On a nice sunny day, that's a must of the historical/touristical targets. The citadel and her ruins are unveiling a huge part ( if not the biggest ) of the portuguese glorious past. Since the Moorish occupation, through the four dynasties that followed and up to the 1947 Republic, those walls witnessed so many important moments that only passing along them and bearing in mind what we've previously read about them, you'll easily feel goose bumped. It's also well preserved, circuits are organized, and the views, absolutely impressive above the beautiful Lisboa !
Beautiful views. Beautiful views. Castle is huge, i think we spend more than hour inside. If You are under 25 don't forget to ask for discount :)
Spectacular views. A great walk through Lisbon to see this remarkable castle. The castle is well worth exploring. The 360 degree views of the city and the harbor were excellent.

Impressive setting. Take the 28 tram up the hill - beware of pickpockets, though.Wander up the last few yards from the viewpont , and there you are - wonderful vistas across the Tagus.However, it's not the Tower of London! Basically the castle has been returned to its medieval origins, but that measn there is little but walls there. You must have the guided tour which really bring s the place alive - puttiing it into historical context. Tours in English for monoglots. It's an easy ten minute stroll back to town as well.
A real Castle!. A great spot for a stroll around the battlements. Easy to access, not expensive and worth it for the great view over the city.
Amazing views!. Used the free lift from the supermarket to access the castle area. Enjoyed walking round the walls and towers which give panoramic vistas over the city.

Excellent reconstruction, beautiful view. Don't miss the free guided tour of the archeological site. It is very impressive.The rest of the castle is also very nice. The museum shows some interesting pieces.

Seen from a distance. Took the red bus up to the castle, but as pensioners we felt the walk on very uneven ground up and own the narrow street a little too taxing. We could have taken a tut tut but didn't feel it was worth it. still worth going up to this attractive hill village. Fascinating watching the trams go up and down the tiny winding street. Well worth the visit for the experience alone.

Walk through a beautiful old castle. Walking distance from our hotel (Memmo Alfama - highly recommend). It is a lot of walking, and some narrow, steep steps, so beware with small kids or the elderly, but you don't have to deal with the stairs, there is plenty to see on the ground level. There is an active archaeological dig inside the castle walls that dates back to 7 BC. The views from the top towers are beautiful. Definitely a must see if you're in Alfama.

Breath taking views. If you're looking for an opportunity to see the beautiful city of Lisbon , this is it! Wonderful scenery. Took the bus up to the castle from the center of town to the castle. Was a little disappointed as expected a little more of castle than fortress! But, that said the views are wonderful and the walk down back to town through the narrow roads and beautiful area of alfama was worth it!
Good views. Great place to get a panorama of the city down towards the river. I enjoyed having a coffee & admiring the view for an hour, after walking the grounds. Very relaxing!
lovely in the sunshine. We took a bus from town up to this castle. The weather was cold but sunny and we enjoyed walking around. It was possible to walk around the walls - but we did not do this.
Fantastic Views of Lisbon. Great mid evil castle with fantastic views of the Lisbon. One of the best Moorish castles I have ever visited. Can't leave without seeing this place.

Beautiful city views and history...what more could you want?. Strategically situated high over Lisbon, you get a real sense of how the old city used to be from here whilst being able to enjoy a great view of the modern city. Only 8.50 euros, the Castle is an interesting experience showing a mashup of different parts of history. For the fitness fanatics, it's a nice walk up the hill too.

A 'proper' castle!. If you've ever drawn a castle when you were young, this is what it would look like! Classic fortress style castle.
