These are several walkways and stairs and towers you can enter so could be quiet fun for older children to explore. This place gets really busy so choose your visit time carefully. The surrounding park is great - superb view of the city below!

Amazing views of Lisbon . A bit tricky to find the way in, I recommend to have a map with you.You'll have to 8€ per person (there are discount for families and groups, etc..)But it's worth the money, for the amazing views that you have over Lisbon from every single corner of the castle.I don't recommend it if you don't like height and steeply stairs.

Great views - worth the trip up the hill!. We took an Uber to the castle and were very happy we made the journey. There is a lot to see and explore on the grounds, and reasonably priced (16 euros for 2 adults and 2 children under 10). It has amazing views overlooking the city, and plenty of places to sit, relax, and enjoy the views.

Trek up hill. On the way to the senhora mountain be sure to stop in and take a trek up this winding tiled street to the castle at the top of the hill. The views at the top are breathtaking and worth the trek up.
Nice castle. It is the building you see the most while travelling through lisbon. It is great to walk around the castle, but it is not the most beautiful building from lissabon.

Amazing views, unique neighborhood. Perched on the top of the hill overlooking the city of Lisbon, this is a site that cannot be missed. You are capable of getting a 360 degree view of the entire city, and all from a 12th century castle. How cool is that? You'll also find the neighborhood (the old town of Lisbon) to be unique and actually quite charming. I do caution driving as the old city of Lisbon can be a challenge to drive through with its labyrinth of narrow and steep city streets and very limited parking. Take the trolley instead.
Worth the walk. We weren't sure whether we could be bothered to plod up the hill to visit this place, but I am glad we did. The views were amazing, and it was quite peaceful on the day we visited.

Great Castle with a view. The castle is renovated to the archetypical "medieval castle look". This said as a positive thing! Views of Lisbon are great and walking the walls is thrilling! the museum can be skipped.

Breathtaking Views. It's a bit of a trek to the top of the hill, but the views of Lisbon are absolutely incredible and well worth it. In terms of the Castle itself, not the most impressive I've ever seen and they could do with trying to preserve it a bit better, but it's quite cool to look around. Little bit pricey at 8.50 euros for an adult ticket though. Definitely worth a visit on a sunny day!
Feel good spot. The views go on forever, although we didn't dine here I would lov to do so on a warm summer night. Maybe next time

Amazing views of the city. We left the castle until our last day and were worried we wouldn't have the time to visit , we got a tuk tuk ride upto the castle and I'm so glad we did!! The views of the city were amazing . And the walk a long the wall was very interesting. Would definitely recommend a visit .

Centuries of history . The castle is located in one of Lisbon’s highest points and here you’ll have a beautiful view of the entire city and learn some history that started with the Ottomans centuries ago.

Gorgeous walk with a view!. On a particularly windy day, they close down the castle, and after our visit, I could see why! You actually get to walk along the castle walls, and if you are slightly fragile or unbalanced, a particularly hearty gust could send you flying. However, the views of Lisbon are amazing. The castle and museum itself are very cool, with a lot of information in Portuguese and English. The line to get in is a little messy, there are lots of people trying to sell you things, taxis dropping off and picking up, and quite a few people attempted to cut in front of us because there is no queue system, it's still a pretty place to visit.

Ruins with good view of Lisbon. Frankly, we had higher expectations of the castle but were surprised that indeed what was left were ruins (should have read up a bit before hiking our way up here!) However, you can get a relatively good view of Lisbon from here.

Great view. The visit of St George Castle is a must when in LisbonYou can take the tram 112 from Praça da Figueira or the 208 from Martim Moniz to go up the hill to the Castle and the trip is already an adventour because the roads are narrow and twisty.The entrance costs €8 but the view of all city of Lisbon and the good conservation of the Castle makes it worthwhile

Perfect start for a tour. We started our tour here. And we have to say it was the perfect place. Heard before it could become crowded, so we went up early. Less people, a wonderful view, beautiful site.We made it up by Tuk-Tuk. Be in good condition if you wanna go by foot.

Awesome views . We reached here at 5:30 at almost closing time and they allowed us in providing us a ticket to be used at a later time. Friendly people and awesome views here. Don't miss the peacocks in the garden.

The castle to visit. This castle is the place to visit in Lissabon. We went up the hill by foot and not with a tram. This turned out to be an excellent choice since during the walk you have nice viewpoints and you can visit (tourist oriented)shops or café's. Once at the castle you have a beautiful view over the entire city. Even though there were many people it did not feel crowded and we took our time to enjoy the view. We visited the old castle itself and climbed the old walls. A real nice experience to visit such an old castle. The archelogical site was not accessible during our visit and did not show so much. Rest of the castle is great and I recommend everyone to visit it.
Amazing!. The view from the Castle is amazing. The city is beautiful. Love it!The price is a bit expensive for what we see but if it's once in a life we should go inside.Residents don't pay.

Hill top panorama. If you don't fancy the hike, the 737 bus (free with Lisboa card) takes you up as far as the castle gate.We were fortunate enough that the rain stayed away so we visited on a bright, sunny day and took full advantage of the views from the Observation terrace. The romantic garden was pretty. Had an al fresco lunch at one of the cafe's outside tables. Watching blue or albino peacocks strutting their stuff in this lovely setting made for a pleasant sit down. The birds are clearly well used to cadging morsels from diners so you really do see these guys right up close.Battlements, archaelogical excavations and exhibitions made for an absorbing few hours

Worth the hike!. We hiked up here...well worth it though for the wonderful views of Lisbon! Perhaps in hindsight we would have rattled up the hill in the local colourful #28 tram. It was still fun riding it d own the hill though.

Well worth the Climb. Quite a climb up but well worth the effort. Steps lead up from the tram 28 or 12 stops. Through narrow little streets up past the cafes, gift shops and an unusual outdoor urinal built into the wall. As you enter the Castle grounds you can look out over the old town below and great river views. There is also a little van serving chilled wine by the glass 3€ (well more like plastic) but you get to keep it as a souvenir.The castle its self has sections of the the lower wall that you can walk around and then inside the main section of the caste itself you can climb up and walk all round the battlements offering great views in all four directions. A discount on the entry fee can be obtained if you gave used the grey line sight seeing buses and show your tickets.
nice views. We enjoyed the views at the castle. Nice overlooks. My children's favourite part were all the peacocks. Friendly and they liked putting on a show.
When in Europe go to castle. Usually for me when I go to Europe I love to visit every castle and its history, that's the best way to understand the city and its founders.

Nice castle with great views of Lisbon. This is one of the most visited sites in Lisbon, and I certainly enjoyed my time here. It’s a huge Moorish castle on the top of the hill, providing great views of the city. It’s great for a few reasons: A lot of history at this castle having been around for centuries, the castle itself is maintained well and very nice, and the views from the top of the hill are absolutely amazing. If you want, walk from the main areas of the city to get a few additional neighborhood visits – I’m definitely glad we walked up.

a must see - if only for the views and streets around the castelo!. Amazing place - the history here is incredible. the grounds themselves are interesting, but not spectacular, but what really makes this is the approach to the castle through the narrow streets, the people milling about, the walls of the castle and the various shops and cafes.

Worth a visit. This place is definitely worth a visit. Views over the city were stunning. Lots of climbing of stairs but worth it for the views. It was a really windy day so you felt quite exposed on parts

Wonderful views.. Well I walked up to the castle which I recommend if you're reasonably fit as you will get to see some of the quieter side streets on the way.The castle itself is fine for a wander round but what makes it special are the views over Lisbon.Entrance fee is 8.50 Euros which, for Lisbon, is quite expensive.

Magnificent views. This is probably one of the best locations to view the city. The walk up to the Castelo is a challenge but is well worth it for the view alone. The Castello is also well worth visiting.

Hike up the cobblestoned streets for great views of Lisbon!. It took us about 30 minutes to walk up to the castle, but the walk is very enjoyable because you can enjoy the neighborhoods along the way. Great history and great views of Lisbon when you get up to the castle and climd up to the top of the castle walls. Very windy up there in the afternoon, so bring a sweater. We took so many pics, because the views were just spectacular. Highly recommend this visit. It cost very little for entrance fee.

Spectacular views . This is basically a glorified mirador / viewpoint. Yes there's a castle but no info, history or anything other than the walls however the views from up there are spectacular. 8,50 entrance but if you're OK with the views from outside don't bother going in.

Go visit Castelo de São Jorge. It is a good half day activity: take the trolley and ride up the hill, then a short walk abd you get to the Castle: great location, with nearby restaurants and shops. From the outside fantastic views ofthe city and Tagus River! The Castle itself is worth the visit.

Walk up the winding hillside for some great views. I love the views along the way. The ruins of the castle are interesting but the grounds give you great views of Lisbon. You can take a tram up but I enjoyed the walk. 8.50 entrance fee is a bit steep as it is mostly a park.

Beautiful views over city. Got on the castle line open top bus to the top and then hired a Tuk Tuk and Katherine from Fun Tours took us to see all the sights and gave us an informative guided tour which we would have been unable to do by foot
Tons of fun . It's like a giant maze. Really fun to walk around and explore. Great views. Very windy!! Has food and drinks available inside, clean toilets.
Amazing history and views!. The views over the city are superb, specially if you have the luck of going there in a clear sky day.

Wine with a view!. Many of the sites in Lisbon have wine catered to guests by the "Wine with a View" carts. This was no exception. I was staying right on the doorstep of the castle and could wait for a sunny warm day for my visit. This site looks over the city, the river, and the bridge. Great for pictures and what I found the most interesting is you get a really good look at the way people live in Lisbon, looking right into their beautiful small walled gardens. This is old Lisbon where I stayed with great restaurants, shopping, and easy walking down to all the sites, you just need to cab or tuk-tuk it back up the hill. The castle and grounds are amazing and the history of the site is worth reading about before you go to really appreciate the history. Spent the whole day, some areas are high, lots of stairs but worth it. Parts of the dig are blocked off but the guide was amazing and it is really worth standing in line for if you want to feel history and see it in layers. Reasonable price and you can spend the entire day.

Great attraction, awful weather!. We decided to walk to the castle, what a mistake as not properly signed. The castle itself has nothing special, but the views you get are said to be stunning. I wouldn't know as it rained constantly when we visited. However, I am sure I would have enjoyed it more if it hadn't been so wet!

Must!! THE CASTLE. Enjoy your time at the castle. Visit the diferent parts of the museum and do not miss the part behind the castle with new historic founds. Walk on the walls. Enjoy the view. Have a coffee or icecream. Sit under a tree. And ... go the tower with the mirror room where you can also see the city

Mildly disappointing. After slogging our way up the hill to the castle we felt somewhat obliged to go into the castle. After purchasing our tickets we were then told the castle was closed due to health and safety. But the grounds were still open. Always good to know after we had purchased the tickets! The views from the castle grounds are wonderful and you can see for miles. The walk around was excellent, even though it was very windy. After spending 20 mins walking around the ground we left and headed down the hill to get to the city centre. My advice would be to take the slog up the hill, maybe using the tram and then make sure the castle is actually open.
Great ciews. Well worth the lob steep walk up for the views. €8 ish to get in, but worth it for the views. You could spend hours up there, especially if it's sunny.

Interesting. We spent a few hours wandering around the castle. There are lifts from the lower streets to the higher ones but it was still a bit of a pull for the last bit. Inside the castle there is a lot of up and downing of steps too so you need to be fairly fit. The views were splendid and the little cafe had lovely pastel de nata and coffee. The peacocks were beautiful and would stay with you for photo oppertunities for as long as you had something to feed them. After that they wandered over to the next person willing to indulge them

Lovely views but not much 'real' history. I walked (via the free elevators) up to the castle - lovely views over Lisbon from the ramparts (still have to pay entrance fee for this area). I didn't time my trip right for any tours - not sure that if these are advertised in advance as they do different languages at different times - they may have helped to give more info. Seeing as most of the castle was rebuilt in the late 1930s it all felt a bit manufactured compared to castles in the UK. Great views and a nice wander but probably worth trying to get one of the free tours to get more out of it.
Interesting. This was a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours. Had some fantastic views and the walk up to the castle was quite pleasant. Try walking up and taking the tram down or vice versa.

Great Views of the city. Castro de Sao Jorge offers great views of the Lovely city of Lisbon. This is an easy 1/2 day trip from the old city. Take the No. 12 Tram up the hill and walk another 5 min to the entrance.
Worth the admission fee. Amazing views over Lisbon and a wonderful place to stroll around. One of my favourite places in Lisbon.

Not a lot to see other than the view. We walked up to the castle on a very wet day. When we got there and paid the €8.50 per person entry fee I was expecting more. The day was so bad the view of the city wasn't great and walking around the castle walls was quite treacherous in spots. Glad we saw it but was a little disappointed
What a view!. Took tram to castle. Wish there were better signs to reach actual entrance. Expensive fee to get into grounds.
Great view. Good view points to appreciate the panorama of Lisbon. Not a huge amount to see in there. there is a small and quite sweet museum with old artefacts.

Hard work . Not good for people who have mobility problems lots of steps and hills . Well it is a fortress ,we visited in February and it was raining which spoilt the view across the city and the river. When coming away from the castle plan your route as lots of little back streets and walkways easy to get lost in the maze.

Man had views. Bit of a trek to get up there, I was just thankful for elevators. But the views the castle offered of the city were nothing short of sensational. Should you find yourself in Lisbon I strongly suggest you take a trundle up there.

Surprisingly good. The view from the castle was awesome. We went without any research and was lucky to chance upon a tour that showcased the periscope in the castle. The guide also showed us from the image projected by the periscope the landmarks of the city and explained briefly the history and some interesting facts about each of the landmarks

Great views. After a short climb up (longer if you go the wrong way!), you will discover a mostly reconstructed castle, built around the original ruins, with fabulous views of Lisbon and the river. It's definitely worth it, although it does lack the authenticity of a genuine medieval castle. The cafe is good for cakes, especially the custard tart.
Nice. I miss this place I'm native from Lisboa this town always be on my mind I love this town it is sun it is river it is sea it is faso

Хороший вид на город. Medieval castle in the city centre. Not much to see considering history. Castle itself is not very big and not much thing preserved in it. But definitely worth visiting, there is some kind of peaceful aura. And absolutely amazing view of the city and river/ocean from the castle walls.

A bit disappointed . It's good to climb up and enjoy the view from the top. But the whole castle is nothing special compared to the Moors Castle in Sintra, which is maintained more at its original state. If you have been to the one in Sintra, you may skip this one.

Very Nice view over Lisbon. The view over Lisbon is grand and the Castle itself is an impressive Building.
The historical part could be better for non guided tourist, there is only a small pamphlet you get handed. Maybe the tours make up for this.
The Museum on the grounds was not very impressive.

Essential part of any trip to Lisbon. The visit of the Castle Sao Jorge is an essential part of any trip to Lisbon. As one of the highest points in this hilly city, the castle offers beautiful views over Lisbon. The remains invite for a stroll, imagining how things might have looked in the past. From the Castle take a walk down the Alfama district, the oldest part of Lisbon, towards Praca do Comercio to experience the small streets and beautiful houses and views.

A sunset must see. This is a Moorish castle that was reconfigured and reconstructed over many centuries. It's lookout points are beautiful. You can see all over Lisbon. The walk around gives a great feel to what it must have been like in the past. There are several charming restaurants inside. The souvenir shops just outside are high priced counterparts to those in other parts of the city.

Steeped in history. I have to say that I love this place.Wonderful architecture, incredible views over Lisbon and steeped in history.You're allowed to wander virtually anywhere. Some bits are slightly hair raising with incredibly steep steps and virtually no safety rails but there are plenty of secure walkways for the less adventurous!

Historical Castle. If you would like to take a look of Lisbon from above, visit this Castle! I visited the Castelo de São Jorge for the first time with my primary tacher, I didn't remember how beautiful this castle was when i visit it in my 20's. I live in the other side if the river and from the Cristo Rei its all ready visible. My daugther went there also with her school teacher and she loved. Its a place to visit solo, with friends or family, its very clean, with informations in 3 languages (i don't remember very well). For who like History its where you will feel at home. Some restaurant near by. Hope you like it like i do !!
Must see amazing view. Great scenery and nice walk. In the ticket is also included the camera obscura and amazing view of the city! Must visit

The views over the river are simply outstanding!. This is a great place to visit. Very organised getting you in, cheap too, not really for those who are uneasy on their feet as you can imaging it is an old castle and the ground is a little uneven but that did not stop the 75 year old iin our group although she did not climb high onto the battlements to catch the views! You can spend hours walking around the perimeter and look over Lisbon. You can see for miles! Well worth this hike up the hill to visit or you can take the tram or tuk tuk / taxi.

CityWide Clicks. If you want to get a good capture of the entire city then this castle has the best view points.As far as the castle itself is concerned,the fee you pay to enter and the efforts to reach here isn't as worthy.A complete no for people with mobility troubles.
romantic site. It is true that the place may not worth the effort to reach it if you are interested in an historical monument but the view and the romantic atmosphere are so amazing...

Scenic building with great views and interesting Camera Obscura. Whilst I enjoyed my visit to the Castle, as someone else said, there isn't a whole lot to do except climb and enjoy lots of views from ramparts. For this reason, I think it would be great with a family, but less successful for those with mobility issues. I actually enjoyed it enormously and used up a lot of energy climbing up and down, particularly enjoying the trip all the way down to the Gate of St Lawrence which is protected by ramparts on both sides. My guidebook was scathing about the Camera Obscura and said it was not worth visiting but as it was my first day, it was a great way to find out what everything was in Lisbon and to learn something of the city as well as finding out how it worked, all in English too. I waited less than 5 mins.There are some archaeological remains on the site too but sadly these can only be visited by guided tour and the timing did not fit in with me. Would have been good to have easier entry into these.
Great visit!. Nearly empty on a sunny morning in February - such a bonus - with spectacular views of the city and the Tagus. Well worth the climb to visit it!

Beautiful views over Lisbon. From the Castle Sao Jorge, there are beautiful views over Lisbon. I recommend a walk from there down the Alafama district towards Praca do Comercio to experience the old Lisbon.

A must do for the views of Lisbon. One of the must do attractions for the views of the city, but there's not a whole lot of the castle left. It is a quite steep walk from the city up to the castle, but take your time and stop in the shops along the way. You must wear sturdy shoes for all the steep walking and stairs at the castle.

Must see attraction. Good place to spend a couple of hours or more. Fantastic views and good history lesson. Lots of steps but the cardiac patients in our party still managed to get there, get round and enjoy it. Good value at 8.50 euros

Fantastic views of the city. Without doubt a 'must-see' destination in Lisbon, good value at €8.50, with great views across the whole city. The cafe was very expensive, and some of the exhibitions were a little bit dull but overall a fun experience.

Great Views . Get there by the No 12 tram. It's quite a short ride but you you'll love the trip. Going through incredibly narrow shop lined streets. When you get to the castle you'll get some stunning views of Lisbon. The castle itself is interesting too.A good way to spend a couple of hours.

Great castle in the middle of the city. Can challenge those scared of heights. It's a bit of exercise for some to get up here - quite a steep hill, and you don't really want to drive up the small streets of this neighborhood (if you're coming by car, the Cathedral (Se) is probably the best place to park but it's still a small hike from there).This is a great place for kids (and adults). Amazing views of the city, you can walk along the walls and imagine what it was like to have been a knight defending the city. Parts of the walls are a bit scary for those scared of heights, but the steps and pavement, railings etc. are all well maintained so it's perfectly safe.A little bonus is there are some peacocks walking around, we even saw a partially albino one. One disappointment was the food - we decided to skip the on-site restaurant after a quick glance at the fare and prices, but then all the restaurants outside were very bad tourist-trap looking places. We ended up having to walk to the bottom of the hill before we found some place we were actually interested in trying.

An interesting couple of hours if you've got the time.. Spectacular views across Lisbon, well worth a visit and quite reasonably priced. You can have a "Port with a view" from a little van/seller inside the castle and just sit down & enjoy!

Impressive castle with great views. We stayed next to the castle and visited on our last day. The castle is impressive and many peacocks roam around the castle including sitting up in the trees. The view from the castle's terrace is worth the visit. The castle itself mainly involved walking around the walls of the castle and through the small museum. There isn't a lot of see in terms of rooms etc as I believe the castle was not used as a permanent residence.
nice experience. Nice view and a huge chance to take a plenty of amazing pics on top, good restaurant but forgot the name:(

Weather didn't help.. We visited the Castelo da Sao Jorge on a very misty day which certainly spoilt the views of the city. On a bright days the views would be tremendous. It certainly gives you a great idea of the layout of the city. Other than the views there's is little to do. Perhaps if the restaurant is open it would be OK. Take a taxi to avoid the walk up steep hills.

Magnificent views from a beautifully restored piece of history. If you're visiting Lisbon this is definitely worth a peek. Start by getting lost within the streets of Alfalma (I did many times and it really is the best) If you have a Lisboa card you get a discount too. There are spectacular views from every part of the castle, you have the opportunity to climb up to the top and see the city from a higher angle. Also look out for the beautiful peacocks around. The romantic garden really is romantic, I'd love to have gone at night as well. A perfect place to see the sunset I'm sure.

Interesting hill top castle but nothing special. Went here as it was one of the main Lisbon tourist attractions. It has great views from the walls and if you like climbing battlements, this is for you. The archeological area was very disappointing, as it is only open for guided tours as specific times. It is not easy to get to, given various renovation works going on, and not a lot on display, if you miss the guide times. We would go again for the views, but the castle itself is nothing special
Nicer to look at from outside. Although this looks beautiful from afar, we didn't think it was really worth the visit, there is plenty of other stuff to see if you're only in Lisbon for a few days
Amazing castle in Lisbon . A must to see if you come here, historical place of Portuguese kings. Really nice park and amazing view point of Lisbon. Cost to enter is 8.50 and it is worth it.
Beautiful views. Interesting museum, beautiful views, peacocks walking around.Don't miss the periscope (10am-5pm) in one of the towers

Great views - when the rain stopped!. We walked along the east / west Rue da Vitoria to the far end, and caught the first of two elevators. Turn left when you leave the elevator building and walk a little way uphill, cross the street and the next elevator is on your right. From here it's just a short walk to the castle. The elevators are free but you have to pay to visit the castle. There's very little to see inside the castle, it's more about the views from the walls but there are a few garden areas, an archaeological site and some statues to see. These is also a very handsome peacock!
Awesome!!!. Great view, beautiful attraction and great pasteis de nata stand right at the entrance. Definitely a place to visit while in Lisboa.

Great view of Lisbon. Over priced.. On a clear day, you can have a great overview of Lisbon.If walking all the way up, past the Sé cathedral is too much, take the #737 bus. It drops you off right at the entrance to the Castelo. Else the 2 sets of Castelo elevator to bring you half way up the hill is helpful and they are free.8.5€ for entrance is a bit too much for me since it's just a big space to walk around. There's restaurant inside. The archeological site is disappointing - see the photo.It is of historical importance, true but it was disappointing overall.
Must see. This Castle is a reminder of Portugal's imperial past.An impressive fortification that helps us understand the life and times of this wonderful town and its people..
Great view. Beautifull Castle, Beautifull view, a place in Lisbon that anyone should go. You can mix the view and culture in one....

Meh, just another amazing sight in an amazing city.... It's a place for a good view but the better deal is when this castle is within view from your hotel room or from your dinner table. If not, then how about a cafe or restaurant adjacent to the castles walls? Castelo de Sao Jorge is literally the pillar of the surrounding community. I didn't enter the castle but it is a beautiful scene atop the hill.
Peacocks. Cant visit Lisbon and not visit the Castle, great views over the city, bring a picnic or visit one of the 2 cafes on site
gorgeous view. best spot to see the views. Amazing spot on a sunny day. You can see the city downtown, the river and the gorgeous bridge

Wonderful views of the city . A must see for anyone visiting Lisbon. Gives you a great historical view of the city as well as the fantastic location.Have a fresh squeezed orange juice in the cafe.Walk up if you can and enjoy the shops and cafes along the way down.

Interesting. Got the tram up to the castle as it's a bit of a hike well worth the visit even though it was raining on and off plenty too see and very interesting well marked out and a cafeteria for tea or a local wine

Worth the visit. Take the tram and get off near the top. With a map you'll easily locate the Castelo. Allow yourself enough time to walk the grounds of this well kept fortress. Have a glass of wine and watch the sunset!

Fabulous views, a must see. The castello is a must see at a Lisbon trip. It offers stunning views over the city and you can walk all along the outside walls to get a glimpse of nearly all directions. In peak season times expect longt queues at the ticket office. To go up you can either walk and see the very characterstic surroundings, take a taxi, the historic tram line 28 or a Tuk_tuk (which the residents are not really keen about because of their noise...)

Best view of the city. If it's a beautiful day out, there's no better place to be than drinking wine and looking out at the city of Lisbon at the Castelo. It would be great for a picnic as there are nice places to sit. The castle itself is worth the visit, but I think the real treasure is the incredible vista.

Worth a visit for the view. We bravely walked up the hill to the castle - don't know if I would do that again though it's very steep! The entrance price was reasonable at 8.50 per person. It was worth the money just for the incredible views, we were lucky it was sunny and could see for miles. The castle itself is well maintained and fairly interesting to look around.
magnificent views. worth the trip up the hill either on foot or take a tram ride. views are amazing from the walls. small museum of artifacts to see. resident peacock also put on a good show!!!

A must with astonishing views! Save the best for last!. This was the last attraction I visited during my stay in Lisbon and I was glad not to have missed it! It is the place to go if you want to take pictures of 180 degrees Lisbon from above. You can walk on the surrounding walls of the castle and enjoying the views and the experience. Ideal for families with young children and senior citizens, this attraction is one of the most beautiful ones that Lisbon has to offer!
Best sunset views. I visited Castelo se Sao Jorge at the perfect time. I arrived around 1700 right before sunset. Most beautiful view of the city and bridge!

Great views, but be fit! . It's a bit of a climb up to the castle, and once there, there is even more climbing that can be done. It is worth it for the views over the city and the river, though. The peacocks in the trees by the café were an unexpected feature, worth looking out for!
Amazing view . Very good place to go to see the perfect catholic church atmosphere. Santa Luzia and Sao Bras church is a place where you should take sometime to be!
Loved the camera Obscura. Brilliant views, camera Obscura was brilliant and really enjoyable to learn about the city of Lisbon.
Family Vacation. Excellent view of the city and a place to enjoy a relax time with family members. Walking up to the castle, you can enjoy the little shops around and mingle with the locals.
Stunning views :) . old castle with great panoramic ciews to lisbon! polecam! must see! long way to walk on the never ending hill... must hav a water or a lot energy to climb. ;)

Nice castle with great views of the city!. The climb up to the castle wasn't easy. You have to be gym fit to not be out of breath haha. The castle is nice and takes you back to a different time. There is a lot to explore, and it's very informative. The garden is lovely too, very green. There is a nice cafe if you want a short beak. I think the viewpoint is the best part. You get great views of the city, the river and the bridge.

An expensive view. The castle itself is nothing much at all. The only thing this place has going for it is that there's a pretty good view of Lisbon from the walls. There are equally good and free views from other parts of the city, since Lisbon is very hilly.

Beautiful Views. This is a charming castle with breathtaking views of the surrounding area.One of the best features is that the castle walls are open for anyone to walk the perimeter and explore - there are some narrow portions and those who don't like heights might be a bit challenged in the walk, but it was fun to explore.The grounds are lovely, even during our January visit, and there is a very nice restaurant at the castle for a special occasion.We decided to walk up to the castle (some of us thought it was a good idea). Be prepared for quite a hike if you do!!! But there are some great neighborhoods surrounding it, and we very much enjoyed our time.Figure a couple of hours to walk up to the castle, tour around and walk down.
Great views. Get up to the castle for great views, an interesting Camera Obscura with a nice talk by the staff (lasting 20 mins) great photo opportunities
A must see when in Lisbon! . Splendid views over the city and the Tajo. Particularly cool spot to take photos in the late afternoon. Fun place to walk around and climb the towers.

Very beautiful. For only 5€(for student) you can have an amazing landscape of Lisbonne. This is one of the best place to see in Lisbonne. You will also find a restaurant for the lunch with a beautiful terrace.
Wonderful views. We took the streetcar as close as possible, and walked up the rest of the way. It was cold and windy, but we very much enjoyed our visit there. It is an amazing place.
Interesting. Excellent for getting great shots of the surrounding areas. Not wheel chair accessible. Lots of steps.

Great Sunset View!. We came up here for a magical view of sunset. The castle is neat to walk around and see the architecture. We also loved seeing the peacocks roaming the grounds. There is a great stand called "Wine with a View" that allows you to purchase wine right on-site - a perfect compliment to the sunset.

Very nice castle!. We were not sure if we wanted to go and visit the castle but we finally did - and it was a fantastic experience. The view from the castle to the city was incredible, a nice walk around the remaining walls, a very nice tour guide who explained a lot. All over we recommend this to anyone.

Great views but a Health and Safety nightmare. The castle has exposed stone stairways leading up to high open castellated battlements, which provide fantastic views of the city, but this attraction is a health and safety nightmare for any person who errs on the side of safety. Probably better suited to teenagers and adults and not young children. There are numerous signs warning of the potential hazards of falling, and on a blustery day, they should be heeded. The potential hazards were not identified before entering the castle so you might feel slightly cheated if you don't fancy venturing up onto the battlements to take full advantage of the views. Obviously H&S is a balancing act. No guard rails is the choice the castle guardians have chosen, with warning signs, of the potential to fall from height, in place. You pays your money and take your chance.

Great castle with great views of Lisbon!. It was really neat to walk along the castle's walls. What was even greater were the views of the city from the top! I would recommend taking a hike up to the complex to see some of the best views of the city.
Fine dining in a lovely setting. Excellent cuisine with a view to die for there is not a lot but good things to say about this place excellent excellent and more excellent

Tranquil castle with great views. Really peaceful gardens with peacocks roaming and a great place to wander. Epic views from ramparts ... Evens place to buy a glass of wine and sit and survey Lisbon. We walked up there and it was manageable but taxis can drop off if you're not feeling energetic!
A must do.. Can't not come here, fantastic city views, lovely gardens but the castle not really very interesting.
Don't miss a visit to this castle. So glad we visited this amazing castle. Such amazing history and great views. The walk up there through some old roads was also worthwhile.
Interesting. Great place to visit, lots of history and interest. Audio guide available in many languages..... Part of Lisbons history

Interesting cultural landmark. First, this rambling fortress offers a birds eye view of Lisbon and beyond. Take your time and walk through all of the courtyards, stop and have a drink at the cafe don't rush as I am convinced there is a vibe here that can be contagious. If possible visit during a weekend when it is really alive as the locals also visit this cultural landmark to stroll and socialize. I was most struck by the history contained within these walls, from the Moors to the Romans to modern day Portugal this place has been occupied and a key element in the history and development of this once powerhouse country. They are still discovering new bits of information as it is a working archeological site. This is a place you don't want to miss.

Beautiful Castle. Quite a hike up to the castle in Lisbon but worthwhile. The cost is 8.50 euros per adult with various discounts for groups etc. You can look around the extensive castle walls with the best views of the city. A very worthwhile trip, do it.

Very impressive castle !. If you are in Lisbon you have to visit this ! it is an very impressive castle and the entrace fee for students was only 6 Euro's . You will get a great vieuw of the city since the castle is located on top of a hill.

Perfect for a bird’s eye view. The castle is at the highest point in Lisbon and gives a grand 360 degree view of the city below, two great bridges on two sides and the river. There isn’t really much to see, but much more to imagine – how royalty of different origins lived and ruled. The peacock sure put up a fine show, cats hide and seek, while the pigeons focus on food! Food! Food! We went early in the morning, when the café wasn’t open, but the view was magnificent. The castle gives a great starting point for a leisurely stroll through Alfama, going down towards River Tejo.

Wonderful view. I was surprised that this is the second attraction of Lisboa I deeply recommend this place for view, for a short walk and for relax himself! With Lisboa card you will pay a rate of 6€ for entry.

Highly recommend it. We went here when it was a bit rainy. Which was quite unfortunate though. The view was amazing on top of the top tower. I definitely recommend walking to through the entire castle and discover every little thing. Take your time and don't rush it! There is also a tower that is a meeting point as well. Pay a visit and they will explain some things in the surroundings. So take your time.

visit the archaelogical site. the castle is great, but you must go to the archaelogical dig all the way in the back. the tour guide was amazing - she showed us ruins from the iron age and muslim times. they have a kitchen from the 7th century bc
Wonderfull. Even if I didn't have the chance to visit it inside (it is closed on January 1st) the surroundings area, street and views are great.

Not so fascinating. The Sao Jorge Castle is very beautiful in terms of its history, Lisbon was formed around this Castle, but it is not as fascinating as the Jeronimos Monastery, for example. Its walls are well conservated, and the views from the Castle over the town are beautiful, but you cannot expect to do more than walking around its walls, seeing some traces of the earlier life of the people populating it and seeing free peacocks (you can feed them, they are accustomed to people). However, the place is, once more, very well conservated!

Pricy but after all worth the money. Entrance fee is 8,50 euro per adult which is pretty steep for just a visit to a view point. But we ended up spending a few hours climbing the walls and castles. We ended up at the excavation sight and saw a sign you could get a guides tour and see the excavations up close. We were a bit to late but a guide came and gave us a quick personal tour, highly recommanded they have ruins going back 7000 years before christ. Also go in to the 360 camera obscura room in one of the towers, 20 persons a time and in different languages. All in all a nice visit, and although it was january it was 21 degrees celcius and sunny!!!

Great views of city!. If you are going to start somewhere, this is the place! Great views, easy to get to off the blue metro line. Beware of necklace hawkers at the gates, but very enjoyable. Grab yourself a gelato for the walk back downhill.

Visit for the views more than the history.. The castle had a feel that it looked too new and over restored .We still enjoyed it for the greatr views and the ability to climb about the tops of the walls.I would not take small children on the walls as they can easily fall as no protection.We got lost finding the entrance as we had assumed the tram tracks took us up to the castle.We still do not know how we found the entrance as there is very poor signage.

One of the Best Castles I have visited. Great visit but a lot of walking involved. Advise is to use the taxi or tram from the city centre or cruise terminal to get there.
Super castle with a lot to see. Also great views of Lisbon from the castle walls.

Great view with atmosphere. It's a steep climb up if you're walking or you could catch a bus which is quite a ride as the bus manoeuvres the very narrow steep and busy cobbled streets. Before you enter a few pedlars will try to sell you their wares. These are the most pleasant pedlars I've ever come across, I just had to buy something. The castle is very well maintained and parts are still under construction. This does not detract from the beautiful panoramic view and the pleasant walk around the grounds. There are some steep steps to climb if you want to walk along the high wall, the climb is worth it. There are peacocks hiding around the ground and it was nice to see them. There is a cafe and a restaurant with tables and chairs outside overlooking Lisbon. (closed when we were there). There is a museum with historical artefacts and I learned a thing or two. When you buy your ticket get the free guide map which is invaluable for this visit. It's a lovely castle and well worth the visit.
Good place to spend a few hours. Fantastic views from all sides of the castle. Informative gulde leaflet. Good value. Enjoyable few hours spent looking around.

Views over Lisbon. This is a splendid castle, high up over the city and with magnificent views over the city of Lisbon and the river. As you would expect, it is a steep climb to reach the main gate and still quite steep once inside the gate. The ground then levels out a little. The wall walks are reached by steep unguarded steps, but almost in every direction tyhe views are superb. There is some shade under the trees (which are perched in the resident peacocks!) and usually a cool breeze. The cafe is really good, with plenty of cool refreshing drinks. The small museum is beautifully designed and well worth visiting.

Nice visit. Our first visit during our trip to Lisbon. While we would have wished for better explanation on what is what, and other historical and architectural facts, it's a nice visit, with a beautiful view of the city. It also shows you how multicultural Lisbon's history is.

Afternoon visit. Spent an afternoon wandering the castle grounds enjoying December sunshine. Relaxed & absorbed amazing view whilst enjoying an ice cream. Quaint way to get up to castle using the lift next to supermarket.

Best view of the city. A must for every visitor, to enjoy the climb up the cobbled streets to the best view of the city. Slippery cobbles in the rain, but well worth it when you get to the top. A good range of shops and restaurants around the castle, and luckily we stayed at the wonderful Solar do Castelo hotel, adjoining the castle walls.

Lovely castle with awesome view.. Very nice pice of the Portugal history with great view on the city, specially if you have luck with weather....unfortunately we didn't:-(The best way to come here is with legendary old tram, and then short walking distance to the castle.Tickets are little bit overpriced for my opinion...8,50€, but it'll be a shame to not visit this place if you have time.
Castelo de São Jorge. The Castelo de São Jorge is one of the most emblematic monuments of the city of Lisbon. I strongly recommend

Fantastic Views and interesting castle. The Castelo can be reached in a number of ways from central Lisbon, depending on how energetic you feel! If you walk, there a lot of steps, but you do get a rest in between flights as you weave your way through the narrow streets on the approach.Once inside the Castle (you need to purchase a ticket), head for the main plaza where the view out across the whole of Lisbon bay are amazing. Once seen, then there is plenty to explore in the castle itself, with the reconstruction well worth seeing. There are a couple of places to get a drink and snack (not the cheapest but it is one of the main tourist traps in the city).Overall good value for money, and a "must-see" when visiting Lisbon

Top notch.. Entrance fee €8.50 per adult. Great opportunity to make photo of the monument Afonso Henriques, creator of the Kingdom of Portugal (love to read the history of his mother - Theresa and her half sister Urraca (Queen of Leon) during those tumultuous times.Beautiful setting,nice gardens,peacocks,interestingly shaped trees,great view of the city from the top.Romantic, little streets leading to the castle.
The views. This was okay. The views were worth the money but everything else about it was a bit less than amazing. I am glad I saw it but I won't have to go back a second time.
Castle . Ik can be quite short about it. I didnt know what to expect. Most of the walls are still standing. The so called inner piece is gone. If the weather's good, you have gorgeous view.
4th star for the views. Some interesting ruins but it would have nice to have been given some idea of what it was like inside.

Must visit. If you visit Lisbon the Castelo should be on top of the list of places you want to visit. And not only if you are interested in historic sites because the breathtaking view alone is completely worth it, so don't forget to bring your camera.

Beautiful view. If you go for a visit, prepare for the climb. That said, it is a beautiful view from the castle. If you have a fear of heights you may have some problems with the stairs up to the tops of the walls. However, once up there it is all worth it. You can see quite a bit of Lisbon from there, and it is beautiful. Highly recommend you visit for both the history and the view.

Visit in dizzly rain, liked the views and the projection via the telescope.... The castell is like many other and in its times played an important role in Portugals history. We all like the periscope style projection in one of the towers. Pretty unusual, and low tech compared to all electronics availible today!
vacation with husband. what a beautiful place to visit. the sceanary from up over is incredible!! looking down and seeing Lisbon was breath taken, this is my second time here. and would go again
Good views. An enjoyable visit but rainy weather meant that Lisbon was not quite as beautiful as it would be on a sunny day. Castle was interesting and well preserved and views were good.
Must-do activity. You should not miss this while in Lisbon, even if only for the view. It can be done fairly quickly as well and the little streets around the castle are a bonus.
Sooo Midevil. Great castle! Loved it. The views from the top are stunning. If your a history buff you will really enjoy this.
Not much!. Not much to see but is on top of the hill and is a good view of the Lisbon city. Watch out your steps because!

See Lisbon from on high. This place has the best views of central Lisbon -- it's a bit of a climb to walk up to this castle, but it's well worth it. The views are absolutely amazing on a clear day, and you can see many sides of the city.I did not have time to explore the castle as much, but there seemed to be less explanation/background of each part of the castle. I didn't get to see the camera obscura, but it sounded quite interesting. If you want to see it, note that there are set tours to see this throughout the day. There is a line to see it, so find the times when you arrive and plan to line up before that time.
Trip through time..... Very interesting old castle that has seen many incarnations. Lots to imagine in this walled castle. Views from the castle of Lisbon and area are great.

Great view of the city, but that is about it.. The castle was the original home to the royal family and it occupies one of the main hills in Lisbon. The view of the city makes it worth the trek up to it through several winding streets. One of the downsides are the trinket sellers outside the main entrance to the castle. You have to worm your way through them to get to the visitor's center to purchase your tickets. Once inside you don't have to worry about the vendors. Again the view is amazing and if you want to walk the high walls you can. An important note here is that unlike Obidos, Almourol castle or pretty much any other historic site with high walls, St. George's walls at least have guard railings along the walls and up the steep steps. Anywhere else its a big nasty fall if you are not careful and I heard stories from tour guides that careless folks have died. This should not be the case for St. George. The castle also has a small archeology museum that is quick to walk through since there isn't much there. There are quite a few peacocks mulling around which are fun to look at!
Great view. For us it was worthy mostly because of the view. Probably not a good idea to enter the castle if you go with small children.

History buffs will love this old castle. We had a sunny but windy day in Dec. to visit this old castle which dates back to the 11th century. If you can walk up steep streets to the to the Castelo de Sao Jorge it is well worth the effort. The views are breath taking ! The best way to get the full experience is to have a guide explain the castle , towers, quarters , the archaeological sites ,the exhibits and gardens. I would leave yourself a few hours the take all this in.

No words . Being at this place is a time travel. From this place many of the Portuguese "discovery" have started.The view here is just mind blowing.Not much to say, don't want to ruin your surprise..Come and see it!! Don't leave without going there.

Excellent restored castle, great views. The views over Lisbon and the port are really worth the entrance fee. But the old castle has been well restored and the walk around the ramparts was impressive, especially as it was blowing a gale the day of our visit. Archaeological dig site is interesting, but the finds museum even more so. Children would enjoy visiting this castle.
Beautiful castle to walk around. Easily accessible and beautiful castle. Didn't have much info besides the pamphlet they gave us, but it was a nice place to walk around.

Great History and Great Views. This castle is steeped in history with discoveries continuing with further archeological exploration. The views of the city are amazing (we were there at sunset)! The walk to the castle take you through colorful narrow streets and alleys with tiles and graffiti. The castle has many opportunities to climb and "play." Make sure to visit this attraction when you are in Lisbon.

Well worth the effort of getting there!. Fantastic to see how this has been restored. It was a wet and windy day when we went but the views were spectacular and I can imagine that on a warmer and sunnier day it would have been breathtaking. Reduction for over 65's with proof of ID: It is at the top of a steep hill. Bus 727 and the old tram 28 are 2 ways to get there. Very interesting museum. The shop however was disappointing as it only offers the expected array of tourist tat!

Weather depending. Beautiful with good weather, we visited when it was very windy and it was not the greatest experience. The views for Lisbon are amazing but under the wind and rain is not so pleasent.
fantastic view. Enter the castle is like traveling back in time. The imposing ramparts and prime location, unique view of the city. Recommend!
Breathtaking. So beautiful! U must to see it! Not expensive, and the landscape is breathtaking! Best time if you catch the sunset. :) lovely

Great City Views. This is probably a must see in Lisbon. There is a lot of history here so read up a bit to get the most of the visit. Line to get in but it moves quickly. Walk around. Take note of the view of Lisbon. This was the home of the king in the middle ages so you can understand the good defensive position. Climb up on the ramparts. When you leave the castle walk around the town. This is where the nobles lived to be near their king. Much Moorish influence here. Cute shops and eating places abound. The #12 tram from Praca do Figueiro goes back and forth from here. I believe the entrance fee was 5 Euro each.

A historical gem!. We loved our trip to the castle in Lisbon. Although we were blessed with a beautiful day weather wise I think you could make the most of this place in any weather. The trek uphill to get to the castle takes you through lots of little winding streets that will give you the essence of what Lisbon is all about. Streets filled with ornate tiling, graffiti that borders on being artwork and tiny galleries and cafés on either side of you. The castle itself while being just a ruin has lots of nooks and crannies for kids to explore and lots of steps and battlements to climb for various beautiful views of Lisbon. My advice would be to take the time to stop and have a coffee or a beer at the restaurant there, the view is really something to behold and the rest will reenergise you for even more climbing and exploring! All in all a wonderfully enjoyable experience.

A great day out. Well worth the 8.5 Euros per person but its best to get there early as queues build by mid-day. Taking the 28 Tram there might seem idyllic but its packed with a huge wait to get on. I'd suggest using the more lightly used 12 Tram instead which ends up at the same place & you're more likely to get a seat. For the less mobile, the 737 bus is easier to use and drops you much closer to the castle entrance. Being an ancient building there are lots of steps with few alternatives. There's plenty of places to eat & buy souvenirs both around & inside the castle.

Amazing views of Lisbon - this is a must do!. Wear comfortable shoes as the climb is steep. Recommend walking if you can to experience the neighborhood and views along the way. Plenty of cafes and shops along the way. Signs point the way but are not consistent. Public transportation will take you part of the way. There is also and elevator that goes up to a certain point but unsure where to access - recommend researching before heading out if you are interested (cost for elevator). Views from castle are amazing. Go on a nice day if you can to get the full effect. Price for entry is 8 euro as of December 2015. There was a line but it moves quickly. You can climb the turret inside and view in all directions.
Fascinating and well maintained. A good view from the terrace area, and lots of fascinating history inside. Quite a long line to buy tickets but worth it.
Nice view of the city. Best view of Lisbon, but it is quite far and expensive, so I would recommend to people who have never been to Lisbon.
amazing view. beautiful view from the castle.dedinetely reccommend it.It is quite windy so get something warm up there.

one of the best castles. one of my favourite
make sure to pay for a guide. they ll take you to the ancient surveillance room. you ll be amazed how they were using the surveillance hundreds of years ago

Great views. Spent the morning touring the castle and then afterward enjoyed a glass of wine from the "Wine with a view" cart. Got there early and the line was short to buy tickets and was not that crowded to walk around. When we left, the lines were long, glad we got there on the earlier side.

Amazing views of the city. Great views, peacocks and a piece of history all in one afternoon. Although a bit of hike uphill, it is well worth the trek and entrance fee. Lots of uneven ground so make sure to bring proper footwear and definitely don't forget your camera.
Wonderful views of Lisboa. . Wonderful views of Lisboa. Expensive entrance ticket, not much more to see than views. Slippery, narrow stairs up to the towers and battlements.

Just for the view.... The good thing about visiting the castle is the amazing view you get on Lisbon.
Apart from that, the castle is not an attraction itself. It lacks of activities.

Ok with some great views.... Nice to spend some time walking around and getting some nice views of Lisbon. I thought it was slightly overpriced for getting in. For those with dodgy knees it may not be best going up to the top turrets as steps are narrow and steap.

Fantastic views. Great old castle built on a high hill overlooking the whole of Lisbon. It was a very tiring climb with lots of steps to get there but you can go up by tram or the hop on hop off bus tours. Well worth the effort

Nice castle with a lot of history. We enjoyed the view of Lisbon from the castle. We went first thing in the morning so there wasn't a line until we left.The castle is the highest point in the city which was nice for pictures.

A Gateway to History of Portugal & Lisbon. Castelo de Sao Jorge is a wonderful medieval castle with amazing views. This castle has plenty of historic moments, starting from 2nd century BC. Over the time its modified by many forces like roman, moors etc.. and finally by kings of Portugal. This fort was destroyed in massive earthquake of 1755, and rebuild partially later. From the castle we will get a great view of Lisbon city and Tagus river. Still archaeological excavation is processing in the castle. For me it was a great experience and gathered information about Portuguese history, also enjoyed the sceneries. Castle having a small museum inside and it will give us valuable information about the past centuries of Portugal. Its a must visit location in Lisbon.
Must see. We enjoyed visiting the castle and reading about its history. It's a nice stop when walking around Alfama. Entrance is 8$ per person.

On the heights of Lisbon. It's a hike up here, but the views are worth it. Imagine yourself back in the middle ages. With the great earthquake of 1785, there's not much left in this city that goes as far back.

It's empty inside!. Be sure to know, that unless you want to use for a high spot to take photographs, this castle is only its walls. Inside there's only empty rooms and nothing else. And the archaelogical site is very small and you can't really get close to see it. It's rather obvious that they tried to savage all the could of the castle and showcase, but there's really nothing left to show. Especially for its price, I really don't think it's worth it.

Best viewpoint 360. Nice walk though narrow streets with steenp steps. A surprise bevhind every corner climbing up the hill. Much beter experience than taking the bus or tram.Wonderfull vieuws from the castle in alle directions. Amazing for sunset as well.

The best . We walked up the hill to the castle. The views were wonderful and the castle itself was amazing. We walked up to one of the towers and were able to get great pictures. Once we left, we went around the corner for wine tasting. Being a beginner, the shop owner really guided us to what we should drink and how we should drink it.

Wine, shade and a magnificent view. The view from the battlements is superb but I recommend seeing it an additional way....by visiting the castle's camera obscura. You might have to queue because tourists are allowed in 20 at a time every 30 minutes. Worth the wait because the 360 degree panorama is pinpoint sharp and a guide identifies the city's landmarks. After that it was back to the battlements, finding some shade and watching the sunset with a glass or two of wine.
Don't skip this place. Stunning example of ancient ways of life. Loved how you were able to walk all over the place on your own, even up on the walls.
The view. Obviouly the greatest view I had during my trip to Lisbonne. You can see every part of the capital from the garden!The castle is empty but pretty.Go there for the view!

A 'must' to visit when in Lisbon. Between the view, scenery and restaurants, Saint Jorge Castle is a beautiful place, either for a couple, group of friends or even alone. You have great restaurants with amazing view, you have gardens, you have the viewpoints. You can travel on an electric car or walk bit you will always find something gorgeous to see or feel, either in the day or by night. A necessary place to visit in Lisbon.

Nice spot on top of the hill. This is a great vantage point to view Lisbon. The old castle is very interesting if you love history. Makes for some great photo opportunities as well. The Cork Store right outside is a great place to buy cork gifts.
Fun day out . Had a great time walking around the castle. The walk up is quite pleasant and had a glass of wine whine were up there. Would highly recommend with family and friends

Good afternoon out. There is a lot more to see and do at the Castle than you out first think. The museum is small but succinct with a good chronology and range of items on display. The castle is great for climbing up and seeing views of the city. It has been well restored to allow use. The gardens are lovely for sitting in. It made for a pleasant watching of the sunset

Nice but not spectacular. The castle itself is nice enough without being spectacular. The views, however, out over the city are worth the effort to see. Cost of entry is reasonable and it's worth considering making the effort to work here from the downtown area in order to gain an appreciation of the surrounding area.

Beautiful views. The views of Lisbon from the castle are wonderful. The castle itself is also fun to explore. There is a small museum onsite which is worth a visit. The grounds contain a small archeological site. You can't visit the site yourself, you have to go on a tour. Its only a short tour but it does allow you to see inside the buildings that have been constructed to protect the site. I would recommend planning your visit so that you can catch one.I would also recommend bringing your lunch. There is a cafe onsite, but its nice to just be able to site in the gardens and admire the views.

Beautiful respite!! . What a great place to escape the crowds! The grounds and the castle are wonderful to see and walk around. The views from the overlook are refreshing. It's a panoramic view of Lisbon from there. Don't miss this one.

Good for view and history. This is definitely worth of visit. You can trace the history of Lisbon from about the 7th century BC through the Romans to the Moors and then to the Portuguese who took conquered the Moors in 1147 and then on up into the 16th century. You could easily spend 2 hours here looking at the exhibits the museum does you and walking on the ramparts. Remember however that this is at the top of Lisbon and everything is uphill and then everything is downhill. Be prepared for lots of walking.

A must see and free tour!. If you're in Lisbon make sure you visit this castle and jump on one of the free tours. The tours take place in multiple languages, including English.Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and really brought the history of the castle to life. Some great views and history to experience.Overall one of the highlights of Lisbon!

Sublime views !. The Castle is well worth the climb up to the summit.. The streets and alleyways around the castle are interesting and vibrant. The views out over LIsbon and environs are simply stupendous and the photo opportunities irresistible.

How a crusade coming from Dartmouth enters the Castle History?. São Jorge Castle was built by the Arabs in the Eleventh century in a Lisbon high point.Half of Portugal (in the making) ended near Lisboa (Santarém). It was vital for the Portuguese King (D. Afonso Henriques) to conquer Lisbon which, in medieval times, meant to conquer the Castle.The Pope Eugénio III called for a new crusade. In its way, coming from Dartmouth, they stayed for a short time in Oporto. Oporto bishop convinced them to help the Portuguese King. ..Not for very religious reasons (the loot would be awesome) they agreed and after a 4 months siege the Arabs surrendered.Today it's a superb place to visit; you'll enjoy a magnificent view of Lisbon (actually a 360° view) along with Tagus River, you'll see the result of several archaelogical researches, some of them show the occupation of the place by people before the Arabs (sixth century BC):Phoenicians, Greeks, Carthaginians and Romans.If it's your first time in Lisbon it's here you must begin.

Interesting but not spectacular. A visit to St George Castle must be part of any walk in the Alfama neighborhood. The most interesting part of the castle is the museum which is very informative and well organized. The view of Lisbon from the castle is disappointing. Most of the castle is stripped down to the bare walls. I would not include St George Castle among the must see attractions of the city.
🔝 view of Lisbon. This is the best view of Lisbon! Amazing place to wait for the the sunset having a nice wine with friends.
Great views. Views are amazing but not much else there. Some wall walks, dig not open so have to view from afar. Camera obscure interesting.
Castelo de Sao Jorge. Maybe we were in a rush, but I didn't find this as superb as some of the other views. More details to follow on my blog nycbonviveur on wordpress.

worth the walk up the hill. nice view of the city from here! we walked up to the castle from the city below and enjoyed the back roads..amazing to see this style of castle as it had been rebuilt after the great earthquake
Great sunset view. We visited the castle during the sunset and it was great! It has an almost 360º view of Lisbon. The castle itself is amazing but very steeply stairs. A must see!
Great views. Great views but a bit expensive at 17 euro for two. It is a nice trek uphill to the castle but the views are worth it.

Wonderful views. Easy to get to, using the old fashioned tram service to get up there, and strolling back down through the bohemian quarter is lovely. Fabulous views of Lisbon from the top and lots to see in the castle itself. Great value for money.

Memories. Before this time I only visited this place when I was a little child. Loved to go there again. It is mostly empty, but there's an awesome surprise there! :D ... You can see all Lisbon through the reflection of a mirror inside of one of the towers! Go there.

Portugese history. Well worth the effort to walk up (or better still take a Tuk-Tuk) and experience the Castle/Fort originally built by the Moors and taken over by the first King of Portugal after their defeat. Stunning views of the whole city of Lisbon. There are cafes in the surrounding village outside.

Good visit. You can walk up the steep way or take a taxi. Best rime is before sunset of morning in winters. They have an amazing periscope or mirror system to view the city..it's good to view in sunlight
The castle is good for a half day out

Long way up!. We walked from ground level all the way up to this on a hot September day. It was so worth it! on the way up, you see some beautiful buildings and then when you finally reach the point of the castle you have such a wonderful view over Lisbon. I agree with other reviewers- there's not a whole lot of the castle to see, it's mainly ruins but you can climb up the castle stairs and walk around- the steps are very dangerous- steep and hard concrete. Not at all good for visitors with limited mobility. The gardens around the castle are very pretty and it's just a great place to see Lisbon.

Beautiful castle HIGH on the hill. We took a tuc-tuc up to the castle as it is a very steep and long climb on cobblestones. The castle is huge and overlooks the city with magnificent views. It is well worth a visit if only for the photo opportunities.

Best photos. - This place definitely has a view and it's great for pictures. - There's a discount for students under 25.- walking distance from downtown - they should have more information plates around the place, ask for a brochure or do your research prior to going or you'll miss the whole history

Worth a visit for the view of the city. The castle is well maintained, but does not have much to see apart from the view of the city. We went to see the periscope with explanation of the different buildings in the city. Free and worth the time. Long queue to enter. To be combined with tram 28.
Highest Point in Lisbon. Long walk up hill but worth it. The best views of the whole city in one area. The castle itself has no railings so it can be quite dangerous with kids. Lots of stairs

The best place to overview the city. . It is very nice.to walk through the castle while enjoying the views. The ticket is pricy but it worthy. Enjoy the sun set with a glass of Portugeze wine and surrounded by the medieval atmosphere.

Wonderful view over the city!. The way to the castle is very nice to walk, also reachable by tram. From the walls you can enjoy a very nice Lisbon view! We spend there a couple of hours, taking pictures and enjoying the air!
Well worth the views alone. Great views. Best visited via 737 bus route. Not recommend when it is wet. It is easier to walk down than up.

Worth the detour, with a nice panoramic view on Lisbon !. Be brave, and walk the streets of Lisbon up to the castle.You'll be rewarded with a nice panoramic view on Lisbon, and a castle visit.While my children do not keep souvenir of the castle, they do about the stairs and the view ! :-)

Other than the view, the place itself is just average. The view of the city is spectacular, however, the castle itself is quite boring - climbing up and down the castle walls would be the only fun of it, very minimum about the history of the castle or about the Knights' lives in the castle. I found it very hard for them to justify the €8.50 ticket price (€6.50 with Lisbon card) as I can walk to the miradouro da garca nearby to have the equally, if not more spectacular view of the city for free.

The Crib of Lisbon. Occupied by vandals, Vikings, moors, celts and Romans the Castle St George is a mixture of history. Lisboa was a sea princess and every people wanted to conquer her. It was finally conquered by King D. Afonso Henriques ( first king of Portugal ) in 1147,. You cannot miss this monument
Great views. We walked up the hill to the castle and spent a very nice couple of hours. Not much to see as the castle is a ruin but we strolled around and admired the lovely views.
nice area. went up to castle, easily accessible by public transport, a short walk up if you take the tram but a bus takes you right up, the area round about it is nice with a few bars

Truly incredible. In my travels I have rarely come across a castle where the public can fully access all of it. It took us about 2 hours to really see everything we wanted to see on the grounds but even then we could have stayed all day.
Great view on the city,. Very easy to reach; great view of the city; history + romantic scenery in one :) ticket: 8,50, tram: 28

Beautiful view. For a beautiful view over Lisbon this is the place to go. The access is not very easy as it is on a steep hill, but it is worth it. There are a lot of restaurants and you can even meet beautiful peacocks in the gardens....

Impressive Castle. It's on top of one of Lisbon's hills. We went in for €8.50 each. I thought it was worth it for the look round. It was fairly empty so had time to see the castle. It was great to walk around the walls. There were decent city views. Had coffee with the Peacocks and saw the views from the castle walls. Just a note, Tram 28 is the busy touristy Tram up to the Castle,, but Tram 12 goes to the same stop.

A must see when in Lisbon!. Some say the castle is hard to find; we reached it very easily, following the tram lines and taking it to the left after the Cathedral. There's a restaurant named after the castle, and this is what we followed as guidance; proved we were right. The road took us to the castle by itself. The castle opens around 9am, so don't be there earlier, as coffee shops don't open till then either. There's an entrance fee, but entering these gardens is a must; also, the views over Lisbon are amazing and so so generous from so many rooftops, especially on a sunny day! There are also free guided tours every hour, which explain and show the main buildings and attractions of Lisbon.
Best view in Lisbon. After a quite steep walk uphill thru lovely Alfama you get rewarded with the best view over Lisbon. A nice historical place where you also can see peacocks in the garden.
Great view but that's it. Worth visiting for the view alone. It isn't an architectural gem and isn't even old but it was fun. Take tram 28 and it is a good day out.

To see the iconic views you see in pictures. We took tram 28 to Alfama got off at a stop that had a stunning view overlooking the river, don't remember which one. We wandered around and bought some stuff from street vendors and tourist shops and beer vendors, so cheap!! We wandered up hills and came across the castle. We weren't planning on entering but decided to. I can't remember how much much maybe 6-8 euros a person... DEFINITELY worth it! Once inside you seen amazing views overlooking the city. Our best pictures are from this location. There's also a restaurant that overlooks the city. We sat at a table but decided not to order. Wine was 8 euros I believe and we weren't ready to eat yet. But it would be worth the price simply because of the view. There's also a cafe on the other side with no view, kind of pricey, but considering its inside the park that's expected. We bought some cool art from a man painting Lisbon scenes with coffee! My favorite souvenir because its authentic! Not made in China junk that most shops sell.
beautiful views. beautiful romantic views over Lisbon - make sure you pack comfortable shoes for the climbs inside and try to take the tram up to enhance the experience.

Definitely worth a visit. I recommend to complete your stroll through Alfama's streets with a visit to the Castle. You can walk on its walls or relax in small shadowy gardens. Take a slow walk around the various parts of the Castle and then have a glass of wine enjoying beautiful views over the city.
Hard to find! Don't give up!. The Castle is hard to find!! But don't give up! Totally worth the difficulty of finding it! Breathtaking view from entire Lisbon!! Lots of history!!!

Great castle, great city views. Entry price of EUR 8,50 is well worth it. The castle grounds are very big so there is plenty to explore. On clear days it gives you a great view of the city as it sits on top of one of the largest hills.Arrive before midday on weekends to avoid queues to buy tickets.
Spectacular. Wonderful visit. Magnificent views of the city, river and bridge. The on going excavation work was interesting. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here.

A must go. Took the tuk tuk ride to go up there about 15 mins was fun! Or the tram if you could find a spot. Stopped by the cathedral on the way up, saw many cafes or local stores along the way. Not much to do at the castle but the view was gorgeous from the top of the castle. Wear a comfortable walking shoes due to uneven stone ground. It might not be stroller friendly.
Stunning. Such a beautiful place, seeped in history and a lovely way to spend an afternoon. I would recommend a yuk yuk ride to it, the drivers know so much.
Great view!. Definitely recommended if you are in Lisbon for a few days. It's truly pleasant to take a walk inside the walls and enjoy the overall city landscape

STEEP WALK. the steep walk is well worth it the view over the city is amazing we watch the sun set whihc gave some great pictures. the Castle itself dosnt really have alot of information boards but the walk around the top is well worth it.
Tip: take tram 28 from to take you part way up

Visit for breathtaking views of Lisboa. This Castle is located on the hilltop (one of the highest points in the city) and overlooks the entire city of Lisbon and Tagus River. There is an entry fee of 8.5 Euros per person. Lot of steep stairs take you on the walls of the castle and if you are a photographer, you will be able to capture some brilliant shots of the city and the beautiful castle walls. Not recommended for old and toddlers.

Very busy. We went on a beautiful Saturday afternoon in December. When we got there the queues were very long so we decided to have a wander around the little back streets close by. We ended up spending a lovely hour looking around the shops and having a coffee in the sun outside a lovely coffee shop.
