Worth a visit. We enjoyed exploring the castle and it's grounds. Great views of the city and plenty to see inside. Wear sensible shoes as there are some seriously steep steps around the castle itself and only worth doing if the weather is dry.
We had a snack at the cafe which was ok if not a little over priced.
Worth a visit.

Great views, great historical significance. The fort sits on the top of the highest hill of Lisbon. It is a great place to see the city from and an enjoyable experience to tour.The ticket with senior discount is 5e and is well worth it if one is interested in going back in time in imagination . The fort also has places to sit and enjoy the view as well as restaurants to have just coffee or sometjing to eat.

stunning castle looking over the city. Really nice, must as a visit, great views of the city, river from top. peacocks all around, best photo opportunities... pretty big area, could be a bit of trouble on hot days with tired feet... the stairs climbing up to the towers are a bit scary, need to be careful. Great place. take a lot of water, entry fees are reasonable... have at least half a day to enjoy, relax and go around the whole place

Take it or leave it. We visited this castle as it features in all the tour books, but really there isn't that much to see other than fantastic views over the city. Quite a relaxing place but the tuk tuk ride up to it was the most fun.
Get the #12 tram up - dont wait for the queue for teh #28. Loved this, well worth the effort of going up the hill - although get the tram up - its a good walk otherwise. A lovely stroll around too.
Outside visit only. Went past castle whilst on tram 28. Lovely area. We were going to enter the castle but the cost of entry put us off. We were happy just to take photos of outside and views.

One of the best experiences in Lisbon. Must see. Do not miss if you travel to Portugal
Amazing views in a good weather
Small neighborhood around it is charming.

Lovely castle :). Amazing! It's really worth your money. The area is huge! Sit down on a bench and enjoy the magificient view over the city, go the the museum and wander around in the castle and all its towers.

Beautiful. Beautiful old monument with a lot of history. You can almost feel the story. Not suitable for people who aren't steady on their feet. Amazing view over the city. There's also a restaurant inside.

Don't go if it's raining. A wonderful place to visit ,but don't go if it's misty or raining. You will not have the views this Miradouro offers.
Also the paving can be quite slippery and there are not may places to shelter.

Has to be visited. You can see the castle from almost every point in Lisbon, we caught a tuk tuk up, 10 euros to get in, there is a discount if you have the Lisbon card. Lots to see once inside, lovely views across the rooftops of Lisbon, the floor is uneven like much of Lisbon so need to pay attention to where you are walking.
A must-see. One of the highlights for Lisbon in our opinion. A nice walk there from the centre and the views up there are fantastic. There's plenty to explore and would highly recommend!
lovely medieval castle. We took a tram tour and hopped off by the castle. Castle is big with great views of the town. we have spent couple of hours exploring the castle. it was very enjoyable.

A must see in Lisbon. No only the castle is great, but the walk up and the surroundings are amazing.This is a must see in Lisbon. For great views of Lisbon pay to get in.Plus points- Good viewsLow points- Watch out for the dead endsRecommendations:- Take water

Wonderful views over Lisbon. Decent castle to visit, wonderful panoramic views over the red rooftops of Lisbon.Value for money for the views alone and this is not an expensive place to visit.You can get the number 12 tram up to the castle if necessary.

first Attraction to see in Lisbon. The Castle sits on the Highest Point of Lisbon and almost demands Attention to all new Visitors that this should be their first point of call in this City. The best way to get here other than a very strenuous climb is to take the Mini Bus 737 from Martim Monez Square where You will be Dropped right up to the Main Entrance ( Tram 28 runs close but still involves a bit of a Climb after alighting ). After Purchasing Your Ticket from the Main Office take a Guided Map and walk through a Turnstile in to a Large Terrace that gives you a Sweeping View of the Lisbon Panorama.  The Castle itself has some Terrific Views from its Many Battlements and Walkways & has a Beautiful Park in its Interior that is Home To some Wild Peacocks who wander the grounds seemingly Oblivious to the Many Visitors. The Grounds can be seen in about one hour but You should try to stay here a Little Longer to take in the sense of its Long History, from Medieval Cannons that poke out between the crenelations to the Towers at the very top with all their Large Flags Fluttering that still invoke images of the Moors Capture and Eventual defeat right here some Twelve Hundred Years ago.  There are plenty of WC's available as well as a Restaurant and Bar, Museum, a recently discovered Ancient Archeological site as well as the usual gathering of Vendors selling Tourist Bric a Brac. In all. this Should be Your First Point of Call to get an Idea of Lisbon's History that will Help you Better Understand the City on Your Further Explorations around.
Castelo de São Jorge. Great place to visit. This historically prominent castle apparently fortified in 48BC, commands spectacular views of Lisbon and the Tagus River. It is a must see

A great view. It's been years since I went to the Castle and I really don't know why it took me so long. It offers a great view, a nice walk and a couple of hours of exploration and it was free because if you're from Lisbon you don't pay! I will definitely come back!

Fun guided tour. The castle itself is just nice with great views but the guided tour thats included in the entry fee really was a lot of fun. We got to know the history of the castle and also sort of role-played how it was invaded. A fun way to tell the story!

A good castle. If you like castles, and you like battlements, this castle if great. Excellently maintained, and very castle-like.
Some very photogenic peacocks knocking around too.

Worth a visit. We got off the bus tour and was initially unsure where to walk to get to the castle, there were no signs at the main stop. We walked for a short while, following a group of people who gladly going to the attraction. If you have difficulty walking then get a taxi or ride to the castle, the walk takes approx 10-15 minutes but it's very steep, uneven and probably slippery if wet. We were greeted by a really nice lady at the ticket office, who asked whether we had any discount vouchers! We had brought the hop on hop off tour therefore got 15% discount. She also happily announced that there was an English tour around the Castle starting within the next 15 mins. She clearly explained where to meet the guide. We had a small group, it was a brilliant tour, our guide Mario was fantastic. He spoke excellent English, was knowledgeable and lighthearted. We had to make decisions along the route as attackers would have made. Mario explained our fate at every turn!!! It was a very good visit and the views from the Castle were amazing.

Beautiful. We came into the harbor on a cruise ship . What an amazing view of this castle. We also took a tour that took us land side to this castle where we got some more pictures. We loved Portugal.
Pretty. Interesting building, with pleasant views, but there's nothing inside and it's a long walk up the hill on which you're harassed, as usual, by tourist-tat sellers.

Fun tour and great views of the city. The concierge at my hotel recommended starting my sightseeing day here - and I'm glad he did.The castle itself was fun and very interesting - and getting a birds eye perspective of the rest of downtown before I walked around was very helpful.Would definitely recommend it as the starting point of a walking tour of Lisbon.

Well preserved castle with splendid views over Lisbon. If you are fit enough, walk up to the castle via the historic neighborhood of Alfama (famous for its Fado music). Go early so you beat the heat and the crowds. Many tourists take small tuk-tuk to drive up the steep streets to the castle. The landmark is well worth the visit and the views are panoramic.

The highest point of Lisbon. A great place to enjoy a sunset in Lisbon. The Castle has plenty of different viewpoints on the walls, allowing for a 360º view of town, with both bridges and every detail possible. The Castle is now completely stripped of everything that was once inside, only the walls remain standing. 8€ entrance fee.

Worth the climb. We walked up to the Castelo and it was well worth it.One of the few places which offers 'senior discounts'. Views were amazing and lots to see and a couple of places to eat inside ( and outside the Castelo also). Museum and ramparts to climb.

Ofcourse the view is great; but search for the camera obscura in the castle: super view. The two best things of the castle are (1) the view over the city and (2) the camera obscura. This 2nd 'thing' is a room you enter with 20 people; you stand around a big round table on which you see the whole city life projected. A really nice view and tour over the city with a big lens on top of one of the castle towers.
Nice. Bit of a walk but this is a great place to get the sunset over the city, the castle is basically walls to get views of the city.

Linger over the beautiful views of Lisbon. Excellent view of the city, and must! Walking shoes required. The ocean tends to be misty in the morning. If you want clear views afternoon may be a bit better.
Wonderful. Great views and fun to be able to climb around the inside. The entry area, a large, shady plaza with killer views, was especially nice. This was a very comfortable space to visit.

Worth a visit at any time but miss the crowds by going early. The climb up to the Castelo is worth it. But be warned this area gets very busy. It opens at 09:00. By noon it is crowded. The views of the city are spectacular. There are guided tours of the archeological site at half past the hour starting at 10:30. This is well worth the time and included in the ticket price.
Best vantage point in Lisbon. If you are in Lisbon you have to get up to the castle to enjoy the view and understand the history of the city.

Great Views!. Old Castle with high vantage point. Walking around the castle grounds is great. Lots of history. But what really seals it it the view. The views of Lisbon are great. This makes it well worth it. There is also a restaurant within the castle grounds. I walked up the hill to the castle, but for the less adventurous, take a cab!
Not the best place in Lissabon. The old castle is not really worth a visit, as there are many nicer viewpoints in Lissabon. But on every tour, this seems to be a must to see. I really don't know why.
Traditional visit. This is a "need to" visit. You can either walk uphill or take the old fashion tran. The views of Lisbon from the Castle are magnificient.

Wonderful View from well preserved medieval castle. You should not miss this place when you visit Lisbon. Take tram to climb the outskirts of castle, enjoy narrow snaky roads to reach entrance of castle, or you may hire a rikshaw until gate of castle...it will take your good 1 hour to see around the castle and take a lot of pictures. I would also suggest you buy a glass of wine from small buffet inside the castle while seeing around.

Worth the visit - Taxi there & walk down hill thru Alfma. Great views of the city. Lot of steps but you can still do a lot of it if you do not want to do the steps. Kind of fun to explore the castle. We took taxi there (up hill) and did a free walking tour down hill through Alfama which worked out great. (The "Discover Walks" Alfama tour is the one that starts just our side the castle and goes down hill)

Lisbon's sentinel. Walk up from the centre, through the winding streets of Alfama to the Castle of St George. The musuem is worth a visit, but apart from that just stroll round and enjoy the view and imagine what it must have been like when it was garrisoned

Stunning views of the city. This was supposed to be the #1 place to go in Lisbon, and we were not disappointed, with stunning views of the city and a maze of narrow walkways on ground level and the battlements, some of the steps are a bit too narrow and steep, fabulous way to see the cityscape.

worth the effort!. charming castle , a lot of steps well worth the challenge, lovely views very interesting, very narrow roads leading to the castle amazing to see the buses and taxies manouver before leaving we had a light lunch which was served with friendliness and good humour, a very enjoyable day!

Nice place . The castle is a nice place to admire the beauty of Lisbon. Access to the castle is not free of charge ( the regular ticket costs around 8 euros). I recommend that you take the tour which is free of charge.
Castelo de Sao Jorge, What a view !. This castle has a great view. You can see Lisbon, the river (tejo). It is a simple castle but well preserve. The view it the main attraction here for me.
Great view. Beautiful views so make sure you visit when it is clear day.There are many places to relax and read a book or something so take your time.Great place to have a little snack and relax.

See this one before Sintra. This was an interesting castle and I enjoyed walking around and climbing up and down the battlements. There are plenty of nice little areas and table like surfaces for a nice picnic if you would like to take along a packed lunch, as well as plenty of shaded areas under trees.It has a great view of the city.From the city, you can see some stairs which look like they lead down into the city. They don't. It's good to know, because if you want to do everything you can, but for me, there was no added enjoyment or interest in walking down those steps. There's a small cafe in a nice setting. There's also a restaurant along the walls with a nice view of the city. Plus a little wine cart if you want to stroll the grounds with your glass of wine, or port.I would recommend this attraction, however, if you have been to Sintra already I would not. Once you've done Sintra, there's a feeling of, is there a need to see any other castle....ever? A bit like going to Rome, any other ruins are meh.
Well worth the entry fee. Not as expensive as other castles, this one is well worth the visit as it offers good views across Lisbon and you can easily spend several hours waking all around the walls.
beautiful views. The castle is on top of a steep hill inside the castle are many steps. But if you can climb up them you will be rewarded with excellent views of Lisbon.

Worth the climb to the top!. The views from this site are well worth the climb up to the citadel. The small museum is interesting, also the archaeological site. Reduced price entry for those over 65 is always welcome.

Amazing views across the city. The walk up to the castle is steep but, if you don't fancy it, the old trams and all the tuctucs all go to it or close to it. The castle costs €8.50 to get in and it's worth that for the view. The castle plateau is a great place to sit and watch the sun go down, maybe with a glass of view from the little tuctuc wine bar, A Wine With A View . The battlements are very well preserved and can be walked around. Theyre high so not for the faint hearted but great photo opportunities of the city.Well worth a visit
Worth paying for. The view is magnificent! And the castel is still impressive. You can get a glass of wine inside for take away, enough places to sit and enjoy the view.
The best miraduoro in the Lisbon. Take a walk on tha castle's wall, you can see Lisbon from a birdview, and not just a part of it, but also all around.

One of the best views in town. This very old castle is high over the city and right on the Tagus (pronounced Ta-zhu) river, and you can watch the various boats and ships on this wide expanse, some on their way to the Atlantic. The site is still part of an archeological dig. The gardens and terraces and the beautiful views are camera-worthy. The restaurant at the castle is excellent. And we had a blast traveling in the trolley, loaded with tourists like sardines, as we slowly climbed the steep terrain (will it make it?). The walking is rough, stones and irregular ground, so take care.

Great place to view Lisbon. This castle has a little for everybody. A great historical attraction with plenty of interesting points. It also is a nice way to spend half of a day at leisure or taking in a relaxing lunch. Wonderful views of Lisbon and nice archaeological points to see.

Great place to view Lisbon. We walked from our hotel to the castle and it was a great but fairly long walk. So if you are not a walker take the tram from near the water. Great views and a wonderful place to look for other sites to see and visit. There is a restaurant at the castle, but we only had drinks there so can't rate it, but the menu looked OK. The castle tour was very interesting and well worth the walk. We also walked down through the old section back to the plaza, We covered over 10 miles (16km) on that day so if you like to walk you will really enjoy all the sites.

Gorgeous afternoon. Went on the heritage tram up to the castle (excellent in itself) when we got off the tram the views were amazing. There were some fabulous street cafes where we had a beer then walked the rest of the way up to the castle. Spending the afternoon wandering around the castle was a delight, the views are amazing. Took some fabulous pictures. We walked back down into town had dinner in a street restaurant the end of a perfectly lovely day.
Great place for a great view . The castle itself is impressive and large, a lot of shaded place to rest at after the long climb to the peek.The location itself is excellent to have a look at Lisbon.

Great views . We walked up the hill instead of getting the tram. Entrance fee was reasonable. We spent about an hour here and got some really good pictures as the view is stunning. Would recommend a visit but go early especially if you want to get the tram as the queue to get up there was massive. Also watch out for pickpockets as I was nearly a victim.

Beautiful castle. Beautiful area - there are gardens and courtyards as well as the fortress, and an archaeological museum. Gorgeous views. If you only visit one place in Lisbon, I would recommend this.

Take care!. The castle is worth a visit, BUT be careful of the staff. We were not given our change on the admission tickets and when we asked for the change the staff were really rude. "We can't give money just because you said you never got your change." No sorry we'll check. It is though this is a routine and if they do this with several customers throughout the day they will make quite a bit. Stand your ground and get your change.

It's a must for a beautiful sunset!. Ancient castle in Mouraria with beautiful views of the city, the Tejo and onto the Ponte 25 de Abril which very much looks alike the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco! Very romantic at sunset. Took quite some nice sunset photos. Be aware of loads of merchandisers standing in front of the entrance.

Interesting. We took a tram up to the castle and after paying the entrance fee (think it was 11 euros) we had a good look around. Very interesting to walk around the battlements etc. and there is also a small excavation going on there. Lots of steps, refreshments, toilets etc, and also good views over the river and all around. Tip, keep your eyes on the paving slabs as saw someone trip over with the unevenness. Lovely walk back down through the tiny winding streets.
Good Views. We went up to the castle one evening--it was very nice. A lot to see (inside and out) and we managed a few wonderful pictures.
historical and awesome. I would say this is a cant miss. historical and fantastic views. it is a hike to walk up but you can get a cab easily. really interesting and great photo ops.

Great views of Lisbon. Took the hop on hop off bus, and got off here. Excellent views of the city, entry price of castle was maybe 8 Euro each, not much to actually see of the castle.You can walk around the walls but there's not much else to see. Wouldn't go out of my way to see this again, but would go up the hill it is on for the views.

The best views of Lisbon & beautiful sunset. We were nicely surprised from the beautiful views up in the castle , if you plan it well enough you will see also gorgeous sunset . Harmony , romance and very relaxing day ended up in the castle . Afterwards you can go for fabulous dinner at Chapitto with Live music and more beautiful views . Neighrbohood has plenty of small local shops coffee places and restaurants . Don't forget to try famous tram 28 .

History and Veiws !. We meandered our way up old cobblestone streets to castle and climbed up and around the perimeter to fantastic veiws of Lisbon and surrounds. Even enjoyed a glass of red wine overlooking the terracotta roof tops of Lisbon

Cool to see, but not that exciting.. I was super excited to go to this, my wife came along because she knew I wanted to see it. However, sadly when we got there it was underwhelming and just mediocre. There is a small museum inside that has some old trinkets in it that gives you a little history, overall though it was really unimpressive. The view was probably the best part of this attraction. I think they need to add some signage that gives some interesting facts and history about the Castle. If you have time go and see it, if you want to get an amazing birds eye view that is far better then The Elevator go here also. But, if you are looking for the history this falls a little short on that. If you want the best view climb up into one of the lookout towers.
Nice castle. Great view but a bit expensive. You can see almost as beautiful views from the near lookout places for free.

Great ruin and fantastic view . The castle itself is more like a ruin, but it's definitely worth it to walk along its walls enjoying the fascinating view of whole Lisboa. The Alfama neighborhood close to the castle is also worth a visit.

Incredible view from historic sight. It's fun hiking around the grounds and through the corridors of this ancient castle. The views of the city are unmatched. There are also lots of historical artifacts.There is plenty of shade on the grounds as well and a cafe'. You can easily just relax and take your time.

The Castle.... The view!. It's all about the views for me! Brilliant castle though, I would imagine most kids would think it's just like the one they play with at home, a real classic. The views from up there are superb and worth the entry fee alone. The trip up was on a bus from Praca Figeueira and pretty straight forward. You need to go all the way to the end! A walk down is a great way to experience the narrow streets and unique atmosphere of the area below the castle.

Well worth a trip. It's easy to spend the a couple of hours here, the views from the battlements, of course, but also the grounds of the castle: the archaeological area for a nice 30 min private guided tour (no extra charge), the camera obscura for an alternative view of the city, chilling by the cafe watching the peacocks.....
Great for a couple of hours. A lovely castle and grounds with lovely views. I would recommend wearing good solid footwear as the ground is very uneven and 99% cobbles. Don't forget your camera!

be very careful. This monument has plenty of falling hazards do not go near the place if you have been drinking.AS Castles go it is ok but Grosmont or Skenfrith are as good and Harlech or Bamburgh better.
Amazing city views + history. Views from the top alone are worth the visit, not to mention the history behind it. Visit to Lisbon would not be complete without visiting Castelo de Sao Jorge.
Great Views. A bit of a climb to get there, but it was worth it for the views. Not a lot to see in the castle really, but a pleasant place to visit.
Beautiful . Visited today amazing weather amazing views. The tram journey to the top was amazing an all round must see price probably quite steep for a view but you soon forget you even paid.
Best view of the city. Over 1000 years of history, the castle is built on the highest point in the city offering great views of the area.

Worthwhile visit. When you get up to the castle, it gives you a lovely view of Lisbon. Do line up for the Lisbon talk at the tour office inside and on top of the castle ( sorry not sure how to describe the location) it will give you a 360 degree view of Lisbon.Go early in the morning before all the tour bus arrive.

Top of Lisbon!. At 8.50 for an adult, this is more pricey than most of Lisbon's sights but still definitely worth a trip - the views are simply outstanding. We had to queue for 5-10 minutes to buy tickets so if you're on a tight schedule, consider buying in advance to avoid this.The best route is to take Tram 28 up from the centre of town, try the stop in Rossio Square, to save yourself some of the walk. It is then only a short but very steep 5 minute walk to the castle from the nearest tram stop. Although the castle is well kept, be warned there is little beyond the actual walls - this sight is about enjoying the fabulous views. The walls are still great fun to climb for kids and, if you are looking for a more historical visit, make sure to pick up one of the informative leaflets when purchasing your ticket and take time to visit the archaeological site as well. If you enjoy your visit and fancy something similar, make sure to take a trip to the Moorish Castle in the nearby town of Sintra.

Castle of Saint Jorge. Beautiful step back in time castle. I felt like a princess. Plan on spending some serious time there to grasp the beauty of the location. Please a must: wear very comfortable walking shoes or sneakers. The sidewalks are very narrow and are made of cobblestones.

Not worth 8.5€. The view from the castle is pretty cool, the castle itself is nothing special as is the exhibition (a few cases, coins and tiles). The archeological center is a complete waste of time!! It's a hike to get there and you can only see the site with a guided tour (every hour, except at lunch time of course) and the rest of the time the ruins are covered! So you can't even see it from the outside. Of course you can only discover this by hiking up a battlement and walking down from it to read the sign. I mean 8,5€?? I'd say it's worth maybe 5! There should be a lot more signage and more explanations.

Tuk-tuk up for top-top views. If - like us - you get caught at the height of a sunny Saturday waiting for tram 28, skip the queues by hopping into a tuk-tuk to bring you up to the entrance to the castle (you can get tram 28 back down much more easily).The castle complex is so impressive, with magnificent views across the whole city. The streets and cafes around it while obviously set up with the tourist in mind add to the appeal of the district.€8.50 per adult to enter, and worth it.

Excellent attraction. If you visit Lisbon, as well as all the monuments, make sure you visit this castle....built on a hill, the views over Lisbon and beyond are astonishing.....beautifully kept (and with reduced admission for over 65s) this area is amazingly cool due to the breeze, and the abundance of large trees. Take the bus (737) which takes you to the door via a ride that would be at home in a theme park.....the tram, which although very scenic, drops you a bit. short, with a steep last bit of a climb. A must see in a very, very busy hoy city.

Worth the hill walk. We walked up the hill in the 30 degrees temperature to see what the castle was like. It cost 8.50€ each to get in, and worth it. The best bit for me was the telescope of the city, but be aware that it takes 20 people max as that's how many people fit round the camera obscure. Top tip is queue to the right of the door as if you are going into the door, as oppose to people just huddling around the door....the staff are very polite but very directs and will insist on the times of the showing being observed and the queue.
Wonderful sight. An enjoyable walk up to the Castle and some more lovely views of Lisbon and the coastline from the top. Worth a visit

Ex-libris of Lisbon. Liked thesurroundings and the interior of the castle. Just be careful not to have dinner inside its restaurant, because it can be a little pricey. The sightseeing over Lisbon downtown and the south margin are worth the ticket price, especially after sunset.

Gorgeous views of Lisbon. Beautiful views of Lisbon...that alone is worth it. This isn't a typical castle as it's mostly outside walls (was used to house army). Nice artifacts collection. Do yourself a favour and don't drive to get there....walk or take a tram, taxi or tuktuk.

Beautiful views. The walk may look daunting to get to the Castle but it really isn't that bad. Stay in the shade and take your time and it is very enjoyable. Once at the top, and in the castle grounds, the view over Lisbon is breathe taking. There's not alot of Castle, - E.g rooms- but if you have kids who enjoy climbing stairs to the castle walls they will definitely enjoy it. Plus the 360 degree view isn't bad either!

Amazing views.. Only 8 euros for entrance. Close to central of Lisbon. The castle has a cafeteria and museum. They also sell tasty ice cream just after the entrance. The castle is very pretty and offers nice views over Lisbon :)

One of our Favourite Places in Lisbon!. A great place to visit, spend some time, enjoy the fantastic views & a glass of wine!The ride up through the Alfama, the views out over the Tejo, the old castle itself is historic & interesting & the views are some of the best in Lisbon. We enjoyed a glass of wine & a rest in the shade looking out over the city. I would recommend staying into the evening to watch the sunset. Fabulous!

Great views, interesting site. This was my favourite part of my trip to Lisbon (actually, the only thing I liked in the city).The line wasn't long at all. There were informational booklets available for free in many different languages, but I don't think they provide enough information about the history of the site. I would recommend going on the guided tours if you can. They have them Monday to Sunday at 1.00 p.m. and 4.00 pm. They're included in the general admission ticket.I liked the permanent exhibition and the archaeological site the best. We had lunch at the onsite cafeteria and the food was ok. We enjoyed sitting on the terrace and watching the peacocks.If you are in Lisbon, I recommend it. If you're planning to visit Lisbon, I recommend you don't. Terrible city, imo.

Best view of the city . We chose to walk up (and down) to the castle. It is doable. Once there it is the spot to take time to view the sights of the city from its many sides. It is one of the best castles we visited because of its size and restoration. Within its confines there is evidence of other settlements. There are many tourists but the size can absorb the numbers.
Must see. Great view of the city. No good to visit if you are not in a good shape to climb . There is a public bus that take you to the top of the Castelo. Tram 28 you need to walk up hill.

Fabulous views of Lisbon. One of the most fantastic monuments in Lisbon with fantastic views all around and the ruins of the former royal palace. Visitors can admire the view of downtown Lisboa and the opposite hill with the Carmo ruins, Chiado and Bairro Alto. You can go down the wall for a fantastic photo op on top of Martim Moniz square. On the other side you can climb the walls of the rebuilt fortress, and view both the Western and Eastern sides of Lisbon, with S. Vicente Convent, the national Pantheon and Graça.A nice cafeteria and small park with peacocks completes this most historical of places, that was the seat of the portuguese monarchy until the XVI century and the stage of one of the most important acts of portuguese history the death of Conde Andeiro at the hands of the Master of Avis that sparked the 1383-1385 revolution
Paying for the view and not much else. Difficult to get to, not much see regarding the castle, but the view is spectacular. Other similar sites are less expensive and more worthy of a visit.
Great visit. Quite a lot to see with this ruin, great views and historical information, one thing it was windy when I went, my advice don't wear a dress nearly had a Marilyn Monroe moment.

Certainly a Castle in the sky.. This is sited in an area providing commanding views of Lisbon and the coast. The walk up to it entails some steep hills but can be approached by Tram 28 and elevators are a useful advantage. The history surrounding the Castelo is well worth reading. Sadly in present day this is an area to beware of pickpockets.

Best views of the city. fantastic views of Lisbon perched high up a steep hill, recommend taking the tram. The castle is all about the building and walls rather than anything inside and be very careful if you have young kids as it could be potentially a bit dangerous on some of the rampart climbing, but definitely a must see.

Well worth the visit. 8.50 euros. Worth it to see the fantastic views and play at castles for an hour or so.
Food is available with one restaurant offering fantastic views be it at a price (25 euro for a main).

Fun for the kids to explore. The views of Lisbon are worth it alone. A permanent exhibit and camera obscurer are also worth a look. Take your time walking the site and be prepared to walk the steps. There is a restaurant inside and you can get a gelato at a food van.

Great views. Well worth a walk up to the castle because of the spectacular views as well as an interesting walk around this historic building.
Adults €8.50 and we stayed for a couple of hours.

Fantastic views!. If you want to experience the streets of Lisboa you should hike all the way up here!! It is a good climb...along the way you will find all kinds of little shop, wine-bars, pasteleria's, art galleries etc. Nice walk! The castle is well kept...and from here you have amazing views!!!
Outstanding view. Outstanding view over the roofs, river, colours, History and soul of the country. Don't take your car

Worth it for the views over Lisbon. Worth the walk up to the Castle, but you can also get bus or tuk tuk. Entry fee seems reasonable and some lovely views all over Lisbon. Great to explore all the walled areas and climb the towers. Some steps are steep and narrow, so not recommended for those who having difficulty with steps, but still can access areas with good views, but you wouldn't get to all areas. Go on a nice clear day though, as if overcast, you would miss out.
Great.. We had a nice walk the view was amazing. Go comfortable since you will encounter dusty floors and rocky stair climbing.

Amazing views of Lisbon. The castle itself doesn't have a lot to see, but the views of Lisbon from the gardens are the best reason to go. The views are hard to beat! Plus there was a nice little wine cart that sells wine by the glass to enjoy while you take in the scenery. I would highly recommend for a couple. I'm not sure how much kids would enjoy, though.

Beautiful view from the gardens!. We weren't really sure what to expect but the gardens were beautiful and the view was awesome. We did walk along the top of the castle and took many great pictures of the city below. There is a very picturesque cafe there as well. We tried to find the 'Camera Obscura' which sounded interesting (but we only found it after it closed at 5pm). It was fun to have a drink on the way up (and watch the streetcars) and fun to walk back down (we walked along a staircase that had lots of really neat graffiti).
Stunning views . Although we didn't read much about the castle itself there are stunning views of Lisbon and a tranquil atmosphere to be found here. Makes for great photographs.

Nice View but not much else. . The view is pretty amazing but the castle is fairly average. As long as you know you're paying for the privilige of getting a good selfie, you'll enjoy it. Otherwise I'd probably not bother.

Another Gem in Lisbon. To get a better sense of Lisbon's long, rich and culturally varied history, a visit to this incredible national monument is something I would highly recommend. It has an archaeological site that is now open to visitors and from which a wealth of fragments and objects are now on display, some dating long before Christ. The view from the top is great, too.

Great views from the garden . We managed to get in to the castle without the long queues by getting there in the morning. The view over Lisbon from the shady garden is worth the admission price alone, but perhaps not worth waiting an hour for entry in the baking sun if you get there late!
Great lookout over the city. The castle is well preserved and offers a great lookout over the city. The museum is a bit small. Worth the climb up the hill.

Ok, over priced, and a bit disappointing. A slice of Portugal's history to be respected. But, not worth the cost of seeing a shell of a structure. Honestly, I can see why it's rated as low on the must see list. The views are amazing, but not exclusive. What is most disappointing is the lack of regard for the site. Trash toss around and graffiti carved into the stone, and with no guards around, it's easy to see how that can happen.

Great views. Take the #28 tram - very scenic city ride. The driver will announce the Castle. A short walk and small entrance fee and you will have the most beautiful views of Lisbon. The castle provides some great photo opportunities as well.
City view!. Nice place to visit! View of Lisbon city. Expensive to be admitted EU8.50. Stores around with typical tiles.

The Castle. Well worth the visit. Catch the bus there and back because it is a long steep walk. Great views and interesting in its own right. Spend a good couple of hours there. The bus drops you back to the square where you can catch another bus to Bellem which is also worthwhile. So almost a day trip in itself if you combine both.

Good views and a good workout.. Panoramic views across Lisbon and beyond. The walk around the ramparts was good fun with lots of photo opportunities. Accepting this is a reconstruction, it is a good job and provides a good sense of the history behind the place. Like anything in Lisbon the walk to and from provides a good physical workout before you find a new patisserie to try out.
Great views of the city . Get there early. Great views of the city and the bay. Nicely kept grounds. You can easily walk down to the lower city through small streets.

Love Castles and this was no exception! . Make sure you see the ruins there. It's a free tour. Which ruins you ask? Why all three of course. The views are great and to be able to stand in what once were rooms for three different civilisations. So cool.

Impressive until learned it was redone in 19th century. It's huge and has a great view, but found out afterwards it isn't all original. Still a great view and nice to get out of Lisbon to see something different.

Castle poor, camera obscura and view nice. The entrance fee of 8,5€ I find way overpriced for this castle, which is nothing more than a restoration of how it once might have looked. There is not much of an explanation of what building used to be what so it felt like a bit of a rip off, till we went to the camera obscura. This was most interesting, since the visit comes with an explanation from a guide. Also the view was nice, but it's not like you can only see this view in the castle. So worth the visit? Not that much, although camera obscura and view compensated the lack of interesting stuff to see.

Not much inside!. Castles are usually attractive and I love them. Unfortunately, Castle St Jorge did not waow me. I was quite excited seeing it from outside but there was little to see inside. I dont think Ive heard much of the history either. The views are however breathtaking but you can also have panoramic views for free somewhere else. I was disappointed. Dont waste your money!

A must see to visit. Castelo de Sao Jorge is a must see while in Lisbon. Finding the entrance isn't easy if you are following the signs and walking up the hill. We weren't the only ones who got lost but a friendly guard armed with a map pointed us in the right direction. Once inside, the views of the city are spectacular; you can see all of Old Lisbon from the vistas. The castle and grounds themselves a great to explore. Definitely a must see while in Lisbon.

Run around the ramparts - Disneyworld without health & safety !. A modern reconstruction of an old castle. They let you run around on some steep steps and narrow ramparts with sheer falls either side and no guard rails. Would love to observe in the rain or a mother's expression with unruly teenagers playing at defending the castle. My favourite was two fat people trying to pass each other at a narrow point. How they made it up the steps remains a mystery. Apart from the views not much to see or do. Museum is poor, broken crockery and suchlike.
Beautiful attraction in Lisbon. A lot of really intersting history throughout. Unfortunately it was poor weather the day I visited, but I can imagine it would be wonderful on a nice sunny day

Best experience during our visit to Lisbon.. Best experience during our visit to Lisbon.
Much has been done to make the place interesting and a nice place to visit
Castelo de Sao Jorge. Fantastic place, beautiful location and great views of Lisboa and the surrounding area. Clean, tidy, lovely cafe well worth the visit.

Don't miss the camera obscura. We spent a few hours at the castell which is interesting in itself but was made by the camera obscura. When we visited on a Tuesday there was a queue for this but luckily we got the 20 minutes past the hour English version. The guide was excellent. Best way to get there is on the tram, number 28, which is very busy but fun to ride, ask the driver when to get off as otherwise you will be on the way back down the other side of the hill!
It's a must. It's a must in Lisaboa. Take the trap from the main street to the Castle, beautiful experience. In the castle also a beautiful experience. Wonderful view and wonderful tim.
It's for the views. Great views, not too expensive and you do get to walk around the castle walls, however it is all about the 360 degree views of Lisbon

Beautiful grounds and amazing views. Much better than expected. Very efficient ticket sales staff then into the garden wich had amazing views over Lisbon. The grounds and castle are both worth a visit and we, to our surprise, spent a few hours here.

Amazing views. We were going to go by tram to see the castle but the queues from the centre were horrendous. We decided instead to walk, although it is a steep, uphill journey it was fantastic to walk and come across little squares and districts that we would otherwise have missed.The views from the castle are amazing and it was so worth that walk! There are little picnic areas in the grounds or there is a small café selling snacks. It was very easy to get on a tram for the journey back and I would really recommend doing the journey that way. Don't queue for the way up, you're wasting time when you could be exploring the area - enjoy the tram for the return trip!

Nice view. We visited Lisabon in September.The castle is nice and offers a very good view of the city. Personally i liked the way the city could be seen from here. Otherwise, after visiting Sintra and the castels there...well is hard to compare.In conclusion, it is an interesting fortress to see but it is mainly becase it offers you a magnificent view over the city.

Don't miss if you're in Lisbon. We took a taxi up to the castle and walked down - there is fabulous view of Lisbon from the castle. Alternatively ou can hop on a tram or take a Tuk Tuk, Take time to explore all the back streets around it and stop for a Portugese lunch of grilled fish. We took a Tuk Tuk around the Alfarma neighborhood - well worth it - the Tuk Tuk drivers are pretty knowledgable - it's a great way to see this neighborhood.

Must see in Lisbon!. The Sao Jorge Castle is worth the challenging, steep walk through the historical Alfama district with spectacular views of Lisbon. This is a well-preserved 11th century fortification and includes archaeological ruins.

Did someone already mentionned the view?. The castle itself is very average, not much interesting but like hundreds have wrote before, you go there mainly for the magnificent view of Lisbon. I don't regret going but wished there was more "castle" to visit.

the castle itself means the past, the view of Lisbon with the mighty river is awesome!. You may walk up to the higest hill (among the seven) or go by one of 2 old trams, either way you may enjoy other actrations, but you must appreciate the views which is the reason why you actually go there, and sit on the old ruined walls and enjoy...

Magical. This was mystical ! Makes you wonder how they kept warm in those times.How creative they were in building this Castle and others.They were built sturdy and consistent in their design.What skills they had !What talent !You wonder what it was like back then.We went there three times so far.Every time you see something you did'nt see before.

Stunning views, reasonable entry fee. Definitely worth a visit when in Lisbon. Great walk up to the castle through the Alfama neighborhood. I enjoyed walking around the layers of walls surrounding the actual castle, and on the walls/up to the towers. The museum of archeological items found during restoration was small but good.- Entrance fee not discounted or free with Lisboa Card- Wear solid footwear to climb the wall steps (some steep and small steps)- If you want to see the camera obscura, go there first and find out the tour time in your language then explore and come back.- Don't forget your camera!- Suggest to go 1-2 hrs before sunset then watch the sunset up there.
Beautiful view.... ....and that's just about it. Unfortunately the interior has been massively affected by an earthquake so one can only see fragments of how it was once living within the castle.

Worth the fee. Super views, and worth the fee in. Walked up from city 20 mins or so. Super Village and worth the effort. The walls of castle give a super super view of Lisbon. My opinion spend the 8.50€ and you will not regret it. Yellow bus tour get a 10% discount

Stunning views. The castle, sitting on top of its hill, is not only an impressive and evocative monument in its own right but a superb vantage point to view the historic city. Do take time to visit. Easy access by tram, can, bus or tuk tuk and with plenty of cafes and restaurants close by.

Amazing Views of the City, Port, Bridge. Take the trolley car up to the castle. It's a great experience. Enjoy the views of the city and bay. Have a pitcher of sangria and lunch on the patio. The castle has a great draw bridge and walls but not much else. Its the experience that will stay with you.
OK but a little pricey.. A bit disappointed with the castle. Good views and some nice neighborhoods to walk by the castle. I thought 8.50 Euros a little much for what you get to see.
amazing views. We went here and just sit on the bench at first and enjoy the view. After that we went to see around. It is a really nice place!

Amazing views over the city. We got the green line hop on hop off bus then walked the steep climb to the castle. Very reasonable entrance fee. The views over Lisbon are breathtaking, and walking the walls and through the castle is very enjoyable. We went at 3pm and it wasn't too busy. Well worth a visit.

It's up a big hill ... but most castles are :). I would strongly recommend you visit this attraction if you are in Lisbon, if only for the amazing views. To get these of course, you have to tackle a steep climb from the city below but you can get a tram all the way up there if the queues at the stops aren't too bad. We walked it, with the cathedral providing a very welcome break on the way up. The walls are pretty much in tact, allowing you to walk along the ramparts but there are no upper floors in place, so the building is essentially a shell. For us, definitely worth the effort of getting there.
Worth the long, uphill walk from the shore. Lots of fine views over the city and plenty of interesting aspects. Try the number 12 tram and take in the neighbouring tiny streets and alleys.

Steep walk but great views. We walked up to the castle and paid to enter the grounds. The views are amazing. Plenty of maps detailing the layout of the castle but a little underwhelming. We had just missed the English speaking tour so don't know if that was a bit more enlightening. Glad we made the effort.

Beautifull views. Well worth visiting this castle,such fantastic views & so much history,Wear suitable shoes as it is a very cobbled area.If you have disabilities(in a wheel chair) probably not the best place to visit.

Decent Views, nothing much in the Castle. The castle is located on top of the hill and hence provides with good views of the city and the waterfront.. However, in terms of the castle itself, its mostly walls and ruins with very little to see in itself..There are also a few exhibits which may be of interest to some people but we found it to be very average overall..

Great view, amazing place. . The place doesn't have much to see. It's worth it if you want to make lots of great pictures Andretti know something about the old buildings in Portuguese history. It's a little pricy but it's worth if you want to see the whole city fromAbove
Nice views. Nice views across Lisbon as you walk around the walls. Not much going on inside otherwise. 8.50 euro seems a bit expensive.

So Peaceful and lovely . You got to come here.. Fascinating building with a fascinating history.. Giving a good intro into Portuguese history. Queues could be an issue so get a combined ticked for this and the tower so you only have to queue once.
Impressive castle. Place with a wonderful view over Lisbon, where you can explore its history. Best time to visit is early evening, when you can enjoy a sunset.
Best place ever :-). It is the center of Lisbon, pure history, beautiful views. Always worth a visit, always worth the time.

Be careful of muggers! . We took a tuk tuk ride up to the castle which turned out to be a great plan as once at the castle there was still plenty of walking to be done! You can also take tram 28, and we did get this back down.The castle itself was lovely, with great views across lisbon that shouldn't be missed. However after leaving the castle we were approached by a man who appeared to want to chat. We tried politely to get away as it seemed very suspicious, when he put a necklace around my neck and would not accept payment. He appeared hurt and offended that I did not want the "gift "and the tried to give my boyfriend a wooden bracelet in the same way. This is a well know scam to mark tourists out as potentially having valuables, little did he know I only had ten euros and no jewellery!I made my boyfriend take the necklace off me and give it back and we left the area asap, however we saw that he then spoke to another man selling necklaces who followed and approached us in a nearby cafe, saying that he had seen us earlier and was watching! At this point we joined the tram queue and left. We felt very unsafe and didn't return to that area at all which was a shame as it was very pretty. Keep cameras and valuables hidden once outside the castle, as we thought we were wise to these scammers but we got drawn in very quickly.

Nice day out.. Good morning spent in the Castle. A lot of walking and climbing. Take a taxi or tuktuk if you are with children. It's a long climb up and plenty more steps in the castle. Loved the views from the Castle and the peacocks in the castle. The small village housed in the castle walls is a nice place to wander. Well worth the visit.

Very nice view of the city. The view is fantastic, but everything else is just ordinary. The roads that lead up to the castle are very steep and go through some very nice areas, with typical Lisbon styled housing.

Worth visiting . It's centrally located and features a viewing of an incredible piece of history. Aside from the various towers, there's not a whole lot to see. It's lacking swords and armor, but do bring your camera, as the views of Lisbon can't be beat.
Do not miss a visit to this castle!. The castle is a great place to explore and has spectacular views over Lisbon and the river. Stairs can be steep but are worth the climb.

Great couple of hours. The cattle if impressive, but it's all about the view. €8.50 to enter though, so bare that it mind before making the trek. There is a lift that can take you up a good portion of it though, free of charge.
Panoramic view of Lisbon. The castle and the surrounding disctrict is very nice, worth to climb it on foot. The panoramic view of Lisbon is amaizing from the castle.

Magnifico. Honestly start your journey by the Tram from Prac de Figuere Lisbon winding by narrow streets up to the top of the fort once there you start by visiting the museum for updates need to also know that one of the early inhabitants were the Arabs you can have breathtaking views of the city of Lisbon besides the lovely architecture of the Castle.if you likeTo walk take a walk down to the cityYou feel amazing!

Not worth your time and money. I was really looking forward to visiting the castle but once we got there it was really disappointing. Overpriced (8,50 euros per person), yet it offers so little. Yes, views of the city from up there are nice, but you can get even prettier views for free on nearby miradouros like Senhora do Monte or Graca. The castle itself is pretty boring, just a lot of walls you climb and walk on while being pushed by other visitors because it's so crowded during season. We didn't get to see the popular Camera obscura because bad organisation of the staff is causing huge queues. After 15 min of waiting in the sun we were informed that next english tour will be in 40 min. Archaeological site was closed for some reason, without explanation. The caste also hosts a small museum which is pretty avarage. The best thing about whole place are peacocks outside. All in all, this "attraction" can easily be missed. I wish we spent our time and money visiting something better.

Just a castle. The visit to Castelo de Sao Jorge was kind of disappointing as my expectations were too high. It's just a castle, that's it. The view over Lisbon city is wonderful, but that's the best part of the visit.

do not miss this Castle. Wonderful views and historical perspective. I received a tour of the archeological site and Fabio Malta did a wonderful job describing the ruins and all the different civilizations that shared this space

Fantastic history. There’s a steep climb to the castle but it’s absolutely worth it. Fantastic views of the city and river are on offer here, as is a fine wander to take in some history of the site and the city. There’s a small museum within the castle which is worth a visit as well. another reasonably priced attraction in Lisbon and one I would recommend adding to your itinerary.
So - so. Nice view but nothing special. The regular castle with nothing much inside. As for me, the ticket a bit expensive for this place.

A Wonderful Castle. If you are in Lisbon this is a must see. It is a beautiful castle in itself (think great battlements, not an elegant indoor experience), but the views above Lisbon are the best. The streets outside the castle have lots of little cafes and shops, fun to walk through. Inside the castle, there is a nice museum and café, also a very upscale restaurant with outdoor seating on the side of the castle overlooking the center of the city.

Excellent viewpoint and interesting Medieval architecture. As we were on a tour through Portugal, this castle and ticket was included in the tour. Therefore we did not have to queue at all. It was a perfect day and the view was incredible! The castle and museum was all really interesting. The walk to the castle was also fascinating. An amazing attraction and icon of Lisboa!

Nice place to visit, maybe buy a city ticket. Beautiful place for a walk around and enjoy the view, also to see the outline of the castle and the arquitectural sites. Unfortunately the entrance is a bit too expensive for what you are getting. Quite impressive that it's smack bang in the middle of a city

A Must See In Lisbon. This is a must see when you are in Lisbon. You get an entirely different feel for the city and the harbour from atop the hill at the castle. Local artisans also set up tables outside and you can find all kinds of interesting things. Be sure to see the video inside the castle which gives you a sense of the history of the harbor and the part Lisbon played in world history.
It's a big castle on a hill.. It really is just a big castle on a hill. Nice views if you can duck under all the selfie sticks.A great place to see a spectacular sunset.

Nice view but not much else. The view from the Castelo is great! But there isn't much else in there. Bit pricey for €8.50 but it's a key landmark of Lisbon so probably still worth a visit. We did this after the Chill Out Tour, which ended 5 mins from it, so it was convenient for us, but it would otherwise take a while to get to. And it is a steep climb to it!

Magnificent views of city. I queued for well over an hour to take a number 28 tram to the castle (but that's another story). It was well worth the wait. The castle is still intact enough to walk the ramparts. The views of the city are breathtaking. There's a restaurant (seemed a bit over-priced), but it has city views and a cafe (reasonable value for money and choice). No views but a fascinating family of peacocks. The exhibition and archeological site are worth a visit.

Don't miss the periscope. The Castle is beautiful and you'll have a wonderful views from the city; but don't miss the periscope. It's an optical system of lenses and mirrors that provides a 360º detailed views of the city in real time (20 minutes starting at 10 AM until 5:30PM). Children loves it!

A must see sight with wonderful views across the city of Lisbon.... ... but I was missing any sort of historic feeling when I wandered through 20th century concrete reconstructions of what used to be the historic birthplace of Lisbon. There are more authentic ways to conserve history, unfortunately none of them was used at Castelo de Sao Jorge.
Like a vast fortress. It is an important landmark of Lisbon and you should not miss it. You can climb up and down on the narrow staircases and enjoy some wonderful views from the towers.

Castelo. We walked from the Praca do Commercio through the steep old medieval stairs & back streets up towards the Se cathedral, which was picturesque with the tram passing outside etc. we then walked the steep path left up towards the magnificent views over the Alfama district. Once we arrived there we took a small lane filled with graffiti- leading to an improv outdoor art exhibition just behind a strange skeleton of an old prison. Strange vibe form it, like it didn't belong to the place.Then the path widened until we got to the Castelo. A little pricey, 12€ each, but we went up just as the sun was setting, absolutely beautiful views. In a courtyard a crusader statue reminds us of Portugal's incredible history, but while we walked we took some of the best photo's from our trip. The castle walls and interior was well maintained and it's powerful facade has a seemingly ageless appearance. Great visit, probably worth the price. Get a bus back down, we we're fatigued after all the climbing!
Well worth visiting. Very atmospheric place, well worth visiting. We caught tram 28 and then walked up steep slope. Reasonable prices in cafe. Superb views all round

Most beautiful panoramic view. We just came back from the castle. It's a beautiful day in Lisbon, so we decided to walk up there... About 15 mins... Very nice.The castle is worth seing... It has been well restored, the walls and miradors have really thick walls.The most amazing part was definitely the view covering the Tagus river, the bridge the city, all the way to the parc Edouard VII.There were a lot of people and the rock steps could be slippery even dry, but it is worth it...Some people were enjoying a glass of wine, from the terrace restaurant (?) while enjoying the views..I would have liked to have an audio guide but there weren't any...
The View. Possibly the most beutiful view you can find of Lisbon. This is a must on your list of what to visit and you can take a tram or a bus up or down (very steep roads).

A must for all Lisbon visitors. worth seeing just to understand more about the history of this fine city. This an area seemingly unaffected by the earthquake and fire which destroyed so much of the centre. The History of the castle is the history of Lisbon with its different inhabitants over the centuries. The old cannons are great for photos. The inner keep is impressive and provides even higher views of the city than the main castle walls. Go early- it gets busy. We took a taxi up and walked down through the ancient streets of Alfama. A jazz band was busking outside the castle entrance which really added to the atmosphere.

Fantastic panoramic view. Beautiful place to watch the sunset, so best time to visit is early evening (6pm). Steep walk to get there. Consider taking a tuktuk or take the elevator to a nearby bar. Afterwards you can eat something at Chapito which is nearby (entrance is a shop).

Have to visit if you like good views . It's a nice walk all the way to the Castelo from the centre - just make sure you know the right entrance: if you just locate one on the map and go for it you will find yourself like me and a few others at an entrance that is for staff only and will have to go round the whole of the Castello to the correct entrance! Great views though when you are there.
Historic site with a breathtaking view of the city. Well worth the price. Drive up there with the 28E and walk the rest - or walk through alfama all the way up. The sight of Lisboa is worth it.

Got injured at the Castle. The Castle has a lot of history and a beautiful view of the centre of Lisbon. However be very careful walking in the grounds of the Castle. I was there and fell. My husband had to go look for some ice for my ankle. A security guard and a first aid person came to my aid...after my husband helped me the first aid person wrapped my foot in gaze to give it some support and said it probably wasn't broken because I could move a couple of the toes. They couldn't get me out of there fast enough.they kept saying that it would be great if I could walk to the entrance so They could call a cab for us, they didn't even offer to pay for that taxi. It turned out my ankle was broken, the gaze wrapped on my ankle caused a blood circulation issue. A month has passed l am still in recovery and never had a cortesy call or message from the castle administration . I wasn't the only person that fell in there on that day...the staff just didn't same to care.Lisbon is beautiful! Just be aware when you visit historical places like the Castle you pay a fee to go in but if something happens you probably will be on your own like us. Just make sure you are able to walk to the front gate so they can have you out of there...

Amazing view over the city. The castle offers fantastic views over the Baixa district and River Tagus. We went in late afternoon and we could watch the sunset. I think it is the best place in Lisbon to watch the sunset and enjoy it with a glass of Portuguese wine from "Wine with a view".

See the spectaular view and burn a few calories!!. We had a great day here at the castle... amazing views over the city, took more than a few panorama pics on my iPhone!!! BUT as title say, you will burn a few calories if you take on the various steps up and down the castle.As a few said before... not geared towards the elderly or young kids in buggies.Besides the view and various parts of the castle, there is not much to see, dont get me wrong, we still enjoyed it, I will still recommend as its a must do thing.Only real negative I think is the price, €8.50, maybe €5.00 would be a better price, felt a bit short changed.

Best views of Lisbon. This hilltop fortress is expansive and offers incredible views of Lisbon. The actual interior of the fortress is frequented by picnicking locals, restaurants, cafes and spartan stone walls. Do not come here expecting a palace as it only shows signs of having been used strictly as a defensive site.

An ancient castle right in the middle of town, well worth a visit.. The castle is a very interesting place to explore, you really get the feeling of how it must have been like to live in. From its walls there are great views over Lisbon. Musicians often play in the courtyards which add to the delightful atmosphere. There is also an attractive looking restaurant but it is fairly expensive but great for a special treat.

São Jorge Castle: a must see in Lisbon!. The São Jorge Castleis a Moorish castle occupying one of the most beautiful hilltops in Lisbon (Lisbon is also known as the City of the 7 Hilltops). The Castle, above Lisbon's most peculiar neighborhoods Mouraria and Alfama, looks proudly to the historic centre, the cathedral and Tagus River.It´s a must see (and s you can't miss it!),

Beautiful views. Well worth a visit, lovely walking round the castle and when your at the top the views are amazing, to top it off there's a place to buy wine, so you can sit and enjoy wine with a view

Well worth a visit. A great castle to explore with all the family, excepting perhaps those in buggies, under 5s or the elderly, who'll find the uneven ground and high, precarious walkways on the ramparts a bit tricky.Great for everyone else. Nice little museum and shady café. About €8 for adults, with a saving for concessions.

Great view of all Lisbon. The castle is just something you have to visit while beeing in Lisbon. When you enter the castle there is a very nice park with lots of trees where you can find some shade during hot day and give a rest to your legs on a bench. Take a walk around the castle and you will see Lisbon from the top.

Amazing views. We made it here on our last evening in Lisbon and I was so glad we did. The panoramic views from all angles were truly amazing and made even more beautiful by the setting sun and shadows on the ancient stone work. A definite must see for any visitor to this wonderful city.

Great views but overrated price. In Castelo de S, Jorge you can enjoy a great view to Lisbon and walk along the wall which is in great condition. The con is the price (8,5€ per person) which seems a little exaggerated specially when you cannot access the archaeological site and also, for the moment, there isn't a discount available using the Lisboa Card.

Interesting Castle Complex with a great view. We primarily visited the castle for the view on Lisbon, but walking around the premises we enjoyed exploring the whole castle. The complimentary guide explains a few things to the main attractions. Furthermore they do a good job presenting some of their excavations, e.g. the Arabian Quarter.

Good value break from the bustle & noise of Lisbon. Great views from this very calm and spacious attraction. The cafe (behind the restaurant) offers good value food and pleasant service (if you can fight off the peacocks and pigeons). My only criticism is that the signage and map leave a LOT to be desired. The archaeological sites (old Moorish houses etc) North of the castle are only accessed from the North East corner of the castle ... this was only clear after we'd walked out and round the castle, so we missed these potentially interesting bits of the site. The museum / exhibition is a bit dry, especially for kids.

Great views of the city and port. Enjoyable time. Panoramic views of the city and port can be enjoyed while grabbing a bite to eat. But watch out for the pigeons who seem to be quite hungry and aggressive.

Fantastic Vistas. Not a great deal to do inside,quite a hike up from the lower street but plenty of tuk tuks to take you up if hungover.Fado street band playing outside entrance which was cool. €8.50 enhance fee which is reasonable only criticism was there was not a lot of explanation for what you were looking at.From the entry point you walk over to the lowest keep wall which gives you fabulous views of lisbon and the river.As you work your way around the castle your level of elevation Increases to the highest point of the castle which is the towers on the wall.we had a lovely day walking around the castle and taking lots more pictures of lisbon.The one relatively exciting point was watching the peacocks climbing the trees

Lots of walls to walk upon. The views of the city are panoramic and eye-catching. Other than that, it's courtyards (the main exterior courtyard is attractive) stone walls and walking around on them. There is a small museum of pottery shards and some coins. Mostly, I was glad to have been there just to say to myself "I have been there". I like the historical connection but at the end of the day, it's just a fort... unless, of course, it's the only thing between you and the besieging hordes. Then it becomes that much more important.

Great views of Lisbon. This place has stunning views of Lisbon. Really breathtaking. The day we went it was pretty busy, but we found a place just to sit and relax. You can even buy a bottle of wine, and they give you unbreakable wine glasses. You can tour the entire castle with a glass of wine!!
A castle as so many others. CSJ is a nice castle with a great view on the river Tagus. This said, the rest of the Castle is just 'another Castle'. Should not be with in your top 3 list.

360 degree views of Lisbon. Beautiful gardens, shady in the heat and fantastic views. Quite difficult for us to find the entrance, but worth it. Accessible but uneven walking, and obviously as a castle quite a few steps to battlements.

Nice. The entrance fee was a fair price. The castle itself is nice and everthing around, too. What I appreciated the most, were the views all around the castle over Lisbon. What disappointed me was that the panoramic vue centre was closed way before the castle closed...

Great View!. It is a difficult find but when you do it will be well worth it as you will have the best view of Lisbon! Be careful of the steps when climbing the towers!
@instabuilt

Great views. Could be so much better!. Signposting from the town is diabolical so be prepared for a walk. We weren't the only ones guessing where to go next. Once there expect a queue for tickets but it doesn't take long. The views are spectacular but that is about it. There was very little information about the history anywhere which left us wondering what we were actually looking at. You do need to be reasonably fit to look round as there are lots of steep and narrow steps, many with no hand rails. If you are disabled you simply can not get round and I wouldn't recommend if you are elderly, have any knee/back injuries or if you are on the large side as many areas are narrow!Plenty of refreshments available but no information. A shame. We paid €20 for a view. Would have preferred to have paid more and have been able to have read about the history as we went round.

The views alone make it a worthwhile visit.. We visited many a lookout in Lisbon but nothing came close to this one! Absolutely sensational views. Walking around the castle was okay but all the magic is at the start as you walk in and enjoy the view.
Amazing place with spectacular views. It's a must! It is worth to visit this marvellous castle near the neighbourhood "Mouraria". Adult tickets cost 8,5€. Spectacular views of Lisbon.

Good views, that's it. . I love castles. But this castle is not impressive in anyway. The views are beautiful , if you love panoramas that's your place to visit.The woman working in the cafe had no change so she decided it's ok to just not give us change! The service in the cafe was depressing and everything overpriced. Keep an eye out for the young guy selling his black and white photographs of Lisbon on your way out at the arch. They're beautiful.

Some Great Views. The Castelo offers some great views over Lisbon and the Tagus and fun clambering up the old walls. But take care as fencing is often low or just not there and there are crowds of people walking the walls. Overall, it's worth the hike up the hill but there's not that much to look at after the views.

Nice view of the city . a place to see for the view of the city, it's a big place for walk around but not a lot of thing to see specially for 8,5€ they have the castle in the middle and we can't see nothing except walk on it.

Cool Experience - Best Views of Lisbon. Castle from the Medieval period in Portugal's history. Probably some of the best views of Lisbon from the Castle. We went during the late afternoon, can be quite a walk (hike) to get there, but there are tuktuk's available that bring you right to the gates.

Beautiful views!. The best views of Lisboa are seen from up here! You have to visit just to see these views! I was absolutely blown away. The castle was also super fun to walk around! I am afraid of heights so it was sort of terrifying in some points and the stairs are a bit sketchy, but it was so fun and definitely worth it! Try to find the peacocks too.

Fun and Views!. The first thing we saw before entering the castle was the amazing panoramic views that the location gives, and we visited during the late afternoon so we enjoyed the sunset and it gave the castle such pretty colours. I felt like a kid going up and down the towers and as a big fan of medieval TVshows (i.e, GOT) I enjoyed it even more! My sister however felt a bit uneasy moving around since there weren't big safe/security measures, regardless that, she still enjoyed the amazing views.
Castle in great state. Amazing view from lisboa, the castle is in great state. I was a bit disappointed by the huge amount of dead ends inside that make you do the same thing's twice.
Great viewpoint. Well kept, excellent views of the city!Inside the walls of the internal castle are knight costumes and play sword battles for children, as well as an archeology museum
Another awesome Portuguese castle.. The castle is beautiful, peaceful, the views of Lisbon are stunning. We have been a few times and will definitely go back.

Excellent view of Lisbon!. Castelo de Sao Jorge like a lot of attractions is Lisbon is on a hill. The walk is very worth it, as the views of Lisbon and the Tagus River are breathtaking. The information brochures provide you with a comprehensive overview of the castle and the areas to visit.

Must see. The castelo de sao Jorge is located in the middle of LisbonYou can go to the castle by using bis 737 from Figuare plazaYou can buy a lisbon ticket or a metro ticket for 24 and use it to go to the castleWhen you arrive to the castle you need to buy ticket to enter the castleThe price is 8.50€ for adult and 5.00€ for studentThe castle is the place to see all around LisbonThe place is very beautiful
Great views of Lisbon, Tagus River and the Atlantic. Superb views from top of the hill. Overpriced shopping at Souvenir shop. Avoid and check other stores.
Cool Castelo. Enjoyed the walk around the wall. The views are pretty incredible as the castle is situated high on the hill. Not too much else to say. A little hard to find, not many signs.

Nice but expensive . My second time here and was shocked to find that you had to pay not only that, it was not cheap either €8 per ticket. Though the views are one of the best, packed full of tourist... so if it's just the views you are interested try one of the miradouros

You can have some fun!. Yah, for some it can might be just a wall, but it's a wall with lots of history, and impressive views!! When visiting this castle (like almost every castle) is recommended that you don't mind to work out. Lots of fun climbing!!! ;)
Place to go. Fantastic view of the city from the castle walls. Well preserved castle built in the 11th century during the moorish period. Don't miss it.

Million dollar views of Lisbon. Since I had hiked up in the heat to the castle, I knew I would pay the entrance fee and see what it beheld. The castle itself was interesting but not much more than an shell. The walking was a little nerve wracking when you had to climb the narrow steps to the castle walls- there was definitely not a enough room for people to come and up and down simultaneously. However, the delight came in the views from the castle grounds- absolutely stunning vistas over and over again. I think I kept taking pictures every time I walked a few feet over. It was really worth it for the views alone. I ate lunch the in courtyard with a simple sandwich and soda from the cafeteria styled cafe inside- you could take your pick from hot lunches, beer, wine,sandwiches, yogurt etc. The prices were a little high but not outrageous. The best part of eating outside the cafe was the tree with peacocks perched in it. I kept seeing people taking pictures of this tree and finally looked up to see 6-7 peacocks sitting in it. On the ground was a mother peacock and probably about 6 babies begging for crumbs. They were a hit. The mother will try to take your food if she stops at your table. Overall, a nice Lisbon site to see and spend some time after walking around the surrounding neighborhood. It's fun to get lost and find cute shops and bars.

Lisbon and its castle. The S. Jorge Castle is one of the Lisbon' symbolTwo things that you can't miss: the view from the Castle of Lisbon and th Tejo river's mouth and of course to go up and down the walls of the castle.It is also quite an experience to see Lisbon by nigth from the castle.

Magnificent charming castle with wonderful view of the city. If you could only visit 3 things in Lisbon, the 'Castelo São Jorge' had to be one of them.The views of the City plus the picturesque neighbourhood makes it one of Lisbon's top attraction.

Great views . The castle gives panoramic views over Lisbon and the river. Definitely worth the climb to get there. The cafe on the right just outside the ticket office also sells great coffee and delicious pasteis de nata!
This is not a boring castle. Trust me. I remember how beautiful this place was the evening we went, and the scent of jasmine flowers that were growing here. I took like a thousand peacock pictures

Lovely place. Great view to lisbon took great pictures and enjoyed the lovely weather tickets were about 6 or 7 euros. Got there by a little bit of walking as I was keen on walking in all the narrow streets a must visit

Fantastic views. Fantastic views over the city and there is a good restaurant tucked away round the back with tables which look out over the city. Not cheap but decent food and worth it for the views.

Amazing. Our concierge recommended we visit the castle. I wasn't too excited to see it, but I'm glad we went. The views and the history, well worth the visit. There are two restaurants...one that looked like fine dining, which wasn't open when I was there; the other with sandwiches, salads, yogurt, fruit, drinks, etc.
