Well worth the climb. Spectacular views. A must.. The views are worth the effort even though ours were not the best because of the rain, excellent castle to visit, cafe and restaurant within the grounds which are well priced. 7.50 euros to enter.Very steep steps to go up on the battlements.
Good views over Lisbon. A little underwhelmed by the castle itself, but it provided some great views of Lisbon. Take the number 12 tram to get up the hill.

Awesome views!. Nice place with beautiful views of the city. Took the trolly up to the castle and wandered about the surrounding streets. Fun place to just climb the stairs of the castle and see the whole city.

Go from downtown on foot. The castle offers a great view of Lisbon but paying for it is ridiculous. Go on Sunday or just check out the view and don't go to the paying area. What I really recommend is going up the small streets by foot for a great experience of old Lisbon. Wind you way up and back down not forgetting to visit the Sé (Lisbon Cathedral) and the miradouro de Santa Luzia for another good view of Lisbon.

So great wiews. You can see everything fron here: Ponte 28 de Abril, planes taking off and landing to the airport of Lisboa, peacocks posing under tourists´s cameras lights... Here you can see the the most spectacular views over Lisboa, if you only can find the way tho the castle,,,, People from restaurants were shoutind "Privet, privet!" and I had to say we´re not from Russia unfortunately...

Disappointed - left feeling ripped off. Visited the castle on a very stormy, wet and windy morning. Once we had paid our 7.50 euros to get in, we found that the whole inner keep along with the camera obscura tower was closed "for safety reasons". Fair enough, but it would be more honest to make customers aware of that before they buy their tickets. Views good, fairly interesting museum area but overall pretty average.

The picture here if from the Cathedral of Évora, Alentejo plains.. The best view point in whole city. The first settlement in Lisbon. A true display of the city long and fascinating history. Not only the castle, also the neighborhood that embrasses. Churches, palaces, museums and lots of good local tascas where you can join the locals for a late night dinner or to a petisco. The view over Lisbon by sunset is absolutely unforgettable.
A must see/must go. The castle offers panoramic views of old Lisbon. You must go and see it for yourself. Take your camera and take your time. You will enjoy it.

To expensive to get in!. You can walk in about 500 feet but then you have to pay to get in 7 euros per person is not worth it. Walk through the entrance walk to the right up the stone stairs to check out the view that is all you need.

the best view from the top of lisbon city.. Smell of history, lovely museum, great view, and the most beautiful photographs you can get in Lisbon. Only you have to climb a long distance up. In conclusion it is a lovely place that one should Not miss.

Go on a Sunday. as it is free ! Breath taking views from it, have to be able to climb stairs and a nice bar/cafetaria where you meet the Castle Peacocks! Yes, the castle has some peacocks living there, running free for the amusement of the crowd.

Great location, nice gardens. The castle offers great views the city and has some nice gardens and a small display of artifacts and an overview of its history. However, overall its disappointing and not really worth the entrance fee.

Fantastic views. We caught a cab to the castle, and spent an amazing hour walking over and under the walls, and looking over downtown Seville.This was well worth the cab and entry costs.We then walked back to our hotel which gave us a great chance to see the city from a walking perspective

Castle resplendent in the Lisbon sky. This does everything a castle should; impresses, amazes, chills, exerts, fascinates, thrills and charms. If you can walk up the hill enjoy the streets, wave at the children, smile at the old folks and nod to the gossiping locals as you pass by. It isn't a hard climb or very long, so take your time and look up, about and around. The Castle is cheap to enter and easy to navigate. Splendid battlements, plenty of signs, cannons, moat, draw bridge, what more could anyone want in a Castle? Oh yes, a nice place to eat and watch the artist feeding the cats, who chase the peacocks.
Go for the view. This castle does not have jewels, state rooms or glam. However, it has uprecendented views over Lisbon and is worth the visit for this reason alone.

disappointing restaurant. when you visit such a panoramic view as the top of the hill of Castelo S Jorge you would like to eat looking at the panoramic great view of Lisbon. However you want a good meal too. The meal is not what it should be for such a good location

Walk up. It's part of the fun.. Spent a great half hour walking up rather than taking the tram. The walk is half the fun and you can only ever get a little bit lost! The Castello was great but the killer views made it special. Couldn't believe how long we just sat and watched all of Lisbon beneath us.

Worth it for the views alone.. Spent half a day up there. When you get to the entrance it is not very interesting looking so you may question whether its worth it or not, we decided to take a chance and were not disappointed. The views from inside the castle are amazing, you can see all around the city. It is bigger than it seems too and there are some interesting hand made crafts and art to buy inside the grounds.Overall would recommend for a half day sight-seeing.

A symbol of Lisbon's history. You can get here with one of the smaller buses from Praça da Figueira (and return with streetcar 28E). It has seen all of the cuty's history: Visigoths, Moors, Christians, royalty and convicts from over 15 centuries. Great looks over the city.
Go for the views. The site sits atop a big hill in the middle of the city. It's a bit of a climb and walk to get there, but the views are worth it. Be prepared for the loud peacocks!

Amazing view of the city. You can catch a bus to the foot of the castle, otherwise it's a long walk uphill. The view is tremendous, so go on a clear day for amazing views of the city. The castle itself is interesting, but note that there are many steep walls in the castle with low, knee-high barriers that seem like they would be awfully dangerous for small children. You can also walk to a separate part of the castle that has remnants of the original Roman ruins and later Arab ruins that is very interesting.

Go for the view. It's quite a climb to get up - but the view is terrific and the peacocks are loverly to look at. There is also quite a few cats around which seems to be looked well after. The fee is low. You can walk around on top of the battlement. The museum though is not very interesting and can easily be skipped.
Interesting. This was a good way to spend a couple of hours but would be enhanced by an audio guide which i would gladly pay for. Signage throughout was also lacking.
Must visit. No visit to Lisbon is complete without a trip to the castelo. Gorgeous views of the city, the river. Peacocks strutting around, and we even enjoyed a classical guitarist in the courtyard.
Amazing views. Going up the hill is interesting,at the top the castle is stunning[the views]lots of things to see and climb also lots of work in progress.
Nice. The castle on its own is not very special but you have a fantastic view into the city and to the river
Beautiful views from the Castle. Watch Lisbon from the Castle. Definitely well worth a visit. Walk on the walls and climb the towers, enjoy the beautiful views and the sunshine.

Don´t miss it!. This one is a must be! Don´t go to Lisbon and miss this! Please! Although you have to pay a small fee, the story within these walls, the views and the tour will worth it´s value! Truly recommended!

Interesting to check out.... The castle is pretty interesting but it is much like other old castles/forts I've seen before. The views over the Lisbon are breathtaking for sure; many picture opportunities.
The cost is reasonable.
St. George's Castle is worth spending some time at; you only need an hour or two (maximum). The town surrounding the castle is nice to walk around.
Enjoy!

empty but nice views. The castle was never inhabited so there really isn't much to see inside. There are also very little informational signs. However, you can get nice views of the city from the walls.

Overpriced view point. This monument had one of the highest entry prices to anything we saw in Portugal and was the most disappointing. Basically, you can see the castle walls, walk around the top of the them to get a great view, and there is a small museum that has very few intact pieces. There are other places in Lisbon where you can get spectacular views without the price.

Location, location, location. The views are the story here. The admission lets you walk the perimeter of the astle along the walls on all four sides of the castle, two of which overlook the city and the river. I think this would be fun for kids as well. There really is not anything to see in the castle interior, so don't go in bad weather.

Nothing great. If you have seen or you are about to see the Christ Convent in Tomar, or are going to Sintra, this site is no impressive. Just a wall with a great view of Lisbon and some people hanging around. Its more a touristic thing then a authentic one. Go to Tomar, Sintra, Alcobaça, Batalha, Mafra, Óbidos and spend yourmoney seeing the real deal.

amazing views. This is a great place to wander around and soak in the views--go when the weather is good. Archaeological exhibits are well down and contribute to placing the castle in historical context. And the peacocks and cats are fun to watch!

Great view !!!. Its a must visit attraction in Lisbon as the castle itself is beautiful and the view on top is beautiful. If you dont want to walk up, you can take a bus from praca da figueira (cant remember if the bus number is 727, but you can around). There is a tour at the top of the castle and it can only accomodate 20pax each time (an hour interval for differnt language). In the tour, you can see the 360º view of Lisbon using an ancient telescope and this is awesome !

The website lied!!. On the website it says they open 365 days a year so we decided to go their on Dec. 25th since we have nothing else to do. When we (and also a lot of others) got there the castle completely closed!!

A great view. the castle's main atraction is the view! You can see all lisbon from there
it's really beautiful if you go at sunset.
Inside there's not really much to see but it's fun to explore

Great view!. The castle is very nice to see, but basically in my opinion the only thing to see in the view really... And Lisbon has got various great free viewpoints, so it depends on your budget really. Sometimes the cue is very long, so if you dont want the wait go to Miradouro de Graça!!!!

Worth the climb. Excellent views from the battlements. I love views and this castle has a good one- of the city
It seems to have been sensitively restored and a great place to take the family just to get a feel of a real medieval fort.
Quite a climb to get to it, but through interesting maze of narrow streets.

The castle is nice, but the views are the best. Climb by walk, from the Praça da Figueira (the streets you must take are indicated, but it's better asking the old neighbours. Attention: it's a senior climb. Every view (and there are quite a lot) is different and unique. Lisbon is here displayed in all her beauty. Don't miss any of the towers, but the 360º telescope is not a must. The museum is interesting, but not extremely worthy. The gift shop has, for a much higher price, the same things you can buy just outside the walls, When you descend, visit the Cathedral.

Beautiful views of the city. The castle itself is nice, with few intersecting relics but not much description provided, as mentioned before. The views, however, from the castle and the ground are stunning! It's worth the visit only to see the beautiful panoramic views

Nice view ... not much descriptions on display without a guide .... The view is spectacular from the gardens where guests enter ... you can see the entire city of Lisbon below and the River Tajo emptying into the Atlantic ...I definitely would have liked more info describing the history of the Castle on display without having to fork for a guide though ...

A great view of Lisbon. Inside the castle, there is often a guitarist playing fado, just adding to the great atmosphere. From the top of the site, you have a magnificent view of Lisbon, especially pleasant on a sunny day. Go take a look, this is a worthwhile visit.

Peacocks, Cats and Wonderful Views. Many walls and a few sets of stairs, but some great views too! It is by far not overloaded with things to see within the castle itself but it does offer some of the best views of the city from different angles. There are also random peacocks and cats strolling around the place which make it a bit more lively. The old Lisbon trams will bring you here (no. 28 or 12) from the city centre.

Interesting castle, great spot on the city. The place is a real castle of some middle ages with the big walls, canons and towers.There is a really great view on the city from most of the sides of the castle. The entrance to the castle is surrounded by small classic streets which are definitely worth walking by too.
Not to be missed!. Very definitely Lisbon's star attraction. We stayed about four hours, there was so much to see. Great views too.
Castle in Lisbon. Once we reached it the grounds and facilities were really nice we picnic'd in the grounds and enjoyed live music

A great place to visit and great views. The castle is very much refurbished (but they have had the odd earthquake) its a 1- 11/2 hour visit but the views over the city are also spectacular . Also try timing the planes landing at the airport !
Don't miss this!. Incredible views of the city and walking through a real piece of history! Be sure to tour the ramparts and the museum.

On a clear day you can see forever!. If the sun is shining and you have a blue sky then don't miss this. We spent over 2 hours climbing here there and everywhere to enjoy fabulous views of Lisbon. At E7.50 per person it's a bargain. NB this is not disabled or slow of movement friendly although the lower reaches are in play for all. AND you'll need to keep a close eye on young kids as it would appear (thankfully in my view) as though "elf & safety" haven't taken all the fun out of the place yet. You can't miss this if the weather is right.
A castle you must visit. the panorama is wonderful, music inside is divine, the food from cafeteria very good (best salmon I've ever eat), finally- great place!
Great views of Lisbon. Castelo de Sao Jorge is worth the effort to climb the hill. Spectacular views of Lisbon and interesting from a historical perspective.

Lovely view point.. Lovely view point. Not so many tourists either. fit enough to walk around in back and rest on your own. We took a break on a bench in the lovely autumn sunshine and admired the view while we enjoyed a glass of beer. recommended

Peacocks, cats, and a view.. The actual castle is a bit underwhelming, though I did like climbing around on the facade. My favorites were: (1) The peacocks and cats that roam around the inside, and (2) The view. You could sit there for an hour just admiring.

Excellent city views. A good place on a sunny day but little shelter otherwise. I took the bus up to the castle and walked back down through the Alfama district. A bit expensive for what's there but it is an excellent view over the city. Elf and Safety haven't been there judging by the lack of barriers around the battlements!
Fantastic views over the city - good value. Very good views. Steep steps though, care would be needed with children. We walked up from Rossio and the climb was well worthwhile.

Not a "Dream" Castle. We found this a little disappointing and had little to offer other than the view which could be found without paying the entrance fee. Other than yards and spaces, the castle had little to offer other than walls and views. If you don't like heights, you might not even get to see the best views!
Best historical place. You can walk several hours and you dont get bored because every corner has a story to tell. Great place to visit with your family.

Take bus 737 from Praca de Figueira all the way to the entrance. it is a steep climb and tram 12 only takes you half way up. If you feel like walking do it at the Castle where you can roam free for hours. Well worth the 7,50 euros entrance fee. Well preserved castle, fabulous views all over town and the river.

Best Views of Lisbon. St George's Castle overlooks the city and the water. Take the tram ride up, but if walking is a concern, take a bus right to the entrance. The short walk from the tram is through cobblestone streets with shops. Don't miss the view just across the street from where the tram stops. There are walls that you can climb via stairs in St. George for a 360 view of the city. The bus driver told us the aqueducts were much more beautiful, so don't miss those too. If you take the bus down, you can exit near the archway and enjoy the open plaza near the water. Be sure to have a gelato-the chocolate orange was fantastic!

WOW. Cannot do Lisbon without going to this attraction. In November there are not many people, it is very romantic with lots of wonderful views of the city. Try to have lots of time so you don't need to hurry ... the restaurant there (high end) appeared to be just wonderful - next time we'll try it!!! Well worth the visit. You can afterward, walk all the way down the hills through Alfama .. fantastic visit!

Majestic Lisbon Chateau - Castelo de S. Jorge. Castelo de S. Jorge, em Lisboa, PortugalBeautiful and magestic,with overview to all Lisbon and other litte povoations around.We can see Left Side of Lisbon, the Tejo River so blue...The green at City, beautiful sights.It´s one of the highers points of the city, so we can see everithing, the uptown, all the Lisbon hills.It was here, in this castle, that our first king, D. Afonso Henriques conquered our city.

Beautiful see sight. From the São Jorge Castle you can view magnificent sights of Lisbon, really impressive. On the side near D. Afonso Henriques statue you can see a breathtaking view on the Terreiro do Paço Square, the Tejo river and 25 de Abril Bridge. On the other side allows you to see the Martim Moniz Square and the slope of the belvedere of São Pedro de Alcantara. Also do not miss a visit in the late afternoon to watch the sunset. The price of entry to the castle is exaggerated. Tour not to be missed.
amazing place. one of the best sight seeing of Lisbon.panoramic view . read the heritage of Portugal.The castle is the highest point at the city and is but do not visible from everywhere..

St. George's Castle. What an amazing castle. We took the funicular part way up and then were astounded by the preservation of the castle. Definitely used as a fortification--the walls and entire castle were well preserved. Our favorite site in Lisbon.
Spectacular Views. The pheasants who wander throughout the castle.The views are wonderful, we walked along the ramparts and sat under a tree to savour the atmosphere.
Panoramic view. took Tram 28, 5 minute walk up to the castle..panoramic views over Lisbon city and the Tagus river...it’s worth visiting for the amazing views...
Only for the view. The only thing that made the climb up there worthwhile was really the view from up there over downtown Lisbon. Stick around during sunset. It was simply gorgeous for me.

Beautiful Castle. Great experience!! I love the view and I'm proud of it's history. Around the castle you must visit the neighbourhood, Alfama and Graça it's amazing too.
Enjoy the castle and try to go there when they have concerts or little outside shops! Amazing

Very interesting. When you're walking through the old part of Lisbon you can see the Castle up above and it's very enticing. There isn't a lot to actually see up there, mostly the surrounding fortress walls and walkways. There are some very ancient ruins from the iron age but unfortunately it was being worked on so we weren't able to see it. The view of the city from the castle is incredible and we took some amazing photos.

Castle tour. Moroccan-inspired architecture, is apparent, inspiring.Great views of the city from highest points of castle walls.unfortunately, it is hard to find, as it's literally walled in, in the old city centre and poorly marked (signage, directions)

Panoramic views!. Castelo de São Jorge is a medieval castle that overlooks Alfama. For centuries, the castle was the main residence of Portugal's monarchs. It sits high above the district of Baixa. Castle Sao Jorge provides tourists with panoramic views over central Lisbon. Hours: 9am-9pm. Admission fee: 7.50 EUR, children free. It’s worth visiting this site because of the amazing views towards the city and the river Taugus.

Beautiful! and not just the views!. Walk on up up and up. Just beyond the gate to the right is the ticket office. Then up a little more towards the actual fortress. We would recommend to go later in the afternoon. After seeing the castle grounds you can see an amazing sunset.

castle on the hill. this castle sits up high in Lisbon and you can experience the sweep of history and see the many beautiful vistas of the entire city by being up so high. It's easy to get to and is in a very pictoreque and fascinating old section of the city. Definitely worth a visit.

spectacular view. St. Georges castle is well worth a visit. It is set high above Lisbon and the view from there is spectacular. The castle itself is pretty much a ruin, but you can walk around the ramparts. There are very tame peacocks wandering around and a nice coffee shop.

Worth a visit. We took the tram along the coast and visited the castle...for photographers...it's a great building...but the interpretation of it is fascinating...worth going inside. The views are good too.
Interesting fortress castle with great views.. Make sure to spend time at this castle. There is even a restaurant located there. The view from the grounds is awesome.

A disappointment compared to other Portuguese castles. Like everything else in Lisbon, the castle was rebuilt after the 1755 earthquake. If I could just review it on its' own and forget the 9th century Moorish castle I saw in Sintra, the 12th century Convento de Cristo in Tomar, I would say its a perfectly nice newish castle. But its hard to forget those other things and in comparison this castle is a let down. It is also very small and much of it has been turned into a gift shop and dining area. It just loses a lot of appeal and history that way.
Amazing!. Great views and lots of history here. For students, the entry is 4e but it was definitely worth it. We went right at sunset and were able to see the entire city. It was absolutely amazing!

Autumnal beautiful day with breathtaking view!. Climbing up the narrow streets to this beautiful building, a fortress with panoramic views of Lisbon and the river Tagus. The vista is quite magnificent and awe inspiring. The fortress looks down on all commercial Lisbon's maritime activity. Meanwhile, explore the castle before 11.00am, you will find the hoards of tourists somewhat overwhelming if you leave your visit a bit later. The tour around the various aspects of the citadel is interesting and the archeological specimens varied. When you are finished, walk around the little side streets to take you back a few hundred years or more.
Beautiful view over Lisbon and Tagus river. Amazing view over Lisbon City and the Tagus river. If you have a chance to visit try to get there in the afternoon and stay for the suset.

Expensive but worth the view it if the weather is good. 5 euros to visit yet another old castle is only worth it if the weather is ok as the view over Lisbon is fantastic. Difficult access for elderly people due to the steep climb to get to the gate.

Impressive views. A bit of climbing if you want to go on foot. Impressive views over the city. The only minuspopint I must say is the parabolic view inside. The service is bureaucratic and not friendly at all.Suggestion: install your loved one in one off the small rooms on the wall and take a romantic picture.
Great View. I suggest you order a taxi to get to the top and walk back down. We spent 2 hours rambling around this wonderful ruin, be prepared to hike up steep steps, but the views are wonderful.

Beautiful views and atmosphere at sunset. Well worth a visit - take something to feed the peacocks too. If you stay till dusk the tiny bats fly in groups like swallows. The museum has some interesting artefacts but the views are the best bit. Outside the castle the cafes are a good place to stop and people watch.

Nothing special. Weather dependent, when it is wet the route can be very dangerous as it is slippery and not suitable for young ones or elderly. Views are only available when weather is clear. Lovely person at the gift shop but gifts are overpriced. Better souvenirs outside the castle. Good stone wall works. Staff were friendly.
Magnificent views over Lisbon. The castle is well worth a visit with fantastic views over the city. We loved it! Getting there can be challenging, good walking shoes are required! :o)
Amazing views well with a visit. Vistas over the city well worth the tram ride up. We had lunch at a little cafe on the hill outside of grilled sardines and a glass of rose which was nice.

great views. From the top of the hill, after a pleasant ride on the tram 28, you can stumble upon a majestic view over Lisbon, the river, Almada.
Located at one one the most traditional neighborhoods in Lisbon, the castle is a site you shouldn't miss.
Take your time and enjoy a romantic sunset.
Average castle. Still standing but uninhabited. I prefer castles with period furniture. Nice views though. It is a large castle with a traditional solid feel to it. but nothing special stands out.

The View from the top is to die for!!!. You can just FEEL the history as you walk the walls and climb the battlements. Your imagination flees to men in battle. To screams of terror and conquest. As you dissect the "science" behind the fortifications you learn how every nook & cranny was designed to thwart the attacker and advantage the defender. Then you remember that they did all of that HUNDREDS and HUNDREDS of years ago! People were so sophisticated then. Sophisticated at killing each other!DO NOT MISS THE VIEW FROM THE TOP. IT'S TO DIE FOR. And for the really adventurous. Do what my teen daughter and her 53 year old dad did. Start at the very bottom of the hill back in town. And climb all the way through the neighborhood to the top of the Castle. It'll make your day. Just make sure that you daughter does NOT wear flip flops :-)

Don't miss this!. fabulous views over Lisbon with beautiful guitar music played in the courtyard. Near the restaurant on site my husband got a 20 min. sitting massage-he said it was the best 10 euroes he spent! Don't miss the peacocks roaming the grounds.

Nice view, but that's all. Nice view, but not the most interesting castle I 've ever seen. It's better to have a walk around the streets of Alfama than waiting in a long queue and paying the entrance ticket. There are also a lot of places with nice view around Lisbon
Breathtaking views of Lisbon. The castle situated in Alfama district offers excellent views of Lisbon from the top. You can get almost 360 degrees view of Lisbon from here.
Fantastic Views. Top of hill - tram takes you to about 50 yards from entrance. Loads to see inside - panoramic views of Lisbon stunning. Peacocks roaming around making a lot of noise.

October 2012. A must visit castle, you will be able to get brilliant photos down onto the city.
The castle has a very reasonably priced restaurant.
Focal point for Lisbon. A long hike. Dinner there with a group, very good. Difficult to get there in small bus , streets very dangerous for driver.
Gorgeous!. Such a pretty place. One of the many places to go and see. Quite a walk but well worth the view when you get to the top of the steps

Overpriced must-miss castle. Take pics from afar only!. It is definitely an imposing structure that offers unparalleled views of the city. The outer structure is in near immaculate condition. But thats all that is good about it. There is nothing to see inside, no place descriptions besides the mandatory maps. There is no clear circuit to take, nothing. Just wander around the parapets for more views but thats it. It is 7.5 € for precious little. Avoid unless u love the views

Moorish or Christian??. This medieval castle, protecting and ensuring the defense of the city during the period of the Christian reconquest in the Iberian peninsula. Stunning views over the city and the river ... the top of this castle is possible to imagine life from another time
Worth the climb. Great views, nice restaurant and great excersise if you walk through the narrow, ever changing streets of the Alfama district

Awesome. The roads and staircases leading up to the castle have a lot of nice little wine bars with friendly service. The castle is reasonably impressive but the best experience we felt was to sit at the bar on the terrace with feet on the wall and take in the awesome view while enjoying a glass of Vinho Verde.
Must see in Lisbon. It takes a while and luckily for us it was not too hot. Probably the one place you have to go - with a fantastic view over the city.
Great Views over Lisbon. There's great views from the castle walls. Take a picnic and sit in the well kept grounds overlooking the city.

Beautiful views from the top!. We went to the castle at around 5pm and wow, the sun was setting, it was beautiful!! You can see the bridge, the sea area near Belem, and the picturesque houses of lisbon. Pretty! Good place for photography.Though if you visit at this hour, be sure to head to the Ulysses first as it closes at 530pm. It was so unfortunate we missed this :(Otherwise, the castle was beautiful. Definitely worth visiting.
Beautiful views. I liked both the ride to the site, which climbed up in steep, narrow streets, and the lovely vies from the top.

Expensive for nothing great. Situated on the top of Lisbon, there is nothing to see except the wall of the old castel. The price was around 8€ for the foreigner!!! The only interesting thing is the view over Lisbon, the Vasco de Gamma bridge and the "Tejo". You can walk over the wall. There is nothing inside the castel to explain you the story of the castel! Pretty expensive for just à view, and also à loss of time!
An Empty Castle. This castle has a wonderful view, but the walk is somewhat difficult and there isnt much but a view. If time is short, visit the castle in Sintra instead
Pinnacle of Lisbon. Beautifully restored, expansive views of Lisbon. A must for anyone who visits our fair city. Even the (fairly recent) purchase on entry tickets and related queues are worth it.

great wiev. great wiev over the city. but i want to warm about the tram. watch your pockets and your belongings, a woman with her two kids tried to steal a mas's wallet from his pocket but she couldn't. don't allow yourself to be surrounded by any groups of people.
Huge!. This is a big property . It was interesting but a long walk. I didn't like the difficulty in finding the bathroom. The staff at the outside bar was miserable.

A pleasant stroll at the end of the day. It was great enjoying the views on the city from the castle at the end of a sunny day. Enjoyed very much the little archeological exhibition, the guitar, and also meeting the peacocks and their beautiful colours.

Abeautiful place to reflect on Lisbon's history. Reachable by tram or by foot at the top of the old city, the alfama, the castle is a well preserved ruin dating back centuries to the Moorish occupation. There are lots of tourists there from all over the world, so don't expect to have the place to yourself. There are lots of stairways to climb and walls to follow, to give you a 360 degree view of Lisbon. Deifintely worth the time and effort to get there!

Visiting the Castle. My husband and I went to visit St. George's Castle while we were in Lisbon. Before we left the hotel we metioned how we really were not exercising while on vacation, however, that changed fairly quick. There are many sets of stairs and uphill walkways at the castle. We surely got our workout that day! If you are not prepared to do a lot of stair climbing and uphill walking, I would think the only thing you could do here is visit the museum. The views of the city are just amazing and we found the archelogical site located there quite interesting. There any dining options available, we choose to have a light lunch and some sangria at the cafe where there is both indoor and outdoor seating.Beware...there are many vendors set up around the castle....people selling jewerly, art work, chair masssages....however they did not appear too pushy to sell their items and any pandhandlers were located outside the gates of the castle. There was also an incredible number...probably at least 20....of stray cats at the castle. The amount of peacocks and birds can be a bit annoying since we sat outside and they seem to have no fear of people and like to beg.Overall, it really was a good, once in a lifetime experience. Again, the sight was incredible and beautiful as were the views. We made it a day trip and even though we only spent about 2 hours at the castle, we continued our afternoon shopping in the neighborhood outside of the castle and visiting some wine shops and a great little bistro. We were able to get some appetizers and some of the best sangria I had ever tasted.
The castle and grounds are a nice experience. Walk through the castle and enjoy the grounds with their overlooks. Learn about the history of the area.

Not worth the money. Don't waste your money on this castle. You can get some amazing views of the city by walking around. You can't get a close up of the archaeological sights as it is cordoned off, the museum is okay but very limited. Save your 7.50 Euros and spend it on something worthwhile. Very disappointed.

My Lisbon highlight. The great part about Castelo se Sao Jorge is that simply getting to it can be half the fun. Located in the steep Alfama district, the Castle requires a bit of a hike through beautiful cobbled streets. The result is a stunning viewpoint over Lisbon and one of the best ways to take it in. The Castle itself is not overly remarkable, but you do get almost free range to wander around it (including some rather precarious climbs into turrets). Again, you are here for the view. There also appeared to be a collection of peahens with their chicks, but I did not see any peacocks.
Fantastic view!. Dont lose the chance to see Lisbon from the bird's eye view, the highest viewpoint in Lisbon. The flavour of rich history and mixture of cultures.

good sight in lisbon. as I said above this is a good landmark to visit in lisbon, since it alread resides in the quaint neighborhood of Alfama. Its not very breathtaking but a good historical site, conveniently located in Lisbon. I wasnt very amused by the castle itself but the view it offers of the city below was great.

One of the best attractions in Lisbon with truly amazing views. Atop a hill in the Alfama district this is a must-visit in my humble opinion. Not only are the views of the city and Tejo river amazing but the castle itself has such interest - and the music by the 'busking' guitarist on the day we visited was just excellent. There is also an excavated area of how living quarters were in times begone, see the pics attached. Then go and have a coffee in the main cafe and chill out under the trees. The resident peacocks are so beautiful and tame. The restaurant there is a bit pricey though, even if the views are fabulous (main courses are circa 25 euros minimum) - sit outside if the weather permits and see the city below.A really great day out for both young and old.

Nice place to walk around. It is a nice place to walk around, beautiful views of Lisbon. There are many trees, so you can easily find some shady place if the sun is burning. We also liked walking from old town to the castle, there are nice little narrow streets and stairs around castle area.

Gorgeous views. Stunning views across the city from this stunning viewpoint. Make sure you also go to the viewpoint down the street from the entrance to the castle, which has excellent views across the river.

and the city opens up as if born from its name…. This is a line from Sophia de Mello’s poem (I’d say, ode to Lisbon), which is carved on a big stone in the Castle terraced square. The poet was right, there’s no better place to enjoy the panorama of Lisbon. Fantastic views, the best, better than from Cristo Rei! When you climb all the towers and walk through all galleries you see that it was a really fortified citadel with barbicans and narrow loopholes, used probably to pour tar or something on the enemies. Now the castle looks totally peaceful; a lot of peacocks feel at home there. There’s a lovely café close to the Romantic Garden with snacks, fruit and chocolates, as you sit at a table outside, beautiful birds walk around.

awesome views. we spent hours here! It was hard to find as I think we got off at wrong trolley stop but worth the hunt; took tons of pictures of castle and scenery; did this on Day One and then had Fado dinner at a nearby restaurant

Lisbon with kids. Kids will like it! There is space to run in this old fortress. The viewpoints are cool, but you have to watch the kids near the walls. Inside the castle, watch the kids when they go up on the walls of the Castle, because there is no protection grid.
Nice views. Enjoyed the views from the castle. Look out for the peacocks. :) A pleasant way to spend a couple of hours in Lisbon.

The castle. Really insteresting castle, much restored, but therefore easier to walk round the battlements. The camera obscura in the Ulysses tower (in English) was worth seeing, but we found the archaeological museum dull.

Spectacular views. A really impressive old castle on a hill with spectacular
views over Lisbon. The museum is of interest as is the
archeological digs currently underway.

Nice excursion. Nice view and nice area for a meal or a drink. It is a steep walk up the hill so dont choose a hot day. Beware of all the vendors selling junk outside of the castello, they can be a bit rude.

Lot for little. Average experience at best. Perhaps, if we had gone when there was stuff happening, it would have been better. The view and the historical significance was spectacular. Not much to write home about.

Not to be missed. The streets within the Castle Walls are full of fastinating houses and shops. The castle terrace has fabulous views over the whole of central Lisbon. We went there on our first afternoon and it helped us to get our bearings as to where everything is in Lisbon. The ramparts are fun to walk around and give even more veiws. It is excellent value for about 7 Euros.

Great views. Catch the 737 bus up to the castle. It drops you straight at the gate. A bumpy ride.I'd recommend sunset for a visit if you enjoy photography. Or take a tripod for later visits. Some excellent views over Lisbon.
A must see in Lisbon. Beautiful old castle. You can see the whole town from the most highest spot in Lisbon.Take a tram 28 to get there.

Best views in the city. Great place, though we decided to walk and only reached the place after lots of trial and error (no joke going up those hills). Great views and the camera obscura in the Tower of Ulysses is a real treat, with amazing real time high quality 360 degrees views over the city. Not to be missed.

Great for the views. After touring other Castles this one was just ok for the money, however the views of Lisbon are worth a visit. The walls are extremely high with not much railing so be cautious if you take Children. I'd be a little nervous if my 7 year old was with me. It's very old and part are crumbling so just be careful. Make sure you bring a good camera though. I also would advise planning this visit at sunset because it will give you a great view of the sun setting over lisbon and into the ocean. I would have stayed but there wasn't much to do to kill alot of time to make it worth staying so long.

An interesting 'must see' in Lisbon. Definately worth a visit when you are in Lisbon. Lots of history with several museum type buildings and fabulous views over Lisbon in every direction. Has Cafe's and a restaurant if you want to make a day of it. Quite a climb up the streets to get there if you're on foot, but worth the effort.
Cool Castle!!. We enjoyed walking around the castle very much!! In addition the view of Lisbon from the Castle is excellent!! A great place to take photos!!

See the Vintage Trade Capital from the Top. Lisbon is a lovely city and of course, there is nothing better than viewing it from the hill top. Even if you're on budget and are not a museum person, you can get spectacular views at major lookouts around the castle which are free. The fee is only if you enter several areas inside the castle. There are plenty of places available for you outside the castle boundaries.TIP: carry drinking water if you're walking. Its a long way :)SAVING TIP: Transport is very cheap in Lisbon, I bought a 48 hours unlimited travel pass and it cost me only 8.4 euros. If you can, go for it and enjoy all the rides in the city and see all the places, even if you're on short schedule.

Castle Ruins...seen one, seen them all. It was nice to see the castle since it has been in the background all around us as we visit this area and there are beautiful views. However, there are beautiful views from several places in the city so if you are pressed for time, I would skip it --unless of course you are a history or castle buff. We took the 28 trolley to and from the castle. Nice day outside in Lisbon's glorious weather.

History & exploration.. Nice walk from the city centre to the castle. I enjoyed exploring the castle grounds, reading a bit about its history, and imagining what it was like in earlier centuries. I was also lucky enough to happen upon a peacock and 2 peahens, which I found out are from the garden(s) in the back of the castle, wandering on the grounds not too far from the garden(s). Really nice view of Lisbon from the castle also. I was with a group and, as a result, didn't stay as long as I wanted to, but I enjoyed what I saw.If you're into history & architecture, this is a good place to go.

Cool castle in the city. This was an interesting historical site. We did a walking tour and our guide walked us around. I recommend having a guide as it made it more interesting. You will need to walk up a hill to see this but it's worth it. There was also a pastry shop on the way up.
One of the best viewing points. Not difficult to find or get to, but you may need to stop in a bar on the way up! The view from Sao Jorge is breath-taking.
Worth the hike. Best view of Lisbon, lots of things to see on the way up to the castle and the grounds are really beautiful. Museums and restaurants on castle grounds. Peacocks roam free!
Good for an afternoon stroll. Nice place for an easy walk after lunch .. climb the castle walls on the steep and narrow stairs, you will get a good panoramic view over the city.
Nice views but castle just ok. You can get some lovely views from St Georges castle but the castle it self is not all that and not much to see. Glad to see some warning signs about slippery surface.

Average as far as castle's go. The castle itself is kind of a so-so site. It's neat to look at but, you can get bored quickly. However, the castle has terrific views of Lisbon and would be well worth a visit for that point alone. Overall, I am glad I visited the castle, it doesn't merit a second visit though.

Second visit to this attraction. This was a much busier visit than when we previously visited in November. My friend wanted to see the Castle and we did have the opportunity to visit the Museum and the castle grounds with superb views over the city. The archaelogical site was a disappointment because we had to climb up the walls of the castle, with notices saying danger of falling, but then the way out on the pathway was blocked by gates and we had to climb back up the same walls to go down. It would have been helpful to have a sign at the bottom telling people that they would have to undertake a climb to come back as well. The maps show a pathway leading away from the site. This did rather spoil our visit to a beautiful place.

Views of Lisbon. This is an old castle not far removed from the port area that provides stunning and spectacular views of this grand and elegant city. Make sure to give a Euro to the gentleman who plays music and takes of the numerous cats on the grounds. If you are a pet lover, it is imperative and more than that, it will make you feel good.
Lovely views. Museum was a bit disappointing but the area and views were beautiful. Entrance fee was €7.50 which didn't seem too bad. Would rec it.

Beautiful place, must see. From the peacocks to the classical guitarist playing in the castle square, it's something you shouldn't miss. The trip there on the 28 tram is also part of the fun. And the views from the parapet are breathtaking.
Don't miss this!. Don't miss this incredible site! Go there on your first day as it gives you perspective of the whole city!! The views are incredible and the self guided tour is perfect!

Good for resting & for viewing. Despite having to climb around quite a lot, the castle really is worth seeing. It is a bit pricey (Eur 7.50) but it does offer exceptional views of the city from a very good height, as well as some amazingly fresh breeze after climbing all the way around Alfama's tiny streets.
Get a good view of the city. If you want to get a good view of the city, this is one of the best places. If you want you can take tram 28 almost all the way to the top.

Nice but expensive. This is a nice and quiet place in an hectic city. The views are spectacular indeed. But, entrance is rather expensive (€ 7.50) and the castle itself is not so special - just a military fortress.For those you only fancy the view, you can save yourself € 7.50 if you climb the stairs, just after the first gate and before the ticket office. The view is the same as in the castle, and .. free.Another tip. If you want to avoid the steep climb, there is a bus (nr 237) that runs from the figueras square (just in front of the metro exit). It will take you to the castle is less than 10'.
See the whole city. And learn about the history of this great placeClimbing up the hill is quite easy and worth the effort, many things took place in this castle which had many owners...don't miss
Great views. Great views over the city. The part of the village outside of the castle walls is also very authentic and worth a walk.

Over the hills and .... Great view over the city and to the river. It was a hot day, but there are a lot of trees and therefore very dense, life-saving shadows. It was great to see the museum and to walk on the walls of the castle. There is also a map of the view with descriptions of the main places, painted on a glazed tiles. Nice to visit.

A good view. The exhibition area was somewhat limited and the exhibits difficult to read about in the first area. The castle gives magnificent views over the city and the trip is worth making for this alone.There is an ongoing archeological dig, but no activity at the time of our visit. It would be interesting to see and hear the work in progress, but overall the castle does not offer much

Castelo de Sao Jorge. Lovely castle with a really nice view over Lisbon. It is nice to see some history of Lisbon. Entrance is not free, however if you have a Lisbon Card you can visit the castle for free. The castle is easy to reach by bus or with the tram 28. However, if you go by tram there is a pretty steep climb up the hill. The only thing we missed was some information about the castle itself and the history of it.

Nice views. The castle looks great from the city. If you are inside, it provides you several good views, a cafe, and a long walk along the walls and up and down the towers. Again, good views on the city and the river, but nothing more.

Great place to gaze and chill out. Despite the crowds, the Castello de Sao Jorge is spread out enough that it is actually a great place to relax. High above the city, you get a real sense of how hilly Lisbon actually is and how varied. As well as the views, there are also nice walks along the ramparts.If there hadn't have been so much else to do in the city below, I would happily have stayed all afternoon ...
A must see. The castle sits on Lisbon's highest hill. It is a must see in Lisbon. It is partially restored ad the view from the castle of Lisbon is beautiful.
History. It is relaxing to walk around and view Lisbon from there, sit down and dive into the history of the area.

Point to see whole Lisbon. The castle is really great. It looks like not very old (very renewed although it was founded at 11-en century) but it is interesting to walk by its walls and halls. Also you can find a nice view on Lisbon from its towers.

Nice place!. Not the best place in Lisbon, but well worth. Well placed, you can walk the stairs, nice to see the streets till there. Great views of Lisbon. As for me, more interesting was walking through the streets of Alfama till the Se de Lisboa( Cathedral of Santa Maria Maior de Lisboa.
Great views. You get some great views of Lisbon and can also enjoy plenty of shade or have a drink or bite to the eat in the cafe.
Impressive moorish castle. Highly recommended. There are free guided tours that explain the castle's history in detail in English and Spanish. Not to be missed!

Steep climb but worth it. A steep climb up but well worth it. Did it on our first day which gave us a good perspective of the City of Lisbon. Interesting Archaelogical site too. Fun clambering around the walls . Camera Obscurer disappointing.

Great place to see the sun set over Lisbon. Take a bottle of wine and a couple of glasses and head up there before sun set, beautiful place to watch he sun go down. Then head ðown the hill on foot and pick a little restaurant on the way down.
Lovely spot for views and respite. I enjoyed this more for the environment than the history, lovely spot, worth the visit and the walk, great views.
Excellent views. Wonderful views from the castle, well worth the visit. Lots of fantastic opportunities to take stunning photos. Look out for the beautiful Peacocks!

A wonderful view of the city.. The historic value and the sight were well worth the trip. The ruins are well preserved. The castle was a beautiful example of the forifications needed to defend the city from all the many groups of people that tried to conquer this piece of Portugal territory. we took a tram to the top of the mountain and then walked down.
Castle. Great views of the city, interesting ruins to walk around and very near to cafes & bars on the way up & down.
A lovely day out. Beautiful views, it was lovely to walk about in such a nice place. Would be better if it had been free. I'm not sure that it was worth the money.

Beautiful Views. On top of the highest hill in Lisbon sits St. George’s Castle. The area is called the Alfama. The castle started out as a 5th century Visigothic fort. Then the Moors came and built the castle. In 1147 Dom Afonso Henriques expelled the Moors and the kings or Portugal lived here until the 16th century. A lot of the castle was destroyed during the great earthquake of 1755. Now the castle is one of the tourist favorites because it has the best views of the city. We took a taxi to the top of the hill, and later took a minibus down. It is too difficult to do this trip on foot, unless you are very young and have the energy to do it. The rides up and down are quite scary, especially since they go at fast speeds in such narrow streets.

Just another castle.... The inside is full of restaurants and shops selling the usual stuff for twice the price you can find it in less "tourist-infested" areas. The walls are crumbling - but then it's a fairly old place, :) so no surprises here. The views are stunning - but paying 7 euro per person admission fee to just walk the castle walls is ridiculous. There are several observation points ("Miradouro" in Portuguese) in other areas of the city, they are free. Use them.

worst visit!. this place is absolutely not worth the visit... its expensive to go inside unless you have the lisboa card and frankly speaking i expected much more than walls and empty courtyards in a castle. there was nothing to see apart from the good view of the river

A must see!. Take tram 28 and enjoy the large castle with great views from its towers & an interesting camera obscura. Demonstrations from 2pm. Architectural site also open at 2pm. Stroll back down via the cathedral and Alfama

Well worth the climb. It was a very hot day (30 C) when we walked all the way up the winding narrow streets to reach the castle, but it was worth the effort. A most interesting fortress encompassing several periods of history, so worth visiting in its own right, and in addition it commands superb views over the city and the river. You can wander to your heart's content along the top of the battlements, or pop in to a small museum of some of the artefacts unearthed during archaeological excavations. There is a small café which offers a good choice of hot and cold food (but very slow counter service) and outdoor tables, also a 'proper' restaurant which we didn't sample. Many peacocks roam freely, and several had chicks of varying sizes.Rather limited provision of toilet facilities - and my wife told me that the door locks on the cubicles in the women's area were all broken.

Cool castle but a little expensive. Not worth the price but lovely to walk around and take photos. It was 7.50E per head which was a lil steep and not as spectacular as the castle walks in Obidos or Sintra

Great for sunset!. We went to the Castle about an hour before sunset. There was plenty of time to wander the area both before and after sunset. It is a good place to go early in your visit to Lisbon. You can get an orientation to the city from the ramparts. Take the 737 bus instead of the trolley.

Stunning!. This castle is viewable from Lisbon and sit on a mountain top. We took a cab up and down...the hills are killers. The veiws from Sao Jorge are incredible. very nice restaureant at the castle too!
History and Views. Well worth the climb, this castle offered some wonderful views and was very atmospheric. Reasonable price to get in and the cafe inside wass good value.

Great views. This castle is ideally located to get some stunning views across Lisbon.The castle itself is beautiful and well worth going in to really get a feel for the period it was built. A little museum is worth spending some time in with some interactive screens explaining more about the history of the castle.Brilliant

Worth the Visit. The castle is worth the cost. The view of the city and river is beautiful and the artifacts in the musuem were interesting. The steps are steep and narrow, but hand rails are available.

Hope you like Heights!. Great way to spend an afternoon. You get great views of Lisbon. Its worth climbing the stairs to walk around the castle. A bit scary if you are afraid of heights. There are some good local restaurants within walking distance. Recommend taking the local trolly or buses to get there.

Great energy!. Take a small picnic snack and sit at the edge of the ancient wall and look out over all of LISBOA and the gorgeous azul color of the bay. Snack, bask in the sunshine and take in the special feel of these ancient walls.
Fun Vertigo Challenge. We loved climbing around the castle and the tremendous views of the city. It's up to you how much you want to challenge your vertigo limit. The view was worth the climb.
Stop here with tram 28. Stop here after taken tram 28 and admire the great overview of Lisbonm and the beautiful castle. You can eat here at night. A bit expensive but the view...
An interesting experience. This was a worthwhile trip into history. It was fun and informative walking along the walls and climbing the towers. The views were particulalry attractive.
walls with a view. Well worth a visit. Well cared for monmument with wonderful views over the city. There is also an interesting archaelogical site there. Very helpful security guards.
Great view. As far as old forts go, and I typically find the boring, this was one of the best. Great views, great castle to explore, and it dumps you out right to a great neighborhood to explore.

Well Worth it. Take in the panoramic views of Lisbon from the castle. Enjoy a well earned coffee in the good coffee shop in the castle (good because it is more expensive than the rest of Lisbon) - trip would have been incomplete without a visit to this castle.
Fantastic views. Well worth visiting for the views across the city - by far the best bit. The archaeological area was not worth the climb up the walls to get across to see it though!

Retreat on a hot day. We found the castle a retreat from the hustle and bustle on a very warm day. It is not cheap at (7,50 Euro) but the grounds are extensive, the castle is nice and the views are fantastic. For the die-hards there are archeological digs which you can have a look at, but I thought it was too warm for that.If you don’t like walking up the hill, take a taxi (we paid 6 Euro) or bus 737 from Figueira. The tram is really too busy, and will only spare you half the climb.

Great views. The castle itself has nothing really inside the
Point of the visit is to walk around the outside and take in the views. There is a self service cafe inside which offers good value food. Worth a visit but not a lot to ser

Nice place, but not necessarily a must see. We had fun around the castle grounds, the view from the walls is scenic and all around there are cute streets filled with shops and eating places. However, if we would have known beforehand, we probably would not have entered the castle just to see the bare walls of the old structure and the gift shop.
Nice, but forgettable experience.

Good, but not the best of Lisbon. It's impressive, but other areas of Lisbon and Belem are better. Although the history is interesting, the site isn't great - I had more fun walking up the Tram 28 line and visiting all the sites on the way to the castle, then the castle itself. The food is ok at the site (one cafe, one overpriced restaurant) but off the beaten path you'll find a couple of nice cafes.
Great views. Tricky to get there and long lines to get a ticket, but the views were excellent of the city. Nice excursion with great little restaurants (tiny) tucked into the surrounding streets.
don't miss it. Visited here at sunset. Beautiful views over Lisbon and the castle itself is very impressive. Well worth the walk up through the character filled streets

Great views over the city. There really isn't that much to see inside the castle. It is pretty much an empty shell. However, as you go around to the top of the castle you get a magnificent view of Lisbon from every side.

Amazing views. Fantastic views of the city and a lovely place to sit and stroll and take in the surroundings. We also found the museum interesting. We walked up through the Alfama area and did not find it too much of struggle up the hill - although anyone suffering from walking difficulties could find it a challenge. The ticket office is located slightly away from the entrance to the castle so remember to vist their first to purchase a ticket.

Beautiful views & fun to explore. It was just beautiful to wander around this beautiful castle. The vistas were really nice of the water and bridge. There are colorful peacocks of different colors wandering around also. It was relaxing to hike all around the castle. Bring good walking shoes as some of the stones can be slippery and there are lots of steps. It is great exercise climbing up the hill to get to the castle and also all around the castle. We took some very beautiful pictures with lots of greenery.
great. a bit tough to get up to in the heat of August but when you get there well worth it with a fantastic view over downtown and the tagus river.
Beautiful. breathtaking views at every turn. Lots of steep steps so wear comfortable shoes. Enjoyed the strains of a live fado tune whilst wandering around
Awesome views. Easy access by bus, the view is great from here and so much fun going up the walls and towers... A definite must-see!

Crusader castle, royal palace, Moorish kasbah. Spend time investigating this amazing historical site that includes Iron Age remnants, Moorish houses from the old kasbah (Alcocava in Portuguese), the impressive medieval castle and what remains of a later royal palace. It's Lisbon's answer to the Tower of London!
Best place for Lisbon photos. A must visit in Lisbon. Affords some of the best photos you will get of the city and the sea while you're visiting.

Worth the walk. The castle is situated on top of a hill, so you might need to walk quite a significant distance. There are buses that go here if you do not want to hike though. It is quite scenic when you get to the castle itself. You'd get a good panoramic view of lisbon when you get there. There are loads of restaurants on the way there, but they are on the pricier side. Well with their views, some of them are worth it. There is a restaurant inside the castle as well, but it requires a reservation.
The top of lisbo. This is the best place to get a panaromic view of Lisbon. The view is breathtaking and perfect for pictures. You can take tram 28 to the top then walk a little or take a cab.

Beautifully preserved, peaceful, amazing views. Grab a Tram 28 and get off at the Miradouro de Santa luzia (killing 2 birds with 1 stone). After taking in the view cross the road and take the road up the hill which will take you to the castle entrance. Get there early (10.30?) and there's no queue. Enjoy the views, the peacocks, the guitarist, and climb the towers and walk the battlements. Top tip: don't take a stroller - lots of parents were struggling with these!

A Gorgeous Fortress with Gorgeous Lisbon Views. Please do not miss St George's Castle even if you have only one day in Lisbon. Firstly, the Alfama neighborhood in which The Castle is located is quaint and adorable - lovely for picture taking and walking the cute little side streets.Secondly, the view of Lisbon is jaw dropping! From Belen to Chiado to the Uptown - the views are all yours at just this one visit.
Great for the view over Lisbon. Great view from here over the whole of lisbon city. Lots of information for the kids to learn. You need to be fairly mobile to make the most of your visit.
Wonderful views. This is a place for great views of the city and getting a feel of the old fortress. The museum is not particularly good and does not add much to the visit.

Great View but that's about it. View was great but once inside there's not much to do but walk around the topside. I looked at the peacocks and cats for awhile as I love animals only spent about 40 minutes inside of castle, rest of time was spent walking around the little streets and areas outside of castle

nice day out. during my visit I didn't actually go inside any of the museums. mainly good for a walk around and check the stunning views!!
restaurant was way too expensive and the cafe was disappointing.....

Whatever else you do, this is the view of Lisbon you should not miss. Don’t even think about walking up to the castle, but take a taxi, they are inexpensive. The castle is beautifully preserved, and will give you an unparallel view out over Lisbon. Whatever reason you visit, for a day on a cruise, or for a longer holiday, put this somewhere near the top of your list, this is where you will see the true beauty of Lisbon laid out before you.

Don't expect an "inside", but what a view!. I was expecting, you know, a building of some kind. I was a little stunned to see that it was more of a "castle complex", with the original outer walls, gardens, and the ruins of the castle walls with steps to tour the upper ramparts. It was very cool, but like lots of people have said-- the views are what make this place amazing.I think it is a must-see in Lisbon! It is very difficult to find, hidden away on the streets of Alfama. (How can a big castle be hidden?? You'll see.) I would have a good map ready, and be prepared to ask any locals to point you in the right direction if you need to.Because it is a loooong walk uphill from Baixa (downtown), I recommend taking the 28 tram up from the center of town to Graça church, have a cold drink and a look at the lovely cafe/miradouro there, then walk DOWNhill to get to the castle. In the Portuguese heat, downhill can be a heck of a lot easier.

Great for viewpoint, but that is all. Compared to Sintra's Moorish castle and Pena palace, this castle is average. Nothing special castle but with beautiful viewpoint. Taking in account that only special thing is viewpoint, then it is overpriced because Lisbon has so many viewpoints which are free of charge or less expensive.You should visit it, but do not expect too much. If you have limited time, rather go to Cristo rei and enjoy.
Fantastic Views. Seen one castle seen another. What makes this one worthwhile agreed the city and ocean views of Lisbon. It is a hike up to it and seeing the vantage points takes some effort.

Great Castle, Amazing Views. Finding the castle is a bit of a challenge, but great once you find your way in! We decided to walk to the castle which was an interesting choice, but we found it! Incredible views of Lisbon, great castle ruins to wander around. Lines can be VERY long in the afternoon. We hit this site in the morning and had no line at all!

Great views and relaxing visit. Take the old tram up through the Alfama and enjoy the views on this historic tram. Once you get up to the castle it is an easy visit for all ages (although there are quite a bit of stairs to walk along the ramparts). You get great views of Lisbon from all around the castle and I would highly recommend it for these views. One could easily picnic in the greener areas of the castle as well!
difficult to find the entrance. didn't bother to go in, queue and entry fee, seen the views as walked up. Tried a buggy thing to get down, fun way to travel
Break from the bustle of the city. This was a good place to step into the past and see the views. It was also an active archaeological site. The opportunity to walk around was great.
lovely castle. fantastic views of the city and impressed with how castle like it was!!! only downside was the climb to get there.

User Friendly and Great Views. You need to be able to handle steps and slopes but the walk up and views from the castle over the old part of Lisboa, over the Tigres and towards the bridge are wort while
Get off on Stop 8 of the Green Hop-on-hop off Bus
A Great experience even for my 6 year old Daughter

Great views. Worth taking the tram up the hill for a visit, the best views of the city are from here. It is well maintained and there are lots of places to sit and admire the scenery. Peacocks and their chicks stroll around!

Impressive castel with a great view of the city... Beautiful castle.. We walked up at the end of day so got a great view of the Lisbon. Apparently they have evening shows too, which we didn't partake in this time.. Lovely walk down though thru the fado-replete neighborhoods below the castle!Only caveat is that it is tough to arrange a sunset cocktail though as the bar closes early.. :)

Pales in comparison to Castello des Mouros in Sintra. Yes wonderful views and if you have no time to get to Sintra you will likely enjoy this view and visit. Long walk up hill to get there but lots of shops and cares to stop in at along the way.
Travel back in time. A most magnicificent monument in Lisbon; a true treasure. You tour it self-guided as the descriptive signs are in Portugese and English. A must-see on any visit to Lisbon.
Amazing view. Nice place With amazing view but need to walk for ling time to reach to the castle and u need to bring some food with you
A Million Dollar View. This visit was worth the climb. The view is amazing. Make sure you put this on top of your list of things to do in Lisbon.

Do see the camera obscura. We loved wandering around the castle, and the great views of Lisbon. The highlight for us was the 20-minute 'tour' of Lisbon in the camera obscura, or periscope, room, which is free to all castle visitors. Check the times of the English language session. It was a great introduction to the city.
Well kept, interesting and great views.. Well kept, interesting and great views are the main selling points. You can walk up and down the tower and walk on the along the high paths.

Lovely - if a bit scary!. After a nice walk up the hill there was a bit of a queue to get tickets for the castle, and once into the grounds the views over the surrounding area were fantastic! When climbing up into the castle itself, it is great that full access is allowed, however i have to say some bits were a bit scary due to the narrow paths and steep falls at some points - i found myself hugging a wall at one very narrow point up on the walls and was quite glad to get back down to ground level. The staff in the cafe could be more customer focussed. The afternoon we visited customers seemed to be getting in the way of their conversations, but all in all iot was a very interesting place to visit.

Nice view, a great walk down. We took the tram up, which was a great idea. Then walked down, as the guide book suggested. However, watch out on the trams, as my husband was pickpocketed on one of the crowded trams in another part of the city. Keep all money and valuables under your clothing. We only lost about 5 Euros, because that's all we keep in our pockets in big cities.
Best view of the city. Prices have gone up (now 7.50 euro) but still worth it. Lovely sunny and shady spots around the castle walls to view the fabulous city.

Worth the climb!. This castle should be top of the to-do list in Lisbon. It is well presented and the views from the ramparts are amazing. Entrance fee was good value and the visit was made extra special by some live music from a Portuguese guitarist. Unless you take a tram it is a long climb up from the main town but the trip back down allowed us to see a little of the real Lisbon in the tightly packed, narrow streets of Alfama.

Highly Overrated -- just a bunch of Courtyards. The only good thing I can say is the views are good, but other than that, the place is a rip-off. All you see are courtyards, you go through one, through a opening in the wall and into -- another courtyard. Just grass, no gardens (on the interior I'm talking about ). And you can climb the skinny staircases to get another view. But the only place people actually lived were in the gift-store, which obviously doesn't show much, other than souvenirs. I had expected a castle would at least have a few rooms decorated in period furniture & artwork, etc. You won't get it here.
Beautiful surroundings.. Just a walk in the narrow little streets around the fortress is enough to get you into the mood. Don't miss it!

Must see in Lisbon. we rented a place very close to the castle.You can see it from other hills in Lisbon.We spend half a day walking around the castle and inside.Lot of walking to do but worth every minute.You can also stop at the restaurant if you are getting tired.You have a splendid view of the city,you can admire the peacocks,also there is a museum,so make sure you check that out as well.It's just a magical place.

Return to Catelo de Sao Jorge!. Take Tram 28 to the top of one of Lisbon's hills. The ride is beautiful as you pass through many quaint artisian's shops. The Castelo is rich with history. Walking is along cobblestones - no high heels! If you're interested in climbing the stairs and stair rails are not for the faint at heart but certainly worth the careful climb! They are currently excavating more of the Castelo and neat to see. You'll see roaming peacocks and they had just had little ones. Very neat!
A very old place ( XII century or before). Well, it`just a castle with a few facilities in it. Nothing very impressive, except the view to Lisbon old town and the river...

A must in Lisbon. Fantastic view of the ocean and rest of the city. Great historic site. Even the trip up there is worth it through the charming, small streets of Lisbon. Don't leave Lisbon without a visit to this castle.

Nice views, not a ton else. Very pretty views over Lisbon, which is why you go here. You can walk the castle walls, but you really just do that for the views. Go at sunset to get soft lighting and fewer crowds.
Excellent views. Tram ride to the top was great and the views magnificient

Fantastic Viewpoint. Take the 28 tram or, as we did, an hours walk upto the castle.. Allow at least 2 hours for the visit and be there early to miss the crowds. Lovely gardens and great views over the city.

Sao Jorge. Only the bview of the town is worth the money ,there are other castles in Portugal which are over S Jorge castle, and you will benefit of the use of tram 28 to go there.Use a taxi (is very cheap),but do not try to go by foot there (exception of youn people;it is a very steepy hill to climb)

great views. get the tram up and enjoy the view from the castle. Cost about 7 euros to get in if i remember correctly. If you fancy a special meal, the restaurant looks lovely, although booking is essentail. Get a seat outdoors and enjoy a night time view over the city.

History with a great view. Steep climb up the hill! We took a cab up to the castle(10 euros) and walked back down. Admission is 7.50 Euro. It took an hour to wander through the grounds. The views are lovely! Lots of shops and restaurants in the area.

Worth the hike up to the top to see the views.. Not as impressive as the Sintra palaces, but the views are amazing and it was very cool to be up there and walk around. Not too expensive nor does it take a lot of time.

Stunning views across Lisbon. An absolute must for any visitor to Lisbon. Great views & plenty of space to explore. We enjoyed some drinks in the restaurant & looked out across the city. Definitely worth the money & a lovely way to spend a sunny afternoon
Impressive. Views as far as you can see! A must see site. Get the bus up but walk down to visit the cathedral.

Worth a visit if you are in Lisbon. The Castle was a lovely surprise actually - it has great views and photo opportunites are varied with the buildings, the view and the garden areas. It is a steep walk up to the castle so make sure your footwear doesnt hold you back! def worth the 7.5 euros.
Less about the castle, and more about the views. The views of the city are spectacular from the Castelo de Sao Jorge and worth the entrance fee.
Interesting to visit. It takes a while to reach the castle by foot but it is definitely worth it! The view is spectacular.
Amazing views. Although there are much richer castles in Europe and also castles with a much greater histroy, this place offers a nice overview of Lisbon below.

Very interesting fortress on top of a hill with a great view.. I loved the views of the city and my daughter took a lot of pictures.
The architecture is old and very interesting.
The stone with which it is constructed has a nice color.

Takes your breath away. I'd recommend this as one of the first places to visit in Lisbon. The views make you stop talking - right there before you is centuries of history and civilisation all laid out in rooftops and washing lines and endless human stories. And then you get to the battlements,. Wow they are cool. Take your children by the hand (firmly - health and safety has yet to kill all the good fun in Portugal) and pretend you are knights defending the honour of Lisbon and you can have hours of fun. Our family did, and we will go back there. The whole thing is done superbly - very casual and unrestrictive so you can climb the stairs and touch the rock without some guy in a peaked cap whistling at you. Watch out for the pickpocket on the way up the hill though. Fagan's descendants now operate in the guise of pretty blonde girls who are adept at taking wallets and anything else they can find.
Quite overrated. The best part of the castle accordinG to my opinion was the view. Inside the castle there was nothing but walls. It's very good preserved.
BEAUTIFUL!. visiting the castle is an absolute must if you wish to see spectacular panoramic views of Lisbon!
worth the walk. amazing picture oppourtunities, quiet even in high summer
excellent view. love the view from the top of the castle. wear comfortable/sport shoes if you wanna go up and down the narrow and steep road..

1st place to go in Lisbon. St. George's Castle is the 1st place to go in Lisbon: the best views (almost all the city sights, the best neighborhood - Alfama) and a very nice museum. To get there, take the subway to Terreiro do Paço station and leave at Praça do Comércio exit, take a walk around the place and walk trough Alfama's streets to reach the Castle. Have a good trip!
stunning view on the city. there nothing much to see of the castle but still worth for the view over the city
Fantastic view. The best view over the city. The most important place to visit while in town.
great views on Lisbon. The view on Lisbon is amazing. The castle itself however wasn't that impressive.
Old times now. The price of the ticket is too high for what it offers. 5 € would do the trick. Apart from that, one has an explendid view of Lisbon.

Stunning city vistas. Bring your walking shoes and your camera. This castle is lovely. It might have less of a Wow Factor than what you will see in Sintra, but the advantage is that it's so accessible to downtown Lisbon and not a 40 minute train ride away. Highly recommended!
Spectacular views. The castle offers breathtaking views of Lisbon and an interesting glimpse into Lisbon's history. The walk along the walls is a must.
Great Views. You can get amazing views of Lisbon from here. We wandered around the castle, which is mainly ruins, but found it to be very interesting.

just a castle. what is left feom the castle is thw surrounding walls which you can see from any spot of lisbon and is more imposing. The view is the same than from the miradouro so it is a waste of time visiting it and has expensive entrance

Adored this Castle. I've been to many castles throughout Scotland and Spain, and I must say that this is one of my favourites. The view when you enter the main courtyard is absolutely spectacular. The parading peacocks on the grounds that were giving us a beautiful display of their feathers just added that much more to the experience. It is quite a hike to get to the castle from R. Augusta, but it was well worth it, and you can always take the tram to cut off most of the uphill climb.
Interesting tour.... Go on the English tour. Our guide was excellent and so interesting!

Great for views, castle is pretty cool too. Great to do on the first day you arrive.
